title: Mama's Spaghetti Sauce with Meatballs
description: This fantastic recipe for spaghetti sauce and meatballs has been a family favorite for many years, passed down from my mother.
instructions: Get a big bowl and put in the ground beef, bread crumbs, parsley, Parmesan cheese, the ¼ teaspoon of black pepper, garlic powder, and the beaten egg. Mix everything well, then shape the mixture into 12 balls. Cover them up and keep them in the fridge until you need them.

Warm up a big saucepan over medium heat. Cook the onion and garlic in the olive oil until the onion looks clear. Stir in the tomatoes, salt, sugar, and bay leaf. Put a lid on it, turn the heat down low, and let it simmer for 90 minutes. After that, stir in the tomato paste, basil, the ½ teaspoon of pepper, and the meatballs. Let it simmer for another 30 minutes. Then, it's ready to serve.
author: Jeremy

title: Easy Black Bean Burgers from Scratch
description: Once you make these simple veggie burgers, you won't ever go back to store-bought. You'll be happy with how good this vegetarian meal is.
ingredients: Black beans: 1 can (16 ounce), drained and rinsed
Green bell pepper: 1/2, cut into 2-inch pieces
Thai chili sauce or hot sauce: 1 teaspoon
instructions: For grilling, get your outdoor grill hot on high heat and put a little oil on aluminum foil. If you're baking, heat your oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and lightly oil a baking sheet.
Take a medium bowl and use a fork to mash the black beans until they're thick and pasty.
Chop the bell pepper, onion, and garlic very fine in a food processor. Then, stir these chopped items into the mashed beans.
In a small bowl, mix the egg, chili powder, cumin, and chili sauce together.
Add the egg mixture to the mashed beans and stir it in. Put in the bread crumbs until the mix is sticky and stays together. Make four patties from the mixture.
When grilling, put the patties on the foil and cook them about 8 minutes on each side. If baking, place the patties on the baking sheet and bake them for about 10 minutes on each side.
author: LAURENMU

title: George's Beef and Bean Chili
description: This chili recipe is simple to make and tastes great. You can cook it on the stove or use a slow cooker.
ingredients: Kidney beans, drained and rinsed: 1 (15 oz) can
Pinto beans, drained and rinsed: 1 (15 oz) can
instructions: Put the ground beef into a big, deep skillet. Cook it on medium-high heat until it's all brown. Drain off any fat, then break up the meat into crumbles.

Get a large pot and put it on high heat. Add the cooked ground beef, tomato juice, tomato sauce, kidney beans, pinto beans, onions, bell pepper, cayenne pepper, sugar, oregano, ground black pepper, salt, cumin, and chili powder. Bring everything to a boil, then turn the heat down to low. Let it cook gently for 1 and a half hours. (If you're using a slow cooker, just put all the ingredients inside, set it to low, and cook for 8 to 10 hours.)
author: Allrecipes Member

title: Hearty Tortellini Soup with Italian Sausage
description: This soup brings together classic Italian flavors like sausage, garlic, and tomatoes. Enjoy it with some warm bread and a side salad for a satisfying meal. A sprinkle of Parmesan cheese on top makes it even better.
ingredients: Sweet Italian sausage, casings off: 1 pound
Large tomatoes, peeled, seeded, and chopped: 4
Fresh basil leaves, packed: ½ tablespoon
instructions: Brown the sausage in a 5-quart Dutch oven. Take out the sausage and drain it, keeping 1 tablespoon of the fat in the pot.

Cook the onions and garlic in the leftover drippings. Add in the beef broth, water, wine, tomatoes, carrots, basil, oregano, tomato sauce, and the sausage. Let it come to a boil. Turn down the heat and let it gently cook without a lid for 30 minutes.

Remove any fat from the top of the soup. Stir in the zucchini and parsley. Cover the pot and let it cook for another 30 minutes. Put the tortellini in during the last 10 minutes of cooking. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese on each serving before you eat.
author: Mary P

title: Flavorful Thai Coconut Shrimp Soup
description: This soup is packed with amazing Thai tastes that you'll love. It's truly the best Thai coconut soup I've ever had. You should definitely give it a try! Great served with steamed rice.
ingredients: Medium shrimp, peeled and deveined: 1 pound
instructions: Warm up the oil in a big pot on medium heat. For 1 minute, cook and stir the ginger, lemongrass, and curry paste in this hot oil.
Slowly pour the chicken broth over the mix, making sure to stir it constantly. Mix in the fish sauce and brown sugar, then let it simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in the coconut milk and mushrooms. Keep cooking and stirring until the mushrooms become soft, which takes about 5 minutes.
Add the shrimp next; cook them until they are no longer see-through, about 5 minutes. Finally, stir in the lime juice, add salt to taste, and top with cilantro.
author: Jessica

title: Spicy Chicken with Basil and Chili
description: My take on this classic Thai dish tastes great even with regular basil. The sauce becomes like a glaze as the chicken cooks quickly. This recipe works best if you chop your own chicken and have all your items ready before cooking.
ingredients: Skinless, boneless chicken thighs, chopped: 1 pound
Fresh basil leaves, thinly sliced: 1 cup
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together the chicken broth, oyster sauce, soy sauce, fish sauce, white sugar, and brown sugar until it's all mixed well.

Put a large skillet on high heat. Drizzle in the oil. Add the chicken and stir-fry it until it's no longer pink, which takes 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in the shallots, garlic, and sliced chilies. Keep cooking on high heat until some juices start to stick to the pan's bottom, about 2 or 3 more minutes. Add about one tablespoon of the sauce mix to the skillet; cook and stir until the sauce starts to get sticky, about 1 minute.
Pour in the rest of the sauce. Cook and stir it until the sauce cleans up the bottom of the pan. Keep cooking until the sauce coats the meat, 1 or 2 more minutes. Take the pan off the heat.
Stir in the basil. Cook and stir until the basil softens, about 20 seconds. Serve this with rice.
author: Chef John

title: Single Pan Pasta with Sausage
description: Each year when school starts back, students ask me for recipes that are super simple, cheap, and don't need much kitchen gear. This tasty pasta recipe uses just a few items, costs very little, and the best part: you only need one pot or pan for the whole thing.
ingredients: Spicy Italian sausages: 8 ounces, casings taken off
Low-sodium chicken broth: 3 1/2 cups, split up or as needed
Orecchiette pasta: 1 1/4 cups, or more if you want
Arugula, roughly chopped: 1/2 cup, or as you like
Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, finely grated: 1/4 cup, or to your liking
instructions: Warm up the olive oil in a big, deep skillet on medium heat. Cook the onion with a pinch of salt in the hot oil, stirring it until it's soft and golden, which takes about 5 to 7 minutes. Mix in the sausage with the onions; cook and stir until the sausage is broken apart and browned, for another 5 to 7 minutes.

Pour 1 1/2 cups of chicken broth into the sausage mix and let it come to a boil. While it boils, use a wooden spoon to scrape up any browned bits from the pan's bottom. Put in the orecchiette pasta; cook and stir the pasta in the hot broth. Add the rest of the broth as the liquid gets soaked up, until the pasta is fully cooked and most of the broth is gone, about 15 minutes.
Stir the arugula into the pasta and sausage until the arugula softens. Spoon the pasta into bowls and sprinkle with Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.
author: Chef John

title: Penne Pasta with Creamy Vodka Sauce
description: This is one of the simplest and best recipes I've made. Find pancetta at a good Italian store; don't swap it out, as it's key to the flavor. It's also tasty with shrimp stirred in during the last few minutes of cooking. If you like heat, put in a little red pepper flake.
ingredients: Pancetta bacon, thinly sliced and chopped: 1/4 pound
instructions: Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Put the pasta in and cook it for 8 to 10 minutes, until it's tender but still a bit firm; then drain it.

At the same time, melt the butter in a big skillet on medium heat. Add the pancetta and cook it until it's a light brown. Pour in the vodka and stir until its amount is cut in half, which takes about 4 to 5 minutes. Mix in the tomato sauce and cream. Let it simmer without a lid for 10 to 12 minutes, stirring every few minutes.
Mix in the cooked pasta and warm it through. Serve it with Parmesan cheese on top.
author: Rick Naylor

title: Quick Thai Green Curry with Chicken
description: This simple recipe always turns out great, giving you tender, juicy chicken. It's a filling dinner, especially good served with jasmine rice.
ingredients: Chicken breast halves (boneless, skinless): 1 pound, cut into 1-inch cubes
Fresh ginger: 1 teaspoon, peeled and finely chopped
Cilantro leaves: ½ cup, for garnish
instructions: First, toss the chicken with 1 tablespoon of dark soy sauce, then coat it evenly with the flour. Warm the oil in a big skillet over medium-high heat. Put the chicken into the skillet, then cook and stir it for about 5 minutes until it turns brown. Take the chicken out of the skillet.

Turn the heat down to medium and mix in the curry paste. Cook this for 1 minute until it smells good, then stir in the green onions, garlic, and ginger; cook for 2 more minutes. Put the chicken back into the skillet, stirring to get it covered in the curry mix. Stir the coconut milk, fish sauce, the other 1 tablespoon of soy sauce, and the sugar into the chicken and curry. Let this simmer on medium heat for 20 minutes until the chicken is soft. Serve it with cilantro leaves on top.
author: laus

title: Skillet Chicken with Artichokes and White Wine
description: This simple chicken recipe is full of flavor. White wine, artichokes, and mushrooms make a delicious sauce. It's great with buttered noodles and a green salad.
ingredients: Chicken breast halves, boneless and skinless: 4
Marinated quartered artichoke hearts: 1 can (14 ounces), drained with liquid saved
instructions: Sprinkle salt and pepper on the chicken. Warm the oil and butter in a big skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken in the oil and butter until browned, about 5 to 7 minutes on each side. Take the chicken out of the skillet and set it aside.

Put the artichoke hearts and mushrooms into the same skillet. Cook them until the mushrooms are soft and brown. Put the chicken back in the skillet. Pour in the saved artichoke liquid and the wine. Turn the heat down to low. Let it cook gently for about 10 to 15 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and its juices are clear.
Stir in the capers and let it cook for 5 more minutes. Take the skillet off the heat and serve right away.
author: Caity-O

title: Italian-Style Pork Chops with Tomatoes and Mushrooms
description: Juicy, tender pork chops cooked in a savory Italian sauce. Great with pasta.
ingredients: Diced Italian tomatoes, undrained: 1 (14.5 ounce) can
Green bell pepper, large, cut into 6 pieces: 1
instructions: Warm 1 teaspoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Toss in the sliced mushrooms; cook them, stirring, until they are soft, which takes 5 to 7 minutes. Move the mushrooms to a bowl and set them aside.

Add the other 2 tablespoons of olive oil to the skillet and heat it over medium. Put the pork chops in, browning them on both sides for 7 to 10 minutes. Take the pork chops out and put them on a plate, then pour out all but 1 tablespoon of the fat from the skillet. Mix in the crushed garlic and chopped onion; cook these, stirring, until the onion gets soft and clear, about 5 minutes.

Pour in the tomatoes, then season with basil, oregano, salt, and pepper. Put the pork chops back into the skillet; cover the pan and let it simmer until the pork chops are tender and no longer pink inside, about 45 minutes. If the sauce gets too dry, stir in some water. Place the bell pepper pieces on top of the pork, then add the mushrooms you set aside earlier. Keep simmering until the bell pepper is tender, which should take 5 to 10 minutes.
author: lutzflcat

title: Thai Chicken Soup with Red Curry
description: This Thai-inspired soup uses ingredients you can find at most grocery stores. The red curry paste adds heat, so you can adjust the amount you use to make it as mild or as spicy as you like.
ingredients: Lemongrass stalks: 3 (use only the bottom two-thirds of the soft inner bulbs, sliced thin)
Fresh ginger root: 1 (4 inch) piece, chopped
Skinless, boneless chicken thighs: 2 1/2 pounds, cut into chunks
Fresh jalapeno pepper: 1, sliced into rings
instructions: In a large stock pot, mix the lemongrass, garlic, and ginger over medium-high heat. Add the chicken broth and bring it to a boil. Turn the heat down to low and let it simmer for 30 minutes.
Strain the chicken broth and put it aside. Throw out the lemongrass, garlic, and ginger solids.
Warm the vegetable oil in a big soup pot over medium heat. Toss in the chicken; cook and stir it for 5 minutes.
Add the mushrooms and cook them for 5 more minutes.
Stir in the red curry paste, fish sauce, and lime juice until everything is mixed. Pour in the chicken broth and coconut milk; bring it back to a simmer and cook on low for 15 to 20 minutes.
Remove any extra oil and fat that floats to the top and discard it.
Mix the red onion into the chicken mixture; cook and stir until the onion becomes soft, about 5 minutes.
Take the pot off the heat and stir in about half of the cilantro.
Serve the soup with plates of extra cilantro, lime wedges, and fresh sliced jalapenos.
author: Chef John

title: Spicy Watermelon Salsa
description: This salsa uses sweet watermelon instead of tomatoes. It's cool and spicy at the same time, making it great for summer cookouts. You can eat it with tortilla chips or put it on top of cooked chicken or fish.
instructions: Get a big bowl. Put in the watermelon, green bell pepper, lime juice, cilantro, green onions, jalapeno, and garlic salt. Stir everything together well, then serve it.
author: Dawn Suzie HomeMaker Hardy

title: Hearty Potato and Italian Sausage Soup
description: This soup brings together different tastes for a satisfying and yummy meal. Your mouth will be very happy. If you don't have a bouillon cube, you can use one ounce of chicken broth instead.
instructions: Get your oven ready by heating it to 300 degrees F (which is 150 degrees C).

Put the sausage links on a baking sheet and cook them in the oven for 15 to 20 minutes, until they're done. Cut each link in half lengthwise, then slice them into 1/2 inch pieces. Put them aside for later.

In a 4-quart saucepan, cook the onions and pancetta over medium heat for 10 minutes, until the onions are almost see-through. Stir in the garlic and cook for one more minute. Add the chicken base or bouillon, water, and potatoes, then bring it to a gentle boil for 15 minutes. Put in the kale, cream, and the sausage you set aside, let it cook gently for another 5 minutes, then serve.
author: MARBALET

title: Spicy Grilled Shrimp with Thai Flavors
description: Get ready for a super flavorful grilled shrimp dish with a nice spicy kick. Once you try this marinade, you won't want to use any other for shrimp.
instructions: Grab a shallow dish or a bag that seals. Put in the lemon juice, soy sauce, mustard, garlic, brown sugar, and curry paste and mix them up. Add your shrimp to this mixture, then seal or cover it. Let it sit in the fridge for 1 hour to marinate.

Get your grill heating up to high. Once it's hot, put a little oil on the grill grates. You can put the shrimp on skewers or use a grill basket to make them easier to handle. Take the marinade and pour it into a small pot, then boil it for a few minutes.
Cook the shrimp on the grill for about 3 minutes on each side until they are no longer see-through. Brush them with the boiled marinade every now and then while they cook.
author: Ned Bruce

title: Creamy Seafood Pasta with Parmesan
description: This recipe features a simple Alfredo-style sauce that's lighter than many traditional versions. It pairs well with either seafood or chicken, so feel free to use your preferred option.
ingredients: Medium shrimp: 1 pound, peeled and deveined
instructions: Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Put the pasta in and cook it for 8 to 10 minutes until it's done but still firm; then drain it.

Melt the butter in a large, non-stick skillet on medium-high heat. Stir in the onions and garlic, cooking them for 1 minute. Add the shrimp and scallops, mixing them in, and cook for 3 more minutes. Turn the heat down to medium-low.

Pour the half-and-half, salt, and pepper into the pan, bringing it to a simmer while stirring all the time. Don't let it boil. Slowly sprinkle 1/2 cup of Parmesan cheese over the seafood mix and keep stirring for another minute. Take the pan off the heat.
Toss the cooked pasta into the pan, making sure it's fully coated. Sprinkle the rest of the Parmesan cheese on top and serve.
author: LAQ1013

title: Turkey Meatloaf with Italian Flavors
description: This is a lighter, healthier take on a classic meatloaf, made with turkey and Italian spices.
ingredients: Ground black pepper: 1/2 teaspoon, or to taste
instructions: Get your oven hot to 400°F (200°C). Spray a baking dish with cooking spray to get it ready.

In a big bowl, put the turkey, egg, bread crumbs, Italian seasoning, garlic, black pepper, and salt. Mix everything together, then make it into a loaf shape and place it in the baking dish you prepared.

Cook in the hot oven for 40 minutes. After that, pour about half of the tomato sauce over the loaf. Keep cooking until the middle of the meatloaf is no longer pink, which should take another 10 to 15 minutes. If you use a thermometer, the center should be at least 160°F (70°C). Let the meatloaf sit for 5 to 10 minutes before you cut it to serve.
While the meatloaf is resting, heat up the rest of the tomato sauce in a small pot on medium-low heat; serve this warm sauce with your sliced meatloaf.
author: PattiMcQ

title: Baked Tortellini with Sausage and Marinara
description: This tasty Italian tortellini meal will make you want more.
instructions: Warm up a big pot on medium heat. Put the crumbled sausage, chopped onion, and green bell pepper into the pot. Cook and stir until the sausage is fully browned, which takes about 7 to 10 minutes. Drain out the grease.

Pour the marinara sauce and diced tomatoes over the sausage mix. Add garlic powder and stir it all together. Bring this mixture to a simmer, then turn the heat down to medium-low. Let it simmer until the diced tomatoes break apart into the sauce, about 30 to 45 minutes.
Turn your oven on to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) to get it warm.
Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Cook the frozen tortellini in the boiling water until they float and the inside is hot, around 6 to 7 minutes. Drain the water.

Carefully mix the cooked tortellini into the simmering sauce. Let them cook together for another 5 minutes. Pour the tortellini and sauce into a 13x9-inch baking dish. Put the mozzarella cheese on top.
Bake in the oven you preheated until the cheese is golden brown, for about 20 to 30 minutes.
author: Dave C

title: Spicy Thai Mussels in Coconut Broth
description: You can make these tasty, spicy Thai steamed mussels super fast, in only about 30 minutes from start to finish.
ingredients: Fresh mussels, scrubbed and debearded: 5 pounds
Thai red curry paste: 1 ½ tablespoons
instructions: Get a big stock pot. Put in the lime juice, coconut milk, wine, curry paste, garlic, fish sauce, and sugar. Mix it up to make sure the sugar and curry paste dissolve. Turn the heat to high and bring it to a boil. Let it boil for 2 minutes, then add the mussels. Put a lid on the pot and cook, stirring every now and then, until the mussels open up. This should take 5 to 8 minutes.
Take the pot off the heat. Throw out any mussels that didn't open. Pour the mussels and all the liquid into a serving dish. Toss in the cilantro.
author: MURINMOON

title: Spicy Chicken Macaroni Bake
description: I got the idea for this spicy chicken mac and cheese from my local ballpark and decided to make my own version. I think it turned out great! This dish goes well with cold beer and celery sticks.
ingredients: Hot sauce (like Frank's Redhot): ½ cup, or more if you want it spicier
instructions: Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Put the macaroni in the boiling water and cook for 8 minutes, stirring sometimes, until it's tender but still a little firm. Then, drain the water.
Take the wings and legs off the rotisserie chicken. Remove the skin and bones from these parts. Chop or shred the dark meat into small pieces.

Melt the butter in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Slowly whisk in the flour until it makes a thick paste. Cook this for about 1 minute until it turns golden. Pour in the milk, whisking all the time, until it gets thick and bubbly, which takes about 5 minutes. Keep cooking for another minute until the sauce is smooth. Turn down the heat and add black pepper to the sauce.

Stir the shredded Cheddar and Monterey Jack cheeses into the sauce until they melt and mix in. Add the hot sauce, putting in more if you like it spicier. Then, toss in the blue cheese, chicken, and macaroni, and mix everything together well.
author: Matt R

title: Summer Garden Bread Salad
description: This salad uses fresh ingredients from the garden, except for the bread! Take a loaf of artisan or rosemary bread that's a bit old. If your bread is too new, toast it until it's partly dry and crunchy, like a soft crouton.
ingredients: Cucumber, peeled, seeded, and chopped: 1 cup
instructions: Take a peeled garlic clove and rub it all over the inside of a wooden salad bowl.
Break or cut the bread into pieces that are easy to eat.

In the salad bowl you just prepared, put the bread, tomatoes, cucumbers, red onions, garlic, basil, and thyme. Pour in enough olive oil and vinegar to lightly cover everything, then mix it up and serve.
author: Tamara

title: Spicy Basil Chicken & Rice Stir-Fry
description: This dish is a common part of Thai food. You can change how spicy it is to match what you like. It's a really good way to use rice you have left over! I get the basil from an Asian store nearby. This kind of basil tastes different from regular basil and is important for this recipe. It's quick and pretty simple to make, but you need to keep stirring it.
ingredients: Peanut oil for frying: ½ cup
Boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into thin strips: 1 pound
Red pepper, seeded and thinly sliced: 1
instructions: In a bowl, mix together the oyster sauce, fish sauce, and sugar.

Heat the oil in a wok over medium-high heat until it starts smoking. Add the garlic and serrano peppers, stirring quickly. Stir in the chicken, bell pepper, onion, and the oyster sauce mix; cook until the chicken is no longer pink. Turn the heat up to high and stir in the chilled rice; quickly stir until the sauce is mixed with the rice. Use the back of a spoon to break apart any rice that is sticking together.
Take the wok off the heat and stir in the basil leaves. Put sliced cucumber and cilantro on top if you want.
author: ErinInVegas

title: Presidential Spaghetti with Italian Sausage
description: A Navy chef who worked at Camp David, MD, shared this recipe with me. He made it for presidents. My family loves it, and I think it's good enough for anyone. Serve it with a fresh salad and some crusty garlic bread.
ingredients: Italian sausage links: 2, with casings taken off
instructions: Cut the sausages down the middle, but don't cut all the way through, so they stay connected on one side. Lay them flat in a big skillet. Cook them over medium heat for 15 minutes, flipping them once, until they are brown and cooked all the way through. Take them out of the skillet and set them aside.

Put the ground beef, olive oil, onion, and garlic into the same skillet. Cook and stir these over medium heat for about 10 minutes until the onion looks clear and the beef is brown and broken up. Pour out all but 2 tablespoons of the fat. Stir in the tomatoes, tomato sauce, salt, pepper, basil, oregano, and bay leaf. Let it cook slowly without a lid over low heat for 1 hour, stirring sometimes, until all the flavors mix together well. Take out the bay leaf.

Turn on the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling, then put in the pasta. Cook it for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring now and then, until it's soft. Drain the pasta, then mix it into the sauce.

Put hot pasta with sauce onto oven-safe plates. Place one of the cooked, opened sausages on top of each serving. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over everything. Put the plates into the hot oven for 5 to 10 minutes, until the cheese melts and starts to turn golden.
author: hungryguy

title: Oat Muffins with Fresh Strawberries
description: These are great to eat with your coffee in the morning!
instructions: Get your oven ready by preheating it to 375° F (190° C). Prepare a muffin pan by greasing and flouring it, or place paper liners inside. In a small bowl, mix the oats and buttermilk, then let it sit for 5 minutes. In another bowl, a medium one, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt; put this aside for now.

In a big bowl, beat the egg, oil, brown sugar, and vanilla together. Mix in the oat mixture. Then, stir in the flour mixture until it's just wet. Gently fold in the strawberries. Fill your muffin cups about 2/3 to 3/4 full.
Place them in the hot oven and bake for 15 to 20 minutes. You'll know they're done when a toothpick poked into the middle comes out clean.
author: SWIZZLESTICKS

title: Simple Italian Sausage Meatballs
description: These meatballs are super simple to make and taste great, using ground Italian sausage and just a few other things.
ingredients: 1 (19 ounce) package Johnsonville® Ground Mild Italian Sausage or Links (take off the casings if using links)
instructions: Get your oven hot to 350 degrees F.
Get a big bowl. Put the egg, bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, milk, and onion in it, and mix them together.
If your sausage has casings, pull them off. Put the sausage into the bread crumb mix and stir it all up good. Make 20 meatballs from the mixture. Lay them out on a baking pan with low sides.
Cook the meatballs in the oven for 20 minutes, or until they are fully cooked (they should be 160 degrees F inside). Eat them with your favorite pasta sauce and spaghetti.
author: From the Kitchen at Johnsonville Sausage

title: Steamed Clams with Garlic Wine Sauce
description: You steam these clams in a mix of wine, butter, and herbs. After you eat all the clams, use some Italian bread to soak up the tasty broth that's left.
instructions: Over medium heat, melt the butter in a big skillet. Let the chopped garlic cook in the butter for a short time. Stir in the wine, then add the oregano, parsley, and red pepper flakes to season it.

Put the clams into the wine mixture. Put a lid on it, and let them steam until every clam has opened. Throw out any clams that don't open. Serve these in soup bowls and pour plenty of the broth over them.
author: Bonnie Dailey

title: Pork and Peppers in Peanut Sauce (Slow Cooker)
description: This recipe brings together pork, bell peppers, and various spices in a Thai-inspired peanut sauce. It all cooks down in a slow cooker until the pork is nice and soft, giving off a great smell. You can serve it with brown or jasmine rice and some steamed carrots for a full meal.
ingredients: Red bell peppers, thinly sliced and cut to bite-size: 2
instructions: Put all the items: chicken broth, soy sauce, peanut butter, honey, garlic, ginger, red pepper flakes, red bell peppers, and pork chops into a slow cooker. Give it a good stir. Set the cooker to the Low setting.
Let it cook for 5 to 6 hours, or until the pork is very soft. Take the pork out of the sauce.
Shred the pork, then put it back into the sauce. Let it warm up until it's hot, then serve.
author: fullerla

title: Hearty Italian Sausage and Beef Pasta Sauce
description: This is a tasty, homemade sauce for pasta, great for when you want something savory instead of sweet. It goes well with your preferred pasta, a green salad, and some garlic bread.
instructions: Take the casings off the sausage links and cut them into 1/2 inch pieces. Put the sausage in a big skillet and cook it over medium heat for about 10 minutes until it's brown. Take it out and set it aside.
In the same large skillet, heat up the ground beef, olive oil, garlic, and onion. Cook this over medium heat until the meat is browned, then drain off any extra fat.
Pour in the canned tomatoes and tomato sauce. Stir in the salt, black pepper, basil, oregano, bay leaf, and the cooked sausage. Let it cook without a lid for 1 hour, stirring every now and then.
Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Add your pasta and cook it for 8 to 10 minutes, or until it's tender but still firm. Drain the water.
Mix the hot pasta with the cooked sauce. Remember to take out the bay leaf from the sauce before you serve it.
author: CRAIG

title: Deli-Style Italian Sub Sandwiches
description: These sandwiches are just like the ones from your favorite local pizza place, loaded with three types of meat and provolone cheese. You'll really like how they turn out!
ingredients: Red leaf lettuce: 1 head, rinsed and torn
Genoa salami: ½ pound, thinly sliced
instructions: First, get a big bowl and put in the lettuce, tomatoes, and onion. In a different bowl, mix the olive oil, white wine vinegar, parsley, garlic, basil, red pepper flakes, and oregano. Pour this dressing over the salad stuff and toss it all together well. Put it in the fridge for about an hour.

Open up your submarine rolls. On each roll, layer the Capacola, salami, prosciutto, and provolone cheese so it's even. Then, put some of the salad on top, and add as many pickle slices as you want. Close the rolls, and they are ready to eat.
author: John

title: Asian-Inspired Noodle Bowl
description: This is a fast recipe for a salad with an Asian twist that looks great and is good enough for any fancy party. It's a healthy choice and tastes really good too.
ingredients: Frozen cooked shrimp, thawed and drained: 8 ounces
instructions: Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Break the pasta into small pieces, then put it in the boiling water; let it cook for 8 to 10 minutes until it's al dente; then drain it. In a big bowl, mix the pasta, cabbage, carrots, green, red, and yellow bell peppers, half of the cilantro, half of the green onions, and the shrimp.

In a small bowl, mix the peanut butter, tahini, rice wine vinegar, and sweet chili sauce. Season this with soy sauce, sesame oil, brown sugar, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. About ten minutes before you plan to serve, toss the sauce with the cabbage mix until everything is coated well. Finish by adding the rest of the cilantro, green onions, peanuts, and black sesame seeds on top.
author: Yakuta Rasheed

title: Easy Oven-Baked Mexican Rice
description: This is a straightforward recipe for tomato-flavored Mexican rice. You can get it ready for the oven during a single commercial break. If you don't have chicken broth, hot water with chicken bouillon can be used instead.
instructions: Get your oven hot to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) before you start.

Warm up the oil in a big skillet on medium heat. Put in the chopped onion and garlic, then cook and stir them until the onion looks clear. Next, mix in the chili powder and cumin, and cook for about 30 seconds. Add the rice, chicken broth, and tomato paste, and let it come to a boil. Pour this mixture into a 1-quart casserole dish, then put a lid or aluminum foil over it.
Cook it in the oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until all the liquid is gone and the rice is soft. Let it sit for 3 to 5 minutes before you serve it.
author: ELIZABETH101

title: Avocado Halves with Seafood Stuffing
description: This recipe takes avocado halves and stuffs them with a tasty mix of shrimp, crab, and cucumber. It's a great starter for a fancy meal or a light and easy lunch.
instructions: Get a bowl and put in the crab, shrimp, cucumber, mayonnaise, and parsley. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cover the bowl and put it in the fridge until you're ready to eat.

Cut the avocado in half longways and take out the seed. Carefully scoop out the soft avocado meat, making sure to leave about half an inch attached to the skin. Put the seafood mix into the empty spots in the avocado halves. Sprinkle paprika on top of each one.
author: ANNIEKH

title: Pork Tenderloin with Thai-Style Sauce
description: This dish has a Thai flavor and is easy enough for a regular weeknight meal, but also nice enough to make for guests.
instructions: In a bowl, mix the orange juice, soy sauce, red pepper flakes, cilantro, garlic, brown sugar, peanut butter, and ginger root. Put the tenderloins in a glass baking dish. Pour the orange juice mixture over the tenderloins. Let it marinate in the fridge for at least 1 hour, or up to 8 hours, or even overnight.
Heat your oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cover a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
Move the tenderloins to the foil-lined baking sheet, but save the marinade.
Bake until the pork is no longer pink inside, which takes 30 to 35 minutes. If you use a thermometer, the middle should be 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).

While the pork bakes, put the saved marinade and chicken stock into a saucepan. Bring this mixture to a boil. Let it boil for 2 minutes, then turn the heat down low and let it simmer for 5 to 7 minutes. Slice the tenderloins into 1/4-inch pieces, then pour the sauce over the sliced pork before serving.
author: Adrienne Lane

title: Homemade Lemon Cream Layer Cake
description: I enjoyed a lemon cream cake at a popular Italian restaurant so much that I wanted to recreate it at home. It is a white cake topped with vanilla crumbs and filled with rich lemon cream. After a few attempts, this is the version that I like best. It uses a white cake mix to cut preparation time. Store cake in the refrigerator.
ingredients: Confectioners' sugar: ⅔ cup, divided, plus extra for dusting
instructions: Warm up your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray the bottom of a 10-inch springform pan with cooking spray.

Measure out 1 cup of cake mix and set it aside for the crumb topping. Put the rest of the cake mix in a large bowl. Add the ¾ cup plus 1 tablespoon of milk, the eggs, and the oil. Use an electric mixer to beat the cake mix until the batter is fully combined, about 2 minutes. Pour this batter into your prepared pan.
In a separate bowl, mix the melted butter and vanilla extract. Stir in the 1 cup of cake mix you set aside until the mixture looks crumbly. Sprinkle these crumbs evenly over the cake batter.
Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick poked into the center comes out clean. Let the cake cool completely to room temperature while it's still in the pan.

In a bowl, beat the cream cheese, ⅓ cup of confectioners' sugar, lemon juice, and lemon zest until smooth and creamy. In another bowl, use an electric mixer to beat the heavy cream and the remaining ⅓ cup of confectioners' sugar until stiff peaks form. Gently fold the cream cheese mixture into the whipped cream.

Take the cake out of the springform pan. Use a serrated knife to slice the cake horizontally into 2 layers; lift off the top layer. Spread the filling onto the bottom cake layer, then place the top cake layer back over the filling. Put the cake in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours. Before serving, dust the cake with more confectioners' sugar.
author: Cindy Catudal Shank

title: Beef Lasagna with Zucchini Noodles (Low-Carb)
description: This recipe uses zucchini instead of pasta sheets to make a delicious and filling beef lasagna. It's a great choice if you're looking for a meal that's low in carbs and has no gluten, and everyone will love it.
ingredients: Shredded mozzarella cheese: 2 cups, split up
instructions: Get your oven hot to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray an 8-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Use a paper towel to dry off the zucchini slices. This gets rid of extra water.

Warm up the olive oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Put in the ground beef and cook until it turns brown, which takes 5 to 8 minutes. Stir in the marinara sauce, 1 teaspoon of salt, oregano, and pepper. Let it cook gently for 10 minutes.
Mix the other 1 teaspoon of salt, ricotta cheese, egg, and nutmeg together in a bowl until they are well combined.

Put a layer of zucchini slices in the baking dish you prepared. Pour half of the sauce over it. Add another layer of zucchini. Spread the ricotta mix on top of these. Sprinkle 1 cup of mozzarella cheese over that. Put down one more layer of zucchini slices, then cover with the rest of the sauce, and finally, top with the remaining 1 cup of mozzarella cheese and the Parmesan cheese. Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil.
Bake in the hot oven for 30 minutes. Take off the aluminum foil and keep baking until the top looks golden, which should be about 15 more minutes.
author: Fioa

title: Zucchini Boats with Italian Meatloaf
description: This recipe makes a tasty Italian meatloaf inside zucchini halves. It's simple to bake and turns out great.
ingredients: Large zucchini: 1, cut in half lengthwise
instructions: Set your oven to preheat at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Take out the seeds from the zucchini halves, leaving just the shells. Put garlic salt into the hollowed-out zucchini and set them aside. Warm the olive oil in a pan over medium heat, then cook the onion and garlic until the onion looks clear, which takes about 5 minutes. Take the pan off the heat and let it cool down.

In a large bowl, mix the ground beef, eggs, bread crumbs, basil, carrot, and Parmesan cheese together with the cooled onion mixture. Fill the zucchini halves with this meat mixture, then put them into a baking dish. Spoon about half of the spaghetti sauce over the zucchini, making sure to cover all the meat and letting sauce drip down the sides.

Bake the zucchini in the hot oven for about 45 minutes, until the meat is no longer pink inside and the zucchini is soft. A thermometer put into the middle should show at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over the zucchini, then put them back in the oven for about 5 more minutes until the cheese melts. While the zucchini bakes, heat up the rest of the spaghetti sauce in a small pot over medium heat. Serve the zucchini boats with the extra sauce on the side.
author: EGallagher55

title: Hearty Meat and Mushroom Pasta Sauce
description: This recipe makes a rich, thick meat and mushroom sauce for pasta. You can put it on any pasta you like.
instructions: Get a big skillet and brown the beef and pork over medium heat until it's no longer pink, then take it out and set aside.
Using the same large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat, then cook the chopped onions and garlic until they are soft; pour in about 1/2 cup of the red wine and mix it all together.
Toss the sliced mushrooms, rosemary, oregano, and thyme into the skillet, then add another 1/2 cup of red wine; cook until the mushrooms are soft.
Put the browned meat, tomato sauce, and tomato paste into the mixture; let it cook gently for 1 hour, then pour in the last 2 cups of red wine.
Let the sauce cook slowly on low heat for 2 to 3 hours, stirring it every now and then; it's ready to serve after that.
author: Debbie

title: Simple Crusty Italian Loaf
description: This recipe makes a straightforward, rustic Italian-style bread with a nice crunchy outside.
ingredients: Warm water (110 degrees F / 45 degrees C): 1 and 1/8 cups
instructions: Put all items into your bread machine, except for the egg, the single tablespoon of water, the sesame seeds, and the cornmeal. Follow your machine's suggested order for adding ingredients. Set the machine to the dough cycle.

Take the dough, split it into two equal parts, and shape each part into a loaf. Get a baking sheet ready by greasing it and sprinkling cornmeal on top. Put the shaped loaves on the sheet with the seam facing down. Brush the tops of the loaves with water. Let them sit until they have doubled in size, which should take about 50 minutes.
Turn your oven on to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) to preheat it.

Brush the loaves with the egg wash. Sprinkle the sesame seeds over them. Cut four shallow lines, about 1/4 inch deep, across the top of each loaf. Put a pan filled with hot water on the bottom rack of your oven. Bake the bread for 25 to 30 minutes, or until it looks golden brown.
author: Verla

title: Big Batch Italian Meatballs (Beef, Turkey, Sausage)
description: Make a lot of meatballs using ground beef, turkey, and Italian sausage. They are great with your favorite red sauce and pasta.
ingredients: Vegetable oil: 1 cup, or as much as you need
instructions: Get your oven hot to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a big bowl, mix the ground meats, onion, eggs, bread crumbs, oats, and seasoning. Roll the mixture into balls about 2 inches big.

Put enough vegetable oil in a large pan so it's about 1/2 inch deep. Heat the oil. Cook the meatballs in the hot oil for about 5 minutes until they are brown. Move them from the pan to a glass baking dish.
Bake the meatballs in the hot oven for 25 minutes.
author: Steve

title: Pressure Cooker Italian Wedding Soup
description: This recipe brings together meatballs, pasta, and cheese in a delicious way. While there are many versions of this classic dish, this is my personal take on it. I hope you like it!
instructions: Get your multi-functional pressure cooker ready and pick the Saute setting. Pour in the oil and let it get hot. Put in the carrots, celery, and red onion; cook them until they are soft, which takes about 4 to 5 minutes. Season these vegetables with parsley, basil, and pepper. Then, pour in the chicken broth and add the meatballs. Close the lid and make sure it's locked. Close the valve and choose the Soup function based on your machine's guide; set the timer for 3 minutes. Give it 10 to 15 minutes for the pressure to build up.

Carefully let out the pressure using the quick-release method as your machine's instructions say, which takes about 5 minutes. Unlock and take off the lid. Stir in the pastina pasta. Put the lid back on. Close the valve and choose the Soup function again; set the timer for another 3 minutes. It will take 10 to 15 minutes for the pressure to build.

Release the pressure carefully with the quick-release method, which takes around 5 minutes. Add the spinach and stir it in. Let the soup sit for 5 minutes so the pasta can finish cooking and the spinach wilts. Season with salt as you like.
Serve the soup in bowls and put Parmesan cheese on top of each serving.
author: Bren

title: Easy Peanut Stir Fry Sauce
description: This is my favorite peanut stir fry sauce. I often make a double batch so I have extra to put on rice.
instructions: In a saucepan over medium heat, mix the vinegar, soy sauce, peanut butter, brown sugar, garlic powder, ginger, and cayenne pepper. Cook and stir for about 5 minutes, until the brown sugar melts and the sauce is smooth.
author: Bonnie Gertz

title: Classic Thai Coconut and Shrimp Soup
description: This soup is a favorite for anyone who enjoys Asian cooking. It's a simple dish to prepare if you have all the items ready, making it ideal for a comforting meal. If not, a quick visit to an Asian grocery store will get you what you need. You can easily change it up too, by using chicken or making it vegetarian instead of with shrimp.
ingredients: Medium shrimp, peeled and deveined: 1 pound
Lemon grass, bruised and chopped: 4 stalks
Kaffir lime leaves, torn in half: 10
instructions: First, bring a pot of water to a boil. Cook the shrimp in the boiling water until they are done, which takes about one minute. Take the shrimp out of the water and set them aside.

Next, pour the coconut milk and 2 cups of water into a big saucepan and heat it until it gently bubbles. Add the galangal, lemon grass, and lime leaves to the pan; let it simmer for 10 minutes so the flavors mix in. Strain the coconut milk into a clean pan, throwing away the used spices. Cook the sliced shiitake mushrooms in the coconut milk for five minutes. Stir in the lime juice, fish sauce, and brown sugar. Add curry powder to season it to your liking.
To serve, warm the shrimp in the soup, then spoon the soup into bowls. Top with green onion and red pepper flakes.
author: MIREYZ

title: Baked Pasta with Garlic Butter Shrimp
description: Looking for a really satisfying meal that comes together fast? This creamy, buttery garlic shrimp and pasta bake is a great dinner idea your whole family will enjoy trying!
ingredients: Uncooked medium shrimp (peeled and deveined): 1 pound
instructions: Set your oven to preheat at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Get a large pot of lightly salted water boiling. Toss in the penne and cook it, mixing sometimes, until it's tender but still firm when you bite it, which takes about 11 minutes. Then drain it.

Warm 1 tablespoon of butter and the vegetable oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until you can smell it, about 30 seconds. Put in the shrimp, 2 tablespoons of parsley, and the dill. Cook and stir, flipping the shrimp once, until they turn pink, which is 3 to 4 minutes. Move the shrimp to a plate and set it aside.

Melt the other 2 tablespoons of butter in the skillet, mixing it into the shrimp juices. Stir in the flour; whisk until it's fully mixed and begins to look golden, which takes 30 seconds to 1 minute. Add the chicken broth, then the milk; whisk to blend. Mix in the tomatoes, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Bring this sauce to a gentle simmer.

Stir ½ cup of Parmesan cheese and all the Romano cheese into the sauce until the cheeses start to melt and the sauce gets creamy. Add 1 tablespoon of mozzarella cheese. Stir in about half of the cooked penne first; add more if there's enough sauce to coat it well. Add the shrimp and mix everything together. Top with the rest of the parsley, Parmesan, and mozzarella.
Bake in the hot oven until the top is golden and the sauce is bubbling around the skillet's edges, for 8 to 10 minutes.
author: Ed N Angela Latimer

title: Simple Baked Seafood Dinner
description: This recipe makes a tasty seafood meal for two people, quickly and easily.
ingredients: Jumbo shrimp: 6, peeled, deveined, tails on
Seafood seasoning (like Old Bay™): ½ teaspoon
instructions: Get your oven hot to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).

Put the halibut, scallops, and shrimp in a glass baking dish that can go in the oven. Pour the wine, butter, and lemon juice over everything. Sprinkle the seafood seasoning and garlic on top. Add salt and pepper as you like.
Cook in the hot oven for 10 to 12 minutes, until the halibut is white and flakes apart easily. Just before you serve it, sprinkle the chopped parsley over the top.
author: MICHELLE0011

title: Ground Beef Taco Bowl (Low-Carb)
description: If you're watching carbs but still want to enjoy Mexican food, this recipe is for you. It's a simple way to make tacos without the shells and always hits the spot when I'm craving them.
ingredients: One avocado, peeled, pitted, and sliced
instructions: In a skillet, cook the ground beef, onion, and jalapeno peppers over medium-high heat. Stir them until the meat turns brown and breaks apart, which takes about 7 to 10 minutes. Then, mix in the taco seasoning with the meat. Let it gently bubble and cook for about 5 minutes so the tastes blend together.
In a big bowl, combine the meat mixture, shredded lettuce, tomato, Cheddar cheese, salsa, and sour cream. Split this taco mix into 4 bowls, then put avocado slices on top of each serving.
author: Sarah

title: Spaghetti Squash Bake with Italian Sausage
description: This is an easy gluten-free meal that your whole family will enjoy eating for dinner.
ingredients: Spaghetti squash: 1 (3 pound), cut in half with seeds removed
Diced tomatoes (with basil, garlic, and oregano): 1 (15 ounce) can
Chicken broth: 1 and a half cups
instructions: Get your oven hot to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Put parchment paper on a baking sheet. Place the squash on the sheet with the cut side down.

Cook the squash in the hot oven for about 25 minutes until it starts getting soft. Turn the oven down to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and keep cooking for about 25 more minutes, until a knife can go through it easily. Take it out and let it cool enough to touch.

Cook the sausage in a big skillet over medium heat until it's brown, around 5 minutes. Take it out of the skillet. Put the chopped onion, celery, and carrot into the same skillet. Cook them in the sausage grease, stirring, for about 5 minutes until they start to soften. Stir in the cooked sausage, diced tomatoes, chicken broth, tomato paste, and garlic. Let the sauce simmer for about 15 minutes so the flavors mix together.

Use a fork to pull out the inside of the squash into long strands, like spaghetti. Put these strands into a 9x13-inch casserole dish. Spoon the sauce over the squash strands and mix it all up. Top everything with the mozzarella cheese.
Bake in the hot oven until it's bubbly and golden brown on top, which takes about 25 minutes.
author: Allmyhearts

title: Thai-Style Cucumber Salad
description: This bright salad is a great side for chicken or fish. Its crisp, fresh tastes can make a rich meal feel much lighter. It's a dish our family really enjoys.
ingredients: Cucumbers (2 pounds), cut in half, seeds removed, and sliced
instructions: In a salad bowl, whisk the vinegar, sugar, coriander, red pepper flakes, and salt together until the sugar is fully dissolved. Add the cucumbers, onion, tomatoes, cilantro, and chopped mint, then toss everything to coat it with the dressing. Cover the bowl and put it in the fridge for 1 hour so the flavors can mix.
Just before you serve it, toss the salad again with the chopped peanuts. Finish by decorating it with the fresh mint sprigs.
author: Kris10 in CA

title: Rigatoni with Mild Italian Sausage
description: It's surprising how much one main item can change a meal. Just put Johnsonville Italian Sausages into a simple pasta meal to make it really special! The sausage goes great with the pasta, peppers, garlic, and sauce. This easy recipe is a must-try for anyone who loves pasta!
ingredients: Johnsonville Italian Mild Sausage Links: 1 package (19 ounces)
Rigatoni pasta: 1 package (16 ounces), cooked and drained
Sweet red bell pepper: 1 large, chopped
instructions: Prepare the sausage links as directed on their package; drain them. Cut these into pieces about 1/2-inch thick and put them aside.

Warm up the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook the garlic and red pepper in it until they are soft but still a little firm. Add the sausage you set aside, the pasta, and the marinara sauce; cook and mix until everything is hot. Sprinkle parsley on top. Serve it up.
author: From the Kitchen at Johnsonville Sausage

title: Three-Cheese Baked Chicken Thighs with Marinara
description: These chicken thighs are baked until juicy and covered with a yummy mix of three cheeses and your favorite red sauce. They go great with pasta, rice, or roasted potatoes for an easy dinner. I like to grate my own cheese because it melts better, but store-bought shredded cheese works too if you're in a hurry.
instructions: Get your oven hot to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
In a small bowl, mix the ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, Italian seasoning, and 1/8 teaspoon salt. Set this aside.
Sprinkle garlic powder and salt on both sides of the chicken thighs.

Heat the olive oil in an oven-safe pan over medium-high heat. Put the chicken thighs smooth-side down and cook them until they're brown, about 3 to 4 minutes. Flip them over, then take the pan off the heat. Put an equal amount of the ricotta cheese mixture on top of each thigh. Spoon the marinara sauce over the ricotta and around the chicken.

Bake in the hot oven for about 25 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear. An instant-read thermometer should show at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C) when stuck into the middle. Take the pan out of the oven, but leave the oven on.
Put the mozzarella cheese on top of the chicken. Put the pan back in the oven for 2 to 3 minutes, just until the cheese is melted. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.
author: France C

title: Pizza Dough from an Old Family Recipe
description: This pizza dough recipe has been a family favorite for many years, passed down from my grandmother who moved here from Italy when she was 40. It's truly excellent, and I hope you like it too. My fiancé even suggested I should sell it!
ingredients: Olive oil: 3 tablespoons (or more, to your liking)
All-purpose flour: 3 cups, plus extra if needed
instructions: Mix the water, olive oil, yeast, sugar, and salt together using an electric mixer until everything is well combined. This should take about two minutes. Then, add the flour, one cup at a time. After each cup, stir with a wooden spoon until the dough starts to pull away from the bowl's sides.

Use your hands to knead the dough until it feels soft and smooth. Lightly put some oil in a bowl, then put the dough in, turning it over so it gets coated in oil. Let the dough sit for 5 to 10 minutes.
author: lizard_c9

title: Quinoa Bowl with Thai Peanut Sauce
description: This dish uses quinoa, which is gluten-free, packed with protein and fiber, and has a great nutty taste. You can easily swap it for rice or noodles if you prefer. To make it vegetarian, just skip the chicken and add more edamame. Or, if you like, shrimp works well too. It's a really good, adaptable recipe!
ingredients: Boneless, skinless chicken breast (large), cut into thin strips: 1
instructions: Get the chicken broth and quinoa boiling in a saucepan. Turn the heat down to medium-low, cover, and let it cook until the quinoa is soft, which takes 15 to 20 minutes. Set this aside.

Warm up 1 1/2 teaspoons of coconut oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Put in the chicken and stir it around until it's cooked through, about 5 minutes. Take the chicken out of the wok. Add the other 1 1/2 teaspoons of coconut oil. Toss in the cabbage, edamame, broccoli, carrot, and green onions and cook them until they get a little soft, for 2 to 3 minutes.

In a small bowl, beat the eggs with the sesame oil. Move the vegetables to the sides of the wok to make an empty spot in the middle. Pour the eggs into this spot and stir them to scramble, which takes about 3 minutes.
In a small bowl, mix together the peanut butter, soy sauce, rice vinegar, chili garlic sauce, ginger, garlic, and sesame oil. Pour this Thai peanut sauce over the vegetables and eggs in the wok.
Put the chicken back into the wok with the quinoa; stir everything well to combine. Mix in the chopped peanuts and cilantro, then serve.
author: Lisa

title: Grilled Chicken Skewers with Peanut Sauce
description: This recipe is my take on a well-known Thai chicken dish, and it's really good!
ingredients: Chicken breast, skinless and boneless: 2 pounds, cut into strips
Wooden skewers: 20, soaked in water for 30 minutes
instructions: Put the vegetable oil, soy sauce, tamarind paste, chopped lemon grass, crushed garlic, cumin, coriander, lime juice, muscovado sugar, and chili powder into a blender. Blend until it becomes a smooth paste. Take a large bowl or a big resealable plastic bag, and toss the chicken strips with this marinade. Let it chill in the fridge for 1 hour.
Get your outdoor grill ready by heating it to medium-high. Lightly brush oil on the grate.
In a small pot, put the peanut butter, chopped peanuts, coconut milk, curry paste, fish sauce, and brown sugar. Cook this mix over medium-low heat, stirring until it's smooth. Keep it warm.
Place the chicken pieces onto the skewers. Grill them until the middle is no longer pink, which takes 3 to 5 minutes on each side. Serve with the peanut sauce.
author: ThaiChefMarty

title: Thai-Style Beef in the Slow Cooker
description: This slow cooker Thai beef dish is super adaptable and works for anyone, whether you're busy with family, a couple, or cooking for one. You can get it ready the night before or in the morning. It cooks for 6, 8, or 10 hours, making it a forgiving and tasty meal.
instructions: Get a large skillet hot over medium-high heat. Cook the beef, stirring it around, until it turns brown, about 2 minutes on each side. Drain any extra fat. Move the beef to a 4-quart slow cooker and sprinkle salt on it.
Put the onion and garlic into the same skillet on medium-high heat; cook them until they are soft, for about 5 minutes. Add these to the beef in the slow cooker.
Mix the coconut milk, beef broth, red curry paste, lime juice, peanut oil, minced jalapeno peppers, and brown sugar into the slow cooker.
Put the lid on and cook on the Low setting until the tastes come together, from 6 to 10 hours.
Bring the water and rice to a boil in a pot. Turn the heat down to medium-low, cover, and let it simmer until the rice is soft and the water is gone, which takes 20 to 25 minutes.
Stir the spinach into the slow cooker and cook it until it wilts, about 15 minutes. Serve the beef mix over the rice and put basil leaves on top.
author: Sapper26

title: Slow Cooker Shredded Beef Tacos
description: I made this dish for a work potluck, and it was a smash hit at our Cinco De Mayo taco bar. The coffee helps make the meat super tender and adds a subtle smoky flavor as it cooks. Just serve it up with warm tortillas and whatever toppings you like. If you prefer less spice, just leave out the jalapenos.
ingredients: One large yellow onion, cut into thin rings
Boneless beef chuck roast: 1 (3 lb) piece, trimmed
instructions: Put half of the onion rings in the bottom of your slow cooker. Place the chuck roast right on top of the onions.

Pour the diced tomatoes, beef broth, and coffee over the roast in the cooker. Then, mix in the diced green chiles, jalapeno peppers, chopped garlic, chili powder, cumin, salt, and black pepper. Spread the rest of the onion rings over everything.
Cover the cooker and let it cook on Low heat until the beef is very tender, which will take 6 to 10 hours.
Take the chuck roast out and put it into a bowl, then shred the meat. Put the shredded meat back into the sauce. Take out the onions and serve the meat.
author: rknotthere

title: Spicy Thai Chicken Soup
description: This is a great, real Thai hot and sour soup. It's a perfect first course for a Thai dinner. It's light, so it works well as an appetizer. It's also super fast and simple to make. The tom yum paste is spicy, so taste the soup before you put in the chile to see if you need more heat. You really need fresh cilantro for this recipe; don't skip it!
ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves, shredded
instructions: Bring the chicken stock to a boil in a big saucepan. Stir in the tom yum paste and garlic, letting it cook for about 2 minutes. Next, mix in the lemon grass and kaffir lime leaves. Put the chicken into the saucepan and cook it for 5 minutes, or until it's no longer pink and the juices run clear.

Add the mushrooms. Then, stir in the fish sauce, lime juice, and green chile pepper. Keep cooking until everything is mixed well. Take it off the heat and serve it warm with the chopped coriander and basil.
author: STEVE ALDER

title: Oven-Cooked Italian Beef Balls
description: These meatballs come out super soft and full of flavor. I like to make a big batch, then freeze them. That way, I can grab just what I need for dinner. If you're putting them in sauce, toss them in about 20 minutes before you're ready to eat.
instructions: Get your oven hot to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Put the bread crumbs, Romano cheese, parsley, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder in a bowl and mix them up. Then, add the water and eggs to that mix. After that, put in the ground beef and really get everything combined. Shape this mixture into balls and place them onto a baking sheet that won't stick.
Cook them in the hot oven until they turn brown, which takes about 30 minutes.
author: Dawn Fronius

title: Baked Italian Egg Dish
description: This egg dish is super simple to put together, and you can easily swap out ingredients for what you already have. It's a great way to use up bits and pieces, and any leftovers are just as good.
ingredients: Artichoke hearts, drained and chopped: 1/2 cup
Sliced mushrooms (from a 4.5-ounce can), drained: 1 can
instructions: Get your oven hot to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Lightly grease a shallow 2-quart baking dish.

Warm up a skillet over medium heat. Put the salami, artichokes, tomatoes, and mushrooms in the skillet and cook them until they are hot, which takes about 4 minutes. Move this mix into your baking dish.

In a big bowl, beat the eggs, milk, green onions, garlic, basil, onion powder, salt, and black pepper together. Pour this egg mixture over the salami mix. Sprinkle both the mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses on top.
Cook in the oven until the eggs are firm and the cheese is bubbly and melted, about 20 minutes.
author: Shagen McBride

title: Joe's Special Chicken Pad Thai Style
description: My girlfriend and I wanted Pad Thai, so we looked at different recipes and came up with our own version. It's not totally like traditional Pad Thai, which is why we gave it this name!
ingredients: Boneless, skinless chicken breast halves, cut into bite-size pieces: 1 pound
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
Pad Thai rice noodles: 1 (16 ounce) package
instructions: First, get a big pot of water boiling.
Season the chicken with salt and black pepper, then set it aside.
In a bowl, mix the sugar, cayenne pepper, white wine vinegar, fish sauce, and peanut butter until smooth.
Put a large skillet or wok on high heat and coat the inside with olive oil.
Cook the chicken in the hot oil, stirring it, until the outside turns white but the inside is still pink. This should take about 3 minutes.
Take the chicken out and put it in a bowl.
Turn the heat down to medium-low under the skillet. Add the garlic and stir it until it looks clear, about 1 to 2 minutes.
Stir the eggs into the garlic and cook them until they are loosely set, which takes 2 to 3 minutes.
Pour the peanut sauce into the skillet with the garlic and eggs, then stir everything together. Let the sauce come to a gentle boil.
Put the rice noodles into the boiling water. Cook them for about 5 minutes, until they are still a bit firm.
Drain the water from the noodles.
Add the chicken back to the skillet with the eggs and sauce. Let it simmer, stirring often, until the chicken is cooked through and the juices are clear. This will take 5 to 8 more minutes.
Stir in the bean sprouts, rice noodles, and beef broth. Bring it to a simmer and cook for about 10 minutes, until the noodles are soft and most of the broth is soaked up.
Top with green onions before serving.
author: Buon Appetito

title: Italian-Style Beef Sandwiches
description: I tried to make a sandwich that takes ideas from the classic Italian beef, the French dip, and even a pulled pork sandwich. Instead of thinly sliced roast beef, I used stew beef, which might surprise my Chicago friends.
ingredients: Boneless beef chuck, cut into 2-inch pieces: 1 1/2 pounds
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
Red pepper flakes: 1/4 teaspoon, or as needed
Chicken broth: 3 cups, or as much as needed
instructions: Put some salt and black pepper on the beef. In a heavy pot, heat the vegetable oil on high. Cook the beef in the hot oil until it turns brown, which should take 5 to 8 minutes.

Add the garlic, vinegar, oregano, 1 1/2 teaspoons of salt, thyme, rosemary, 1 teaspoon of black pepper, the bay leaf, and red pepper flakes to the beef and stir everything together. Pour in enough chicken broth so the meat is covered by about 1 inch. Bring this mixture to a simmer.
Put a lid on the pot, turn the heat down low, and let it cook until the meat is very tender when you poke it with a fork. This will take 1 to 1 1/2 hours.

Take the meat out of the pot using a strainer or a slotted spoon and put it into a different pot. Add about 1/4 cup of the meat broth to this pot. Use a wooden spoon to gently break the meat into smaller pieces. Cover the pot with a lid or aluminum foil to keep it warm.

Take off the extra grease floating on top of the broth that stayed in the first pot. Taste the broth and add more salt and pepper if needed. Cover this pot with a lid or aluminum foil and keep the broth warm.

Lay out the ciabatta roll halves. Spoon 2 to 3 tablespoons of the meat broth over each half. Put a lot of meat and a spoonful of the pickled vegetables on the bottom half of each roll. Place the top halves on the sandwiches. Make 3 more sandwiches using the rest of the buns, broth, meat, and pickled vegetables.
Pour the hot meat broth into small ramekins. Sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon of parsley on top of each ramekin. Serve the sandwiches with the hot broth on the side for dipping.
author: Chef John

title: Slow Cooker Spicy Beef Barbacoa
description: This recipe makes barbacoa meat that tastes really close to a popular restaurant chain's version. It's packed with strong tastes from garlic, spicy cayenne, and smoky chipotle. If you don't like a lot of heat, make sure to use less cayenne and serrano pepper, because this dish is quite hot! Serve it on corn or flour tortillas. You can put cilantro on top, and add lime cilantro rice (from this site), black beans, fresh tomato salsa, mashed avocado, cheese, lettuce, and sour cream.
ingredients: Beef chuck roast (2 pounds), trimmed and cut into 4 to 6 pieces
Garlic cloves, peeled: 4, or more if you like
Ground cayenne pepper: 1 tablespoon, or more to taste
instructions: Warm the oil in a large skillet, starting on low heat and slowly increasing it to medium-high. Put the beef chuck pieces into the skillet. Cook them until they are brown, which takes about 10 seconds on each side. Move the browned beef to a slow cooker.

Place the apple cider, chipotle peppers, lime juice, garlic, cumin, serrano pepper, cayenne pepper, oregano, black pepper, garlic powder, salt, and ground cloves into a blender or food processor. Blend everything until it's smooth. Pour this mixture over the beef in the slow cooker.
Add the chicken broth, chopped onion, and bay leaves into the slow cooker with the beef and sauce.
Cook the mixture on the Low setting until the beef is very tender and falls apart easily, which will take 6 to 8 hours. Use two forks to pull the beef apart into shreds.
author: Dani_Dizzle

title: Chicken Lo Mein with Peanut Sauce
description: This dish is a hit with kids and always gets compliments. You can add more vegetables like broccoli or snow peas if you want, but you might need a bit more peanut sauce if you do.
ingredients: Chinese-style chow mein stir-fry noodles: 7 ounces
Skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cubed: 3
instructions: Get 2 quarts of lightly salted water boiling. Put the chow mein in the boiling water. Stir it sometimes until it's cooked but still a bit firm, about 12 minutes. Then drain it.
In a bowl, mix the soy sauce, peanut butter, 4 teaspoons of vegetable oil, sugar, vinegar, and 4 teaspoons of sesame oil until it's smooth.

Heat 2 teaspoons of vegetable oil and 1 teaspoon of sesame oil in a big skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the chicken, garlic, and ginger in the hot oil for 5 to 10 minutes, until the chicken isn't pink anymore. Use a slotted spoon to take the chicken mix out and put it in a bowl, but leave the drippings in the skillet.
Warm up another 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil and 1 teaspoon of sesame oil in the skillet with the drippings. Cook the mushrooms until they smell good, which takes 15 to 30 seconds.

Put the chicken back into the skillet. Add the drained chow mein noodles, bean sprouts, and green onion. Toss everything together so the chicken and veggies are mixed with the noodles. Pour the peanut sauce over the noodles and toss to coat them. Cook until the sauce is warm, about 1 minute. Take the skillet off the heat and put cilantro on top.
author: Tonja

title: Spaghetti Squash with Italian Sauce
description: This recipe puts a new spin on spaghetti squash. It's enough for four people as a main meal with some crusty bread, or it can be a side dish for more people. It also tastes great warmed up the next day.
ingredients: Spaghetti squash: 1, cut in half with seeds removed
Diced tomatoes with onion, celery, and green pepper: 1 (14.5 ounce) can
Shredded Parmesan cheese: 1/4 cup, plus extra for serving
instructions: Warm up your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Pour the water into a baking dish. Put the squash halves in the dish with the cut side down.
Cook the squash in the oven until a fork goes into the skin very easily, which takes about 45 minutes. Let the squash keep cooking while you get the rest of the recipe ready.

Melt the butter and olive oil together in a big skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the diced onion in the hot butter until it gets soft, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and keep cooking until it smells good, for about 1 more minute. Pour the diced tomatoes over the onion mix, then add the basil. Put a lid on the skillet, turn the heat down to medium-low, and let it simmer until the tomatoes are soft, around 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

Once the squash is cool enough to touch, use a fork to pull out the stringy insides from the skin. Mix the squash and Parmesan cheese into the tomato sauce. Put the lid back on the skillet and cook until the squash is hot all the way through, for 5 to 10 more minutes. Sprinkle more Parmesan cheese on top when you serve it.
author: Judy in Delaware

title: Hearty Italian Sausage and Bean Chili
description: I've mixed pork with ground beef in chili before, but this time, I tried using only Italian sausage and was really happy with how it turned out. We made it even more Italian by including cannellini beans and a little bit of basil. Otherwise, it's a pretty standard chili recipe. You can serve it with sour cream, avocado, red onion, and basil on top.
ingredients: Hot Italian sausage, casings off: 1 and 1/4 pounds
Mild Italian sausage, casings off: 1 and 1/4 pounds
Water: 2 and 1/2 cups, or as needed
Cannellini beans (15-ounce cans): 2, drained and rinsed
instructions: Warm the oil in a big pot over medium-high heat. Put the hot Italian sausage, mild Italian sausage, chopped onion, and a pinch of salt into the pot. Use a wooden spoon to break up the sausage as you cook and stir it. Keep cooking for about 10 minutes until the sausage is brown and crumbly, and most of the liquid has gone away.
Add the ancho chile powder, paprika, cumin, ground black pepper, chipotle chile powder, and oregano to the sausage mix. Cook and stir for about 2 minutes until it smells good.

Pour the water and tomato puree into the sausage. Bring it to a simmer, then lower the heat to medium-low. Let it cook at a steady simmer for about 45 minutes until the sausage is tender. If needed, add more water and use a spoon to remove any fat that rises to the top.

Stir in the cannellini beans, diced red bell pepper, and diced green bell pepper with the sausage mix. Let it simmer for around 30 minutes until the vegetables are soft. Taste and add salt as you like.
author: Chef John

title: Turkey and Bean Meatballs (Italian Style)
description: These Italian-inspired meatballs are a lighter option that pairs nicely with your favorite pasta dishes, like spaghetti with tomato sauce.
ingredients: Butter beans (one 15-ounce can), rinsed and drained
instructions: In a big mixing bowl, mash up the butter beans. Put in the ground turkey, egg white, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper; mix everything until it's all blended. Gently stir the bread crumbs into the mix.
Roll the mixture into meatballs, making them about 1 inch big.
Warm up the oil in a skillet on medium heat.

Cook the meatballs in the hot oil until they are brown on all sides, which takes 5 to 7 minutes. Put a lid on the skillet and keep cooking for about 5 more minutes, until the meatballs are not pink inside. To be sure, a thermometer put into the middle should show at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
author: Susan Quinn

title: Fresh Chicken Spring Rolls with Peanut Dip
description: These spring rolls mix Vietnamese style with Thai tastes. They are great as a starter or a light main meal. You get a nice crunch from the colorful vegetables and a soft feel from the clear wrapper.
ingredients: Fresh ginger root, 1 (1 1/2 inch) piece, minced
Skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into 1-inch pieces: 1 pound
instructions: In a bowl, mix together 1 cup peanut sauce, the minced ginger, minced garlic, and 1 teaspoon soy sauce. Add the chicken to this mixture and stir until all the chicken pieces are covered. Put the bowl in the fridge to let the chicken soak up the flavors for 30 minutes.

Heat 1 teaspoon of peanut oil in a wok or a large pan over medium heat. Cook the snow peas, bean sprouts, and green onion in the hot oil for 3 to 4 minutes, until they are warm but still crunchy. Move these vegetables to a big bowl. Stir in the watercress and cilantro. Use a vegetable peeler to make long strips of carrot directly into this vegetable mix. Pour 1 teaspoon of soy sauce over everything and toss to mix it well.
Add another 1 teaspoon of oil to the wok or pan and heat it up. Cook the chicken that was marinating until there is no pink left inside, which takes about 10 minutes.

Fill a big bowl with hot water. Take one spring roll wrapper at a time and dip it into the water for about 2 seconds. As you take each wrapper out of the water, put 2 big spoonfuls of the cooked chicken and a small handful of the vegetable mix onto it. Fold the two opposite sides of the wrapper over the filling. Then, fold the bottom part of the wrapper over the filling and roll it up tightly. Serve these rolls with the remaining 1/2 cup of peanut sauce for dipping.
author: Rebecca V

title: Salmon with Pistachio Topping
description: Give regular salmon a fancy twist with a crunchy pistachio topping. This dish is ready in less than half an hour, perfect for a fast dinner any night or when you have friends over. It goes great with a cold glass of white wine.
ingredients: Salmon fillets (6-ounce each, skin on, center cut): 4
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
instructions: Get your oven ready by heating it to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
In a small bowl, mix together the pistachios, panko bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, and melted butter. Use a fork to stir until everything is mixed well.
Sprinkle salt and pepper lightly on both sides of the salmon fillets.

Warm up the olive oil in a big oven-safe pan over medium heat. Place the salmon fillets in the pan with the flesh side down and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Turn off the heat. Flip the salmon so the skin side is down. Spread Dijon mustard evenly on top of each salmon piece. Put the pistachio mixture on top, pressing it down onto the salmon.
Put the pan in the oven you preheated. Cook until the salmon easily flakes apart with a fork, which should be about 10 to 12 minutes. Serve it with the lemon wedges.
author: France C

title: Quick Thai-Inspired Noodle Salad
description: I just put this together and it turned out great. You can serve it warm or cold, just give it another mix before serving. Be careful not to cook the noodles for too long.
ingredients: Fresh basil, chopped: 2 tablespoons (or to taste)
Fresh cilantro, chopped: 2 tablespoons (or to taste)
Fresh ginger root, minced: 1 (1 inch) piece
instructions: Put rice noodles into a bowl and cover with boiling water. Cover the bowl and let the noodles soften, which takes about 10 minutes. Drain the water, then add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and mix it in.

Combine the chopped romaine lettuce, diced red bell pepper, chopped red onion, green onions, diced cucumber, fresh basil, fresh cilantro, minced ginger root, minced jalapeno pepper, and minced garlic with the prepared rice noodles.

In a separate bowl, whisk together the 1/3 cup olive oil, rice vinegar, soy sauce, white sugar, lemon juice, lime juice, salt, turmeric, and paprika. Pour this dressing over the noodle mixture and toss everything to coat well.
author: christinadavis

title: No-Cook Chicken and Avocado Bowls
description: Have a healthy, tasty Mexican-inspired side dish ready fast, with no cooking needed. This recipe is simple and good for you.
ingredients: Canned chicken: 3 cans (6 ounces each), drained well
Chili powder: 1/2 teaspoon, or more if you like
Avocados: 3, cut in half the long way and seeds taken out
Lime juice: 1 teaspoon, adjust to your liking
instructions: Put the chicken, cilantro, and chili powder in a bowl and mix them up.
Place the avocado halves on a plate. Sprinkle lime juice over them. Spoon the chicken mix into each avocado half.
author: KyLeeAnn

title: Penne Pasta with Sausage and Peppers
description: Make your Italian dinner special with this tasty Johnsonville Italian Sausage dish.
ingredients: Johnsonville® Mild Italian Sausage Links, coin-sliced: 1 package (19 ounce)
Green bell pepper, cut into strips: 1 medium
Red bell pepper, cut into strips: 1 medium
Onion, sliced in half then into strips: 1 medium
Marinara sauce, warmed up: 1 jar (28 ounce)
instructions: Prepare the pasta as the package tells you to.
Warm up the oil in a pan. Put the sausage in and cook until it turns brown, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add in the peppers, onion, and garlic. Keep cooking until the vegetables are soft.
Put the cooked pasta into serving bowls. Pour marinara sauce over it, then add the sausage and vegetable mix on top.
author: From the Kitchen at Johnsonville Sausage

title: Romagna-Style Italian Flatbread
description: This flatbread comes from the Romagna area of Italy. It's really good with arugula and a soft cheese (Squacquerone is the usual choice) or with sliced meats. You can also enjoy it with a glass of Sangiovese Superiore di Romagna from Forli'. The dough can be kept in the fridge at 40°F (4°C) for up to two days.
instructions: In a bowl, combine the milk, margarine, and yogurt.

Get a large bowl and mix together the flour, salt, baking powder, and egg white. Pour the liquid milk mixture into the dry flour mixture. Use your hands to work the ingredients until the dough pulls away from the bowl's sides. Add more flour or water if needed to get the right feel – it should not be sticky or too dry. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it sit at room temperature for 30 minutes.
Put the dough onto a surface dusted with a little flour. Divide it into 12 parts and roll each part into a ball. Roll and stretch each ball until it is about 1/8-inch thick and 8 inches wide.

Lightly oil a cast iron skillet and place it over medium-low heat. Cook the dough in the hot skillet for 1 to 2 minutes per side, until it starts to firm up. Pierce the dough with a fork 3 to 4 times while it cooks. Wrap the finished flatbreads in a towel until you are ready to serve them.
author: Max_a_romagnolo_In_America

title: Creamy Cheese Stuffed Mushrooms
description: These mushrooms are a copycat of an expensive restaurant appetizer I once had in North Carolina. I figured out how to make them myself because I liked them so much.
