They taste very rich and good. Plan for about 6 mushrooms per person as a starter. The middle part is soft; if you want it firmer, just add an egg white to the cheese mix.
ingredients: Medium fresh mushrooms, stems off: 2 pounds
instructions: Get two big skillets hot over medium-high heat. Put 3 tablespoons of butter in each skillet. Divide the mushroom caps between the two pans. Cook and stir the caps until their edges get a little soft, which takes about 5 minutes. Take them out and put them in a colander to drain and cool off.

Mix the cream cheese and goat cheese together until they are smooth. Stir in the chopped onions and mushroom stems. Use all of this mix to generously fill each mushroom cap. Put them, filling-side up, into a baking pan.
Turn on your oven broiler to high heat.

Melt the last ¼ cup of butter with the garlic in a small pot on medium heat. Once the butter is completely melted, cook the garlic for 1 minute. Pour this garlic butter over all the filled mushroom caps.
Put the pan of mushrooms under the hot broiler. Cook them until they turn golden brown, which should take around 5 minutes.
author: jenny662

title: Quick Skillet Meal: Italian Sausage with Peppers and Onions
description: When you need a filling meal fast, this recipe is perfect. It brings together already-cooked Italian sausage slices with cooked bell peppers and chopped tomatoes for a flavorful dish, great by itself or stuffed into a hoagie bun.
ingredients: Frozen Johnsonville® Mild Italian Sausage Slices: 1 package (22 ounces)
Canned diced tomatoes (with basil, garlic, and oregano): 1 (14.5 ounce) can
instructions: Get a big skillet hot. Put in the sausage, peppers, onion, and garlic with the oil. Cook them until the veggies are soft, which takes about 10 minutes.
Toss in the tomatoes and pepper flakes. Keep cooking and stirring for 5 minutes, until everything is hot.
If you want, put the mixture into rolls to eat.
author: From the Kitchen at Johnsonville Sausage

title: Spicy Coconut Shrimp with Tomatoes and Mushrooms
description: This recipe brings together shrimp, mushrooms, and tomatoes in a warm, spicy coconut-curry broth. It's great over any kind of rice, like Jasmine.
ingredients: Large shrimp, uncooked, peeled and deveined: 24 pieces
Hunt's® Diced Tomatoes, drained: 1 (14.5 ounce) can
instructions: Put salt and cayenne pepper on the shrimp.

Heat olive oil in a big pan over medium heat. Add the red onion and cook it for 1 minute. Then, put in the garlic and ginger and cook for 30 seconds. Next, add the lime juice and the shrimp, cooking until the shrimp turn pink, which takes about 1 minute on each side. Move the cooked shrimp into a small bowl.

Pour the drained diced tomatoes, mushrooms, chicken broth, and crushed red pepper into the same pan. Cook this mix until the mushrooms start to get soft, around 5 minutes. Stir in the coconut milk, curry powder, fish sauce, and chopped Thai basil. Let it cook until everything is hot all the way through. Put the shrimp back into the pan and cook for 1 more minute.
Serve your dish with a lime wedge on the side and sprinkle fresh cilantro on top if you want to.
author: Kim's Cooking Now

title: Flavorful Broth-Cooked Rice with Spinach
description: This simple recipe transforms regular rice into a tasty side dish by cooking it in chicken broth and adding fresh spinach and Parmesan.
ingredients: Chicken Broth (Swanson® Chicken Broth, Swanson® Certified Organic Chicken Broth, or Swanson® Natural Goodness® Chicken Broth): 1¾ cups
Uncooked long-grain white rice: ¾ cup
instructions: Get your broth and Italian seasoning hot in a 2-quart saucepan over medium-high heat until it boils.

Add the rice and spinach to the saucepan and stir them in. Turn down the heat to low. Put the lid on and cook for 20 minutes, or until the rice is soft. Mix in the cheese. Serve with more cheese on top.
author: Campbell's Kitchen

title: Italian Sausage and Bell Pepper Pasta
description: This recipe came from an Italian woman I used to work with. She told me it was a family favorite she often made because it fed a lot of people and even picky eaters enjoyed it. When I have guests, I just make a double batch. Now, my own family loves this dish too!
ingredients: Sweet Italian pork sausage, sliced into 1/2-inch pieces: 1 pound
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
instructions: Warm the olive oil in a Dutch oven or a big skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the sausage in separate groups until both sides are brown, which takes about 5 minutes. Take the cooked sausage out and put it on a plate while you cook the rest. Put all the sausage back into the Dutch oven, then add the onion and garlic. Cook and stir until the onion looks clear, about 5 minutes. Mix in the red and green bell peppers. Continue cooking until the peppers are soft, for another 7 to 10 minutes.

Stir in the diced tomatoes, marinara sauce, red wine, and parsley. Add salt and pepper to your liking. Cover the pot and let it simmer, stirring every now and then, until all the vegetables are tender, around 30 minutes.

While the sauce simmers, get a big pot of lightly salted water to a rolling boil on high heat. Once the water is boiling, put in the linguine and let it come back to a boil. Cook the pasta without a lid, stirring from time to time, until it's cooked through but still a little firm when you bite it, about 11 minutes. Drain the pasta well using a colander in the sink. Serve the sauce over the linguine.
author: Jennifer Pease Rudolph

title: Easy Thai-Style Pesto Sauce
description: This sauce brings big Thai flavors to your noodles, salads, rice, or whatever you're making! Eat it right away or put it in a sealed container in the fridge for later.
instructions: Put the cilantro, peanut butter, garlic, olive oil, ginger, fish sauce, brown sugar, and cayenne pepper into a blender. Blend everything until it's smooth.
author: she_cooks

title: Shrimp and Clam Linguine with Garlic Butter Sauce
description: This is a personal favorite recipe that I often make when friends and family visit. It's surprisingly simple, and even if you're not a fan of capers, they really add something special here. If you absolutely can't stand them, you can put them in an empty tea bag, tie it up, and take it out before you serve the dish. But honestly, I've never had anyone complain! This meal is great for entertaining or for a cozy dinner for two. I suggest serving it with a simple spinach salad and some good Italian bread.
ingredients: Salt and pepper: to your taste
Clams in shell, scrubbed: 2 ½ pounds
instructions: Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Put the pasta in and let it cook for 8 to 10 minutes until it's al dente, then drain the water.
Heat your oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).

Melt the butter in a large, heavy skillet. Add the chopped red pepper, sliced zucchini, chopped garlic, and chopped shallots. Cook this over high heat until the shallots start to get soft, which takes about 4 minutes. Stir in the capers, salt, and pepper. Take the skillet off the heat, then add the clams and shrimp. Mix everything together well.

Move this mixture into a large baking dish. Cover it and bake in the hot oven until all the clams open up and the shrimp are cooked through. Make sure the lid isn't touching the shrimp, or they might burn and stick. Cook for about 20 to 25 minutes, stirring it sometimes.
Pour the cooked scampi mixture over the linguine, sprinkle fresh basil on top, and serve.
author: DONNA123

title: Grilled Tri-Tip with Thai Marinade
description: I much prefer making beef tri-tip over small beef satay skewers. I've also never made satay without poking my finger with a bamboo skewer. This recipe is less work, and you can cook it in many ways.
ingredients: Beef tri tip roast, trimmed: 1 (2 1/2 pound) piece
instructions: In a big mixing bowl, put the garlic, bruised and chopped lemon grass, grated ginger, grated onion, fish sauce, rice vinegar, soy sauce, coriander, cumin, turmeric, cayenne pepper, brown sugar, and vegetable oil. Whisk everything until mixed well.

Move the tri tip roast into the marinade. Use a fork to poke both sides of the roast many times to get the marinade inside. Cover it with plastic wrap. Put it in the fridge for 2 to 12 hours. While it's marinating, take the meat out of the fridge sometimes to flip it and poke it more with the fork.
Take the roast out and put it on a tray with paper towels to dry off for a bit. Keep the marinade.
Heat your covered grill to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Lightly oil the grill grates.

Cook the roast with the lid closed, using indirect heat. Baste it with the marinade and turn it every now and then. Cook it for about 35 to 45 minutes, depending on how hot your grill gets. An instant-read thermometer put into the middle should show 130 to 135 degrees F (54 degrees C). Move the roast to a cutting board and let it sit for at least 20 minutes before you slice it.
Put any marinade left over into a pot; bring it to a boil. Let it simmer for 1 or 2 minutes. You can use this as a sauce when serving.
author: Chef John

title: Spicy Chicken and Pineapple Fried Rice
description: This recipe captures the taste of Bangkok street food, which I picked up on a recent trip. You can serve it in a hollowed-out pineapple if you want to be fancy.
ingredients: Red Thai bird chile pepper, chopped fine: 1
Tiger prawns, peeled and deveined: 4 ounces
instructions: Put the diced bacon into a wok or big skillet. Cook it over medium-high heat, stirring, until it's crispy, which takes about 10 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to take out the bacon, but leave the drippings in the pan. Next, cook the sliced shallots in the bacon drippings over medium-high heat for 1 to 2 minutes, until they smell good and turn light brown.

Add the chicken to the shallots. Let it cook without stirring for 45 seconds to 1 minute until one side is brown, then stir it. Keep cooking for about 1 more minute until the chicken is browned all over. Mix in 2 teaspoons of the curry powder until the chicken is fully coated.

Push the chicken to the sides to make an empty space in the middle. Pour the oil into this space, then add the beaten egg yolks. Cook and stir the egg yolks for 1 to 2 minutes until they are set. Now, add the rice and stir everything together, breaking up any clumps of rice.

Stir the chopped chile pepper, cilantro, soy sauce, the rest of the 2 teaspoons of curry powder, fish sauce, and sugar into the rice mix. Add the shrimp and cook for about 2 minutes until they are fully cooked and pink. Finally, fold in the pineapple, green onions, and the cooked bacon with the rice.
author: eatvancity

title: Mixed Seafood Bake for Two
description: This dish brings together four types of seafood for a rich flavor that's perfect for a special meal. It's a simple way to make something tasty.
instructions: First, butter two baking dishes that hold 2 cups each. Put one sole fillet in the bottom of each dish. Then, add layers of scallops, crab, shrimp, and cheese. Top with a second sole fillet. Set these aside.
Get your oven hot by setting it to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).

Melt your butter. In a bowl, put the egg yolks, lemon juice, mustard, and salt. Mix this well on high speed. Slowly pour in the melted butter in a steady stream until the sauce gets thick and creamy. Pour this sauce over the fish fillets in the dishes.
Cook in the hot oven for 10 to 15 minutes. After baking, sprinkle the parsley and paprika on top. Then, serve it right away.
author: Carol A. Giorgio

title: Healthy Zucchini Noodle Pad Thai
description: This recipe is a lighter take on classic Pad Thai. Don't forget to put out extra lime wedges when you serve it.
ingredients: Skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes: 12 ounces
instructions: Make noodles from the zucchini with a spiralizer.
Get a small bowl and whisk together the chicken stock, tamarind paste, soy sauce, oyster sauce, chile pepper sauce, Worcestershire sauce, lime juice, and sugar until the sauce is smooth.

Put sesame oil in a wok or large skillet and heat it on high. Add the garlic and stir it until you can smell it, which takes about 10 seconds. Then, put in the chicken and shrimp; stir and cook this until the chicken is not pink inside and its juices are clear, about 5 to 7 minutes.

Move the chicken and shrimp to the sides of the wok to clear the middle space. Pour in the eggs and scramble them until they are firm, which takes 2 to 3 minutes. Add the zucchini noodles and the sauce; stir and cook them, adding water if needed, for about 3 minutes. Put in 2 cups of the bean sprouts and the green onions; stir and cook until everything is mixed, for 1 to 2 minutes.
Take the wok off the heat and sprinkle the peanuts over the noodles. Serve it with the last 1 cup of bean sprouts and fresh basil on top.
author: Andrea Nicole

title: Hearty Spaghetti Sauce with Tomatoes
description: This is a classic spaghetti sauce with a tangy taste.
instructions: In a saucepan, put in the diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, garlic powder, sugar, parsley, salt, oregano, basil, and pepper. Get it boiling. Turn the heat down to medium-low, put a lid on the saucepan, and let it cook gently for about 30 minutes so the tastes mix well.
author: Soulfood

title: Bacon Carbonara, Italian Style
description: This is a real Italian carbonara dish, made with bacon, just like the old coal miners used to make it.
ingredients: Olive oil: 2 tablespoons, split into two uses
instructions: Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Put the spaghetti in the boiling water and cook it, stirring sometimes, until it's soft but still a little firm, around 12 minutes.

At the same time, put the bacon in a big pan and cook it on medium-high heat. Turn it over sometimes until it's brown all over, about 10 minutes. Take the bacon out and put it on paper towels to drain. Keep 2 tablespoons of the bacon fat in the pan and throw the rest away. Once the bacon is cool enough to touch, cut it into pieces.

Pour 1 tablespoon of olive oil and the chopped onion into the pan with the bacon fat. Cook this on medium-high heat for about 5 minutes, until the onion gets soft and clear. Add the crushed garlic and cook it until it smells good, about 1 minute. Pour the vermouth into the pan and bring it to a boil. Use a wooden spoon to scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan for about 1 minute. Stir in the chopped bacon.

Drain the spaghetti and move it to a big serving bowl. Mix in the other 1 tablespoon of oil. Put the bacon-onion mix, Parmesan cheese, cream, beaten eggs, and pepper into the hot pasta. Stir everything until the spaghetti is covered well and the sauce is creamy.
author: ShaneRyan

title: Grilled Chicken Thighs with Thai Marinade
description: Anyone who loves grilled chicken and Asian flavors will really like this dish. The marinade hits all the right notes: savory, sweet, spicy, and salty. These chicken thighs will turn out super juicy and make everyone happy. Try serving them with jasmine rice, grilled or stir-fried vegetables, or a cool cucumber salad. Finish with some chopped cilantro and lime wedges on the side.
instructions: In a bowl, mix together the soy sauce, fish sauce, brown sugar, cilantro, sesame oil, ginger, Sriracha, garlic, lime juice, and lemongrass paste.
Place the chicken thighs into a plastic bag that seals. Pour the marinade over the chicken. Let it sit for 2 hours, or even overnight for a stronger flavor.
Get your grill ready by heating it to medium-high and oiling the grill grates.
Take the chicken thighs out of the marinade. Throw away the used marinade.

Cook the chicken thighs on the grill. They need to be cooked until the middle is no longer pink and the juices run clear. This usually takes about 3 minutes on each side. A meat thermometer put into the thickest part should show at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
Once done, take the chicken off the grill. Let it sit for a few minutes before you cut and serve it.
author: lutzflcat

title: Lasagna with Italian Sausage, Mushrooms, and Cream Sauce
description: This amazing lasagna gets an extra special touch from the creamy bechamel sauce. I like to use part-skim ricotta and mozzarella, plus low-fat milk, to reduce some of the fat in this meal. You won't even notice the difference in taste.
ingredients: Bulk mild Italian sausage: ½ pound
No-boil lasagna noodles: 1 (9 ounce) package, divided
Shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese: 1 (16 ounce) package, divided
Grated Parmesan cheese: ½ cup, divided
instructions: Set your oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Put the sausage in a skillet over medium heat. Cook it until it's browned and crumbly, which takes about 10 minutes. Drain the sausage and set it aside.

To make the bechamel sauce, melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in the flour. Let the flour and butter cook until they are light and foamy, about 2 minutes, making sure to whisk it all the time. Slowly whisk in the milk. Add the salt and nutmeg, then bring the sauce to a gentle simmer, whisking constantly until it thickens, around 10 minutes. Take the sauce off the heat and set it aside.
In a bowl, beat the egg. Stir in the ricotta cheese and parsley until everything is mixed well.

To put the lasagna together, pour about 1 1/2 cups of marinara sauce into the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Place 4 lasagna noodles on top of the sauce, letting them overlap if needed. On the noodles, add a layer of 1/3 of the ricotta mix, then 1/3 of the cooked sausage, 1/3 cup of mushrooms, 1/4 of the bechamel sauce, 1 cup of the mozzarella cheese, 1/8 cup of the Parmesan cheese, and 1 more cup of marinara sauce. Repeat these layers two more times. Finish with a final layer of noodles topped with marinara sauce, bechamel sauce, the rest of the mozzarella cheese, and the rest of the Parmesan cheese. Cover the dish with foil.

Bake the lasagna in the hot oven until it's bubbly and the noodles are soft, about 1 hour. Take off the foil and continue baking for about 5 more minutes until the cheese on top turns brown. Let the lasagna sit for 10 minutes before you cut into it.
author: Valerie Brunmeier

title: Simple Italian Tomato Sauce
description: Here's a straightforward recipe for real Italian tomato sauce. It gets its flavor from good olive oil, garlic, and fresh basil. You can put it on your favorite pasta, or use it for pizza, gnocchi, and other dishes.
instructions: Get a saucepan and warm the oil in it over low heat. Put the chopped onion and garlic in. Stir and cook until they are soft and clear, which takes about 5 minutes. Then, add the passata, basil, and salt. Put a lid on it and let it cook gently over medium heat, stirring every now and then, until the sauce gets thicker. This will take about 20 minutes. Before you serve it, take out the garlic pieces.
author: SilviaG

title: Fresh Tomato & Basil Crostini
description: This appetizer is light and fresh, perfect for a quick and flavorful bite.
ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper: to taste
High-quality balsamic vinegar: 1 tablespoon, or as desired
instructions: Mix the tomatoes, basil, 3 tablespoons of olive oil, red onion, garlic, red wine vinegar, and pepper together in a bowl. Let this tomato mix sit out at room temperature for 15 minutes, then put it in the fridge to soak for 45 minutes.
Place an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat and turn on your oven's broiler.
Brush one side of each bread slice with the rest of the olive oil. Put these bread slices, oiled side up, onto a baking sheet.

Broil the bread until it's golden brown, which takes about 2 minutes; then take it out of the oven. Spoon the tomato mixture evenly over the toasted bread. Drizzle balsamic vinegar evenly over the top of the tomato mixture. Serve right away.
author: Francine Lizotte Club Foody

title: Crunchy Baked Tortilla Bowls
description: You can make these tortilla bowls in the oven, so they're nice and crispy without all the grease from deep frying. Just keep an eye on them to prevent the bottoms from burning while they get crunchy.
instructions: Warm up your oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Brush oil on both sides of each tortilla.

Turn a ramekin upside down on your counter. Center one tortilla on the bottom of the ramekin and gently press it down around the sides. Put a double layer of aluminum foil over the tortilla and press it into the ramekin shape. Place this right-side up on a baking sheet. Leave about half an inch of the tortilla's edge uncovered by the foil so it can brown. Do the same thing for the second tortilla.

Put the baking sheet in the hot oven for 5 minutes. Take the sheet out, then carefully use tongs to pull the ramekins out from inside the tortilla shells. Put the sheet back into the oven. Bake the shells until they look lightly browned, which takes about 5 more minutes. Take the baking sheet out of the oven.

Carefully take the foil off the shells, but save the foil. Flatten the foil sheets and turn the shells upside down onto them. Bring the foil up around just the bottom part of the shells to keep the top edges safe.

Put the baking sheet back into the oven. Bake until the shells are browned and crunchy, 8 to 10 minutes. Take the sheet out of the oven and flip the shells over again so they are right side up. Place them back on the foil and put the sheet back into the oven for the last crisping, 3 to 5 minutes. Watch them closely so they don't burn.
Take the baking sheet out of the oven. Move the basket burritos to a rack to cool down completely.
author: Chef John

title: Big Batch Italian Meat Sauce
description: This is a rich sauce with sausage, pork pieces, and meatballs. It takes a good amount of time to make, but it's really worth the effort.
ingredients: Diced tomatoes with juice: 3 (14.5 oz) cans
Fresh parsley, chopped: 4 tablespoons, split for use
Pork meat: 1 pound, cut into cubes
instructions: Pour 2 tablespoons of olive oil into a large pot and set it over low heat. Add the chopped onion and two-thirds of the sliced garlic, cooking them for 5 minutes. Next, stir in the tomato sauce, diced tomatoes, water, and tomato paste. Let this mixture simmer gently.

At the same time, warm the rest of the olive oil (2 tablespoons) in a big skillet over medium heat. Cook the remaining garlic for 1 to 2 minutes. Put the sausage in and brown it for about three minutes on each side. After browning, cover the skillet and turn the heat down. Cook for 10 minutes, then take the sausage out of the skillet and cut each one in half. Add these sausage pieces to the tomato mix.

Cook the cubed pork in the same skillet you used for the sausage, over medium heat, until it turns brown. Add this pork to the tomato mixture. Stir in 3 tablespoons of parsley, the Romano cheese, oregano, and salt and pepper. Keep the sauce simmering on low heat.

Get your oven ready by heating it to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a cookie sheet with aluminum foil. In a large bowl, mix the ground sirloin, bread crumbs, garlic powder, the rest of the parsley, Parmesan cheese, and eggs. Roll the meat mixture into 1-inch balls and place them on the lined cookie sheet. Bake them until they are golden brown, which should take around 20 minutes. Add these meatballs to the sauce. Let the sauce continue to cook for another 5 hours. Serve it over fusilli pasta or ravioli.
author: SHELLIE1111

title: Spicy Peanut Sauce (Thai-Inspired)
description: You can make this strong, tasty peanut-based sauce as hot as you like. It tastes really good with noodles or chicken.
instructions: In a small bowl, mix the brown sugar, rice wine, and rice wine vinegar until it's smooth.

Put the coconut milk and peanut butter in a small pot on low heat. Heat and stir until the peanut butter is melted, but don't let the coconut milk boil. Stir the sugar mix into the coconut milk mix. Pour this into a bowl, then stir in the soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, chili sauce, ginger, and fish sauce.
author: GRANTALDRICH

title: One-Pan Beef and Ramen with Italian Flavors
description: If you prefer less heat, simply use fewer pepperoni slices in this dish.
ingredients: 2 packages (3 ounces each) beef-flavored ramen noodles
Green bell pepper: 1, cut into strips
instructions: Warm a large skillet on medium-high heat. Put the ground beef and pepperoni slices in the hot skillet. Cook and mix them until the beef is fully browned, which takes about 5 to 7 minutes. Add the tomatoes, water, and the seasoning from the ramen noodle packets to the beef mixture and stir.
Break the ramen noodle blocks in half and toss them into the beef mixture along with the green bell pepper. Let this cook until the noodles become soft, around 5 minutes.
Take the skillet off the heat. Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese over the beef mixture, then put a lid on the skillet. Let it sit for 2 to 3 minutes until the cheese is melted.
author: mastbath

title: Ground Turkey Patties with Thai Flavors
description: These turkey burgers get their Southeast Asian taste from fresh ginger, garlic, and coriander. To make them gluten-free, just swap in gluten-free soy sauce and breadcrumbs. You can eat them as is, or put them on a bun, whether it's gluten-free or whole wheat.
ingredients: Fresh ginger, minced: 1 ½ tablespoons (add more if you like)
Salt and black pepper to taste: 1 pinch
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together the egg and soy sauce. Then, add the cilantro, green onions, ginger, garlic, salt, and pepper. Mix in the ground turkey and bread crumbs well, then shape the mixture into 4 burger patties.

Warm a big non-stick skillet over medium heat. Put the patties in the hot pan, cover it, and cook them for about 15 minutes, flipping them once, until the middle is no longer pink. Use a meat thermometer to check; it should show at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C) in the center.
author: Tracy Mckerk

title: Copycat Italian Restaurant Salad Dressing
description: Make a salad dressing just like the one you get at that well-known Italian restaurant.
instructions: In a bowl, mix the salad dressing, minced garlic, basil, oregano, and sugar until combined. Put it in the fridge for a full day, then serve cold.
author: Colleen

title: Hearty Pasta Sauce with Merlot
description: This sauce recipe comes from my time in Italy, and it's a real crowd-pleaser. The Merlot and chicken bouillon are key to its special flavor.
ingredients: Salt and ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Warm the olive oil in a big saucepan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic. Cook this, stirring, until the onion looks clear, about 5 to 7 minutes.

Mix in the tomato sauce, diced tomatoes, wine, tomato paste, chicken bouillon granules, basil, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper with the onion mixture. Bring it to a boil, then turn the heat down low. Let it gently simmer, stirring often, for 1 hour.
author: Celeste Debruzzi

title: Hearty Italian Seafood Stew
description: This recipe is perfect for a hungry family; they'll really enjoy it. Just spoon the soup into bowls when it's done.
ingredients: Cod fillets, cut into chunks: 1 ¼ pounds
Large shrimp, peeled and deveined: 1 pound
instructions: Over medium heat, melt the butter in a large braising pan. Cook the onions and garlic in the melted butter, stirring occasionally with a wooden spoon, until the onions become soft, which takes about 5 to 7 minutes.

Add the chicken broth, diced tomatoes, wine, water, basil, thyme, oregano, red pepper flakes, and bay leaves to the onion and garlic mixture. Put a lid on the braising pan and let the mixture simmer until the tomatoes are soft and the broth has good flavor, about 30 minutes.

Stir the cod, shrimp, scallops, clams, and mussels into the broth. Bring everything to a boil, then turn the heat down to low. Put the lid back on and keep simmering until the clams open up, which takes 5 to 7 minutes.
author: Cindy Anschutz Barbieri

title: Salmon with Mediterranean Topping
description: This salmon dish gives a fresh spin to a common recipe. It's good for you, tastes great, and everyone will enjoy it. You might want to make extra since people will likely want more! It's especially good served on top of couscous. If you really like tomatoes, feel free to use a full cup instead of just half a cup.
ingredients: Tomatoes: 1/2 cup, chopped (or more if you like)
instructions: Warm up 1 teaspoon of olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Put the salmon in the hot oil. Cook it until it's done and breaks apart easily with a fork, which takes 5 to 7 minutes on each side.

In another pan, heat the 2 tablespoons of olive oil on medium. Add the garlic and cook until it smells good, about 1 minute. Stir in the tomatoes and cook them for about 5 minutes until they are warm. Pour the balsamic vinegar into the tomato mix, then add the basil. Keep cooking and stirring the tomato mixture for about 3 minutes so the tastes come together.
Put the cooked salmon onto a plate and spoon the tomato sauce over the top.
author: Honour232

title: Tripe in Roman Style
description: When you make tripe this way, it has a nice, mild taste, but it's still unique. If you're looking for an amazing sauce to dip crusty Italian bread into, this recipe is perfect.
ingredients: Salt and ground black pepper, to taste
Freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, to taste: 1/4 cup
instructions: Get a big stockpot and put in the water, tripe, vinegar, salt, vanilla, and bay leaf. Turn the heat to high. Once it boils, skim off any foam on top. Turn the heat down to medium-low, cover the pot, and let it cook for 1 1/2 hours. Take the tripe out and set it on a plate to cool. Keep 1 to 2 cups of the cooking liquid aside.

Warm up the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the pancetta and onion to the pan; cook and stir these until the pancetta is brown and the onion is see-through, which takes about 6 to 7 minutes. Stir in the garlic with the pancetta mix; cook and stir until you can smell it, around 2 minutes.
Stir the marinara sauce, 1 cup of the saved tripe liquid, and the red pepper flakes into the pancetta mixture. Turn the heat down to low and let it cook for 30 minutes.
Cut the tripe into 1-inch cubes and put them into the marinara-pancetta sauce; mix them together. If you need to, add another 1 cup of the saved tripe liquid. Let it cook for 30 minutes.
Mix the garbanzo beans and mint into the sauce. Add salt and black pepper until it tastes right. Sprinkle Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese on top and serve it.
author: Chef John

title: Italian Farro Pilaf with Sun-Dried Tomatoes
description: This recipe is quite flexible. You can swap out the farro for rice if you need to, but farro is really good. You can also turn this into a main course for four people by adding a pound of meat, like diced chicken.
ingredients: Sun-dried tomatoes (packed in olive oil with garlic, drained and chopped): ⅔ cup
instructions: Get the farro, chicken bouillon, and water to a boil in a saucepan. Turn the heat down to medium-low, put a lid on it, and let it cook gently until the farro is soft and all the liquid is gone, which takes 20 to 25 minutes. Pour out any extra water.

In a skillet, cook and stir the sun-dried tomatoes and basil with the mushrooms over medium heat until the mushrooms are a bit soft, about 5 minutes. Toss in the squash and cook for another 10 minutes until it's tender. Add the farro to the squash mix and stir it all together until everything is hot, about 2 to 3 minutes. Sprinkle the Parmesan cheese over the farro pilaf.
author: Jennifer Hayes Ryjewski

title: One-Pan Breakfast with Potatoes, Sausage, and Eggs
description: This recipe for a hearty one-pan meal featuring new potatoes, Italian sausage, and eggs comes from Sandra's Easy Cooking, part of the Potatoes USA Potato Lovers Club Program.
ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper: ½ teaspoon
Minced fresh rosemary leaves: ½ tablespoon
Chives or scallions, sliced: for garnish
instructions: Put the potatoes in a bowl, then toss them with the salt and pepper until they are covered well. Heat up the oil in a heavy, oven-safe skillet. Carefully drop in the potatoes, a few at a time.
Use tongs to flip the potatoes several times while they cook. This helps them brown evenly.

When they are about halfway cooked, add the onion and mix it in as they continue to cook. The potatoes should be crispy when they are done. Sprinkle on the rosemary leaves. If you want, spoon out any extra oil.
While the potatoes cook, brown the Italian sausage in a nonstick pan over medium-high heat for a few minutes, until it's no longer pink.

Add the cooked sausage to the potatoes and onion. Mix everything together well. Crack the eggs into the pan, sunny-side up, and add a few dashes of salt to season them. Try to place the eggs between the potatoes so the whites spread around and under the potatoes and sausage; try not to break the yolks. Once the egg whites are almost set, turn on your broiler to high and set a baking rack in the middle of the oven.

Move the pan under the broiler for a minute or two. This is just to make sure the egg whites are fully cooked, but the yolks might still be a little runny or soft. If you don't like runny yolks, just leave them under the broiler longer. At the end, sprinkle on the chopped chives or scallions and enjoy!
author: Potato Goodness

title: Spicy Braised Beef with Mashed Sweet Potatoes
description: This recipe features beef stew meat cooked until it's super soft in a rich, slightly spicy red chile sauce. It's then served over creamy mashed sweet potatoes.
ingredients: Vegetable oil: 2 tablespoons, or as needed
Mexican guajillo red chile cooking sauce (like Herdez®): 1 (12 ounce) bottle
instructions: Get a large pot and put the potatoes in it. Cover them with water and bring it to a boil. Turn the heat down to medium-low and let them simmer gently until they are soft all the way through when you poke them with a sharp knife, which takes about 40 to 45 minutes.
While the potatoes cook, mix the paprika, oregano, cumin, salt, and black pepper in a small bowl. Set this seasoning mix aside.

Pour enough oil to cover the bottom of a large saute pan and put it over medium-high heat. Add the beef to the hot pan and sprinkle with the seasoning mix you made. Cook the beef, stirring occasionally, until it's brown on all sides, around 10 minutes. If you have a lot of beef, cook it in batches so you don't crowd the pan. Take the beef out and put it on a plate.

If the pan needs more oil, add some. Then, put in the onion. Cook and stir it until it's soft, about 3 to 5 minutes. Pour in the broth, chile sauce, and tomato paste. Cook and stir until the sauce is mixed well and warm, for another 3 to 5 minutes. Put the beef back into the pan, bring the sauce to a gentle boil, then lower the heat to low. Cover the pan and let the stew cook for 1 hour.

Drain the sweet potatoes and let them cool down so you can touch them. Use a paper towel to help you take off the skins and throw them away. Put the sweet potatoes in a big mixing bowl. Add the sour cream, butter, and salt. Use a hand mixer to beat them until they are smooth and creamy.
Serve the mashed sweet potatoes onto plates, then put big spoonfuls of stew on top. Sprinkle with the chopped green onions.
author: Valerie Brunmeier

title: Fresh Spinach Pasta from Scratch
description: This recipe helps you make pasta with a nice color and taste from spinach. Getting the amounts just right can be a bit hard, but this guide will show you how to do it.
ingredients: All-purpose flour: 2 cups, or more if needed
instructions: Get a bowl with water and ice ready. Warm up a skillet over medium heat. Put the spinach in the hot skillet. Stir it all the time until the spinach turns bright green, which takes about 30 seconds. Quickly put the spinach into the ice water. Take it out when it's just warm. Use a cheesecloth to squeeze out all the extra water.

Put the spinach, eggs, olive oil, and salt into a food processor. Mix until everything is smooth. Add the flour. Keep mixing until the dough doesn't stick to the blades anymore, adding more flour if you need to.
Form the dough into a ball. Wrap it in plastic wrap. Let it sit at normal room temperature for 20 minutes.

Take off the plastic wrap from the dough. Put the dough on a surface dusted with a lot of flour. Cut the dough into 4 pieces using a sharp knife. Use a rolling pin to flatten the dough pieces to about 1/4-inch thick. Make them into rectangle shapes.

Dust your pasta maker's rollers with flour. Feed the dough rectangles through the pasta maker on the widest setting. Roll the dough through the rollers again and again, making the setting smaller each time until you reach your desired thickness. Change the pasta maker's part to the noodle shape you want. Cut the pasta using the machine.

Get a big pot of water boiling. Carefully put the pasta into the water. Use a spoon to stop the noodles from sticking together. Cook the pasta until it's firm but soft, which takes 3 to 6 minutes. Take the pasta out of the water with tongs and put it into a bowl.
author: The Late Night Gourmet

title: Rustic Chicken with Tomatoes and Olives
description: This is a popular chicken dinner from Italy, a Mediterranean favorite. My go-to recipe features chicken thighs, juicy tomatoes, fresh herbs, and olives.
ingredients: White sugar: 1/4 teaspoon, or more if you like
Salt and black pepper to taste
Chicken broth: 1/2 cup, or more as needed
instructions: Warm 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook the diced onion, mixing often, until it's soft and clear, about 5 minutes. Move the cooked onion to a pot.
In a big bowl, mix the flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Toss the chicken thighs in this flour mix until they are fully covered.

Put the rest of the olive oil (2 tablespoons) in the skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken thighs and cook one side until brown for 5 minutes, do not turn. Flip and cook the other side until brown, about 5 more minutes. Put the browned chicken thighs into the pot with the onion.

Pour the white wine into the skillet; bring it to a boil. Stir to get all the browned bits and flavors from the skillet into the pot. Add the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, and sugar; season with salt and pepper. Add enough chicken stock to cover the chicken. Cover the pot and let it cook gently over medium heat, stirring sometimes, until the chicken is no longer pink inside, around 45 minutes.
Stir in the olives, parsley, and basil. Mix them in to warm everything up.
author: Ita

title: Shrimp Pasta with Cream Sauce and Vegetables
description: This is a simple recipe for pasta with shrimp and fresh veggies in a creamy sauce. It's easy to make and you can change things up depending on what you have.
ingredients: Medium shrimp, uncooked, peeled, and deveined: 1 pound
Heavy cream: 1/2 cup (or more if you like)
Salt and ground black pepper: 1 pinch, to taste
Freshly grated Parmesan cheese: 1 tablespoon (or more if you like)
Fresh basil, chopped: 1 tablespoon (or more if you like)
instructions: Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Put the spaghetti in the boiling water and cook it, mixing sometimes, until it's soft but still a little firm, which takes about 12 minutes. Drain the water out.

While the pasta cooks, warm up the olive oil in a skillet on medium heat. Put the onions in and cook them until they're soft and clear, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook it until it smells good, for about 30 seconds. Stir in the mushrooms and bell pepper; cook these until the bell pepper is soft and the mushrooms have some light browning, taking 3 to 5 minutes. Add the shrimp, white wine, and oregano. Cook until the shrimp are almost done and turning pink, which is 3 to 5 minutes.

Add the cream and butter. Let it gently bubble, stirring all the time, for 8 minutes. Put the cooked spaghetti in, mix it all together, and then turn off the heat. If the cream sauce isn't thick enough, use the flour to make it thicker. Season with salt and pepper, then sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and basil.
author: Littlechef

title: Shrimp and Scallop Risotto
description: For a great seafood risotto, you need good fish stock and the freshest seafood you can find. It's best to cook the shellfish and rice separately. Rice takes more time to cook, and if you cook them together, the shellfish will get overcooked and tough.
ingredients: Uncooked medium shrimp: 1/2 pound, peeled and deveined
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
Fish stock: 1 quart, or more if needed
instructions: Start by heating 3 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Toss in the garlic and cook, stirring, until it begins to sizzle, about 2 minutes. Add the scallops and cook for 1 minute. Next, add the shrimp and season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Cook on high heat until the shrimp turn pink, which takes 3 to 5 minutes.

Pour 1/2 cup of white wine into the skillet and let the alcohol cook off. Scrape the bottom of the pan to loosen any bits; cook until the liquid reduces, about 2 to 3 minutes. Take the skillet off the heat, add the lemon juice, and sprinkle with half of the parsley. Remove the garlic. Cover the skillet to keep the shellfish warm.
Get your fish stock ready by pouring it into a saucepan over medium heat and bringing it to a simmer.

Melt the butter in a separate skillet on low heat. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and the chopped shallot. Cook until the shallot is soft and see-through, but not brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Turn up the heat and add the rice; cook until the rice has soaked up the oil and butter and smells nutty, stirring often, 1 to 2 minutes. Watch closely to make sure the shallot doesn't burn, lowering the heat if the pan gets too hot.

Pour 1/2 cup of white wine into the skillet and stir until the alcohol has evaporated. Add one ladleful of fish stock, stir, and cook until the rice has absorbed the stock. Keep adding one ladleful at a time and repeating this process until the rice is tender, which will take 15 to 18 minutes in total.

About 3 minutes before the risotto is done cooking, add the shellfish and their juices to the risotto pan. Stir everything together and finish cooking, adding more stock if needed. Take the pan off the heat. Mix in the rest of the parsley and 1 tablespoon of extra-virgin olive oil. Let the risotto sit for 2 minutes before serving.
author: tea

title: Hearty French Bean and Meat Stew
description: Making cassoulet takes a good amount of time and various items, some of which are tough to find, and it uses many pots and pans. So, why bother making it? It's simple: cassoulet is one of the tastiest meals you will ever eat. Also, it’s great for improving your observation skills, since no two cassoulets turn out exactly alike, and the cooking times I give are just a general guide.
ingredients: Tarbais beans, or other white beans: 1 pound, soaked overnight
Seasoned chicken stock or broth: 3 quarts
Garlic cloves: 6, unpeeled and cut in half
Reserved bones: from duck confit and pork, if available
Fresh pork shoulder or chop: 12 ounces, cut into 2-inch pieces
Salt and freshly ground black pepper: for seasoning
Toulouse sausages, or other garlic pork sausage: 1 1/2 pounds
Chopped Italian parsley: 1/2 cup, plus extra for garnish
instructions: First, rinse your soaked beans and then drain them well.

Pour the broth into a large pot. Add the chopped pancetta, the bones from the duck confit, and your drained beans. Tie together the bay leaves, peppercorns, thyme sprigs, and garlic in a small piece of cheesecloth to make a bouquet garni; put this into the pot. Stir everything together. Bring it to a simmer over high heat; if foam appears, skim it off if you want. Reduce the heat to low and cook until the beans are almost tender, which should take 30 to 45 minutes.

Sprinkle the pork pieces with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat; brown the pork pieces for 3 to 5 minutes. Move them to a bowl. Add the sausage to the same skillet and cook in the same oil, turning until they are nicely browned on all sides, about 3 to 4 minutes. Cut the sausages in half and put them in the bowl with the pork pieces.

Take the fat and skin off the duck confit and put them into the same skillet. Cook over medium heat until the fat melts out, about 3 minutes. Move all the fat and browned bits from the skillet to a mixing bowl. Add the melted butter. Stir in the bread crumbs and chopped parsley; mix until it looks like wet sand. Stir in about 1/4 to 1/2 cup of the broth.
Turn on your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Put the onions, carrots, and celery into the same skillet you used for browning the meats; add a pinch of salt. Cook and stir over medium heat until the onions are see-through and the mix turns golden, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in the tomato paste; cook and stir until the tomato paste starts to brown and stick to the pan bottom, 3 or 4 minutes. Pour in the white wine; cook and stir until most of the wine has evaporated, 5 or 6 minutes. Take it off the heat.
Drain the beans over a large bowl to save all the cooking liquid. Take out the bones and the bouquet garni.

Put the drained beans into a large, shallow baking dish or a cast iron skillet (about 12 inches across and 3 inches deep). Stir in the cooked vegetables and about 1 cup of broth. Add the pork pieces, spreading them out evenly among the beans. Top with the shredded duck confit. Place the sausage halves into the bean mixture.

Pour cooking liquid into the baking dish until the beans are almost covered. Spread the bread crumb mixture evenly over the top, but don't push it into the liquid. Use your fingertips to make small dents on the crumb surface so it browns better.

Bake in the hot oven until most of the liquid is soaked up, about 2 hours. Take it out of the oven and make a small dip in the middle of the cassoulet crust. Pour about 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid (or more if needed) into the dip to moisten the mixture again. Use a fork to gently poke into the cassoulet to make sure the liquid spreads out fairly evenly, but try not to mess up the crispy top.
Keep baking until the cassoulet's top is crispy and browned, the meat is very tender, and the beans are soft and creamy, about 30 to 45 more minutes.
Serve in big bowls with a spoonful or two of hot cooking liquid. Put some chopped fresh parsley on top.
author: Chef John

title: Smoky Tomato Salsa (No Onion)
description: My mother-in-law enjoys Tex-Mex food, but she can't eat onions. I worked on this recipe a few times and finally made a salsa that tastes like the real deal. The smoky flavor comes from a roasted pepper. I often roast a bunch of these peppers at once so I always have them ready to go.
instructions: Turn on your broiler to preheat it.

Put the poblano pepper and garlic cloves onto a medium baking sheet. Cook them under the broiler, keeping them far from the heat source. Turn the pepper often until it gets brown, which should take about 15 minutes.

Grab a food processor and add the roasted pepper, roasted garlic, tomatoes, cilantro, cumin, chili powder, and lime juice. Use the pulse button to chop everything until it's chunky and even. Put it in the fridge until you're ready to eat it.
author: Susan Baker

title: Braided Pizza Dough with Meats and Cheese
description: Imagine all the delicious fillings of an Italian deli tucked inside a crispy loaf of bread. This braided bread is simple to make with only five items, including ready-made pizza dough.
ingredients: Sliced prosciutto: 2 ounces, torn into ribbons
instructions: Get your oven ready by preheating it to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

On a floured surface, roll out the pizza dough into a rectangle, about 1/8 to 1/4 inch thick. If the dough springs back, let it rest for a bit. Spread the pesto on top, leaving about a 1-inch border. Then, add the provolone cheese, prosciutto, and peppers evenly over the pesto.

Roll the dough up tightly from the long side, finishing with the seam on the bottom. Gently flatten it and dust the top with a little flour. Use a pizza wheel to cut the dough lengthwise into three strips of the same size.

Lay the three strips next to each other, but don't let them touch. The middle strip should be cut-side up, and the other two should have their cut-sides facing inward. Braid the strips together. Then, curl the braided dough to form a round wreath shape, tucking any loose ends under the loaf. Put it onto your prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the hot oven until it turns a nice brown color, which takes about 30 minutes. Let it cool a little before serving, either warm or at room temperature.
author: Chef John

title: Creamy Baked Macaroni and Cheese
description: Everyone loves homemade macaroni and cheese, it's the best comfort food there is!
instructions: Get your oven hot to 350 degrees F.

Boil some lightly salted water in a big pot. Put the elbow macaroni in the boiling water and cook it until it's tender but still a little firm, about 8 minutes, stirring it sometimes. Drain the water from the macaroni.

In an oven-safe pan, melt the butter. Mix in the flour and cook it over heat until it just starts to turn light brown, don't let it get too dark. Take it off the heat and mix in about 1 cup of milk until everything is smooth. Put it back on the heat and let it gently bubble until it starts to get thicker, around 5 minutes. Then, add the rest of the milk and stir it all together.
Toss in all the cheeses and stir until they are melted. After the cheese melts, add the cooked macaroni. Stir it to combine.
Spread the panko crumbs over the top of the macaroni and cheese. Put the pan in the oven. Cook it for about 20 minutes, or until it's bubbly and the bread crumbs are a little golden brown.
author: T-fal

title: My Favorite Pad Thai Salad
description: This is the best Pad Thai I've ever made. Once I started preparing it myself, I couldn't go back to buying it. This dish makes a complete meal, good for people who eat meat and those who don't.
ingredients: Chili powder: 1/4 teaspoon, or to your liking
Lettuce: 1 head, chopped, or as much as you need
Fresh bean sprouts: 1/2 cup, or to your liking
instructions: Put the noodles in a bowl and cover them with hot water. Let them sit until they are soft, about 10 minutes. Then drain the water.

Get a large pot and mix the sugar, water, lime juice, soy sauce, fish sauce, and tamarind. Cook this over medium heat. Let it gently bubble, stirring sometimes, until the sauce gets a bit thicker, which takes 3 to 5 minutes.

Warm up the peanut oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the garlic and stir it just until you can smell it, for 30 seconds to 1 minute. Put in the eggs next; cook and stir them until they are almost firm, about 2 to 3 minutes. Add the drained noodles to the egg mix. Stir in half of the sauce. Keep cooking and stirring the noodle mix until it's hot, adding more sauce if you want, for another 2 to 3 minutes. Sprinkle paprika and chili powder over the noodles.

Spread the lettuce on a serving plate or in separate bowls. Drizzle flaxseed oil over the lettuce. Put the noodle mixture on top of the lettuce. Finish by adding bean sprouts, green onion, cilantro, and peanuts. Serve with the lime wedges.
author: Carrie Medina

title: Sweet Vanilla Whipped Cream
description: This recipe makes whipped cream that's extra sweet and really smooth. My family enjoys it on things like pancakes and chocolate mousse, or anytime something needs a little more sweetness.
instructions: Take a sharp knife and cut the vanilla bean in half the long way. Hold the pod open and use the flat side of the knife to scrape out the seeds from both halves. Put the seeds into a big bowl, and throw away the empty pod.

Add the heavy cream, sugar, and vanilla extract to the bowl with the vanilla seeds. Use an electric mixer to beat the mixture until soft peaks appear, which should take about 3 to 5 minutes. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and put it in the fridge until it's time to serve.
author: MonicaA.

title: Flavorful Pork Tacos with Citrus Marinade
description: Make real Cuban-style tacos at home using simple tastes like garlic, cumin, and oregano. You just add spices and citrus to pork, rub it in for 5 minutes, and then bake it. These juicy pork tacos will be ready in under 45 minutes.
instructions: Get your oven hot to 375°F. In a small bowl, mix everything except the pork and tortillas. Poke the pork a few times with a fork. Put the pork into a big plastic bag that seals. Pour the marinade mix over the pork; turn it around to cover it well. Rub the marinade into the pork for 5 minutes.
Put the pork and the marinade into a glass baking dish. Cover the dish with foil.

Bake for 30 minutes, or until it's cooked how you like it. Let it sit for 10 minutes. Cut the pork into 3 pieces, then pull it apart. Mix the pulled pork with the juices from the pan in the baking dish. Serve it on the warm tortillas with whatever toppings you want.
author: McCormick Spice

title: Pasta with Sausage, Tomatoes, and Herbs
description: This is a dish I always find myself making again. You can change it up a bit to fit what you like. The kind of sausage you pick really changes the flavor. I like to use Sicilian-style chicken sausage for this one. Don't forget to sprinkle some Parmesan cheese on top of each serving.
ingredients: 1 small onion, cut into small pieces
3 cloves garlic, cut into small pieces
Italian chicken sausage: 1 package (12 ounces) (like Trader Joe's® Chicken Sicilian Sausage)
20 cherry tomatoes, cut in half (or more if you want)
instructions: In a big pan, warm up the butter and oil over medium heat. Put in the onion and garlic; cook them, stirring, until the onion gets soft, which takes about 2 minutes.

Turn the heat up high and add the pancetta to the pan. Cook and stir it until it's crispy, for 3 to 5 minutes. Take the skin off the sausages; add the sausage meat to the pan. Cook and stir until it's brown, about 3 to 5 minutes. Pour in the wine and scrape the bottom of the pan to get up any stuck bits.

Toss the mushrooms into the pan. Cook them, stirring sometimes, until they get a bit soft, which is 5 to 10 minutes. Add the tomatoes, basil, oregano, and salt. Mix it all together. Turn the heat down low; cover the pan and let it cook slowly, stirring now and then, until the sauce is thick. This takes 1 to 2 hours.

Fill a big pot with salty water and bring it to a strong boil. Put in the orecchiette and bring it back to a boil. Cook the pasta without a lid, stirring now and then, until it's tender but still a bit firm when you bite it, about 7 minutes. Save 1/2 cup of the cooking water and drain the pasta without rinsing it.

Stir the spinach into the sauce in the pan. Cook until it wilts, about 1 minute. Toss the pasta into the pan and stir to mix everything well. Stir until it's hot all the way through, adding some of the saved pasta water if the sauce seems too thick.
author: Staci

title: Hearty Meat Sauce with Pork and Sausage
description: This is a basic sauce recipe featuring meatballs, pork, and sausage. It tastes great by itself, on a sandwich, or with any kind of pasta. It's a traditional Abruzzi style recipe.
ingredients: Extra virgin olive oil: 4 tablespoons, split for use
Whole peeled tomatoes: 2 cans (28 ounces each)
Italian flat leaf parsley, chopped: ¾ cup, divided
instructions: Warm up 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a big saucepan over medium heat. Cook the onion and garlic until the onion is soft and clear. Pour in the crushed tomatoes and the whole tomatoes. As you add the whole tomatoes, let them slide through your fingers and crush them roughly before they go into the pot. Season with 1/4 cup of the parsley and 1 teaspoon of garlic powder. Put a lid on it, then turn the heat down low.

In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef chuck, breadcrumbs, 1 teaspoon of garlic powder, 1/8 cup of parsley, the egg, milk, and salt and pepper to taste. Use your hands to blend everything well. Roll the mixture into small meatballs, about the size of a golf ball. Cut all but one hot and one mild sausage link into 1/2 inch pieces.

Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat until it's slightly smoking. Cut open the last hot and mild sausage links and crumble them into the pan. Cook, breaking up the pieces constantly, until they are all golden brown. Move these browned bits to the sauce. Brown the meatballs, the cut sausage pieces, and the pork bones on all sides until they are a deep golden color. You might need to do this in batches, moving them to the sauce once they're browned. Drain any extra fat.

Pour the red wine into the skillet to scrape up all the brown bits from the bottom of the pan. Let the wine cook down until about half of it is left, then add it to the sauce. Stir often, and season with salt and pepper to taste for about another hour after the last meat has been added to the pan. Finish by stirring the rest of the fresh parsley into the sauce. Serve the sauce over your favorite pasta and put the meat on a separate plate.
author: MFLOCCO

title: Pork Chops Stuffed with Italian Cheeses, Grilled on Maple Plank
description: Get ready for a tasty meal! Thick pork chops are filled with a mix of spinach, croutons, and Italian cheeses, then cooked on a maple plank on the grill. It's really good. I usually serve this with steamed broccoli and cold Riesling wine.
ingredients: Boneless pork loin chops: 4 (6 ounce), about 2 inches thick
Shredded Italian cheese blend: ½ cup
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
instructions: Get your outdoor grill ready by preheating it to medium-high heat. Prepare the maple grilling plank by soaking it in water, following the maker's instructions.

Lay the pork chops flat on a clean surface. Cut into each chop from one side, going through the middle, but stop about half an inch from the other side. Open up the two cut sides so they spread out like a book. Set them aside for now.

Melt the butter in a big skillet over medium-high heat. Toss in the chopped onion, garlic, and celery; cook and stir these until the onion turns soft and see-through, which takes about 5 minutes. Add the spinach next, and cook until it wilts, about 3 to 5 minutes. Pour in the chicken broth, then add the croutons; stir everything until the croutons soak up the broth. Take the skillet off the heat, then mix in the Italian cheese blend and the Parmesan cheese. Spoon this vegetable-cheese mix into the pockets of each pork chop. Fold one side of the pork chop over the filling. Arrange the pork chops on the prepared grilling plank. Sprinkle fresh rosemary over them, and season with salt and pepper as you like.
Cover the grill and cook, turning the chops once, until the pork is no longer pink inside and the juices run clear. This will take about 30 minutes.
author: Challengergurl

title: Coconut Chicken & Red Curry Soup
description: I turned our favorite red curry chicken dish into a soup. This way, you get to enjoy every bit of the tasty sauce.
ingredients: Cooked basmati rice: 1 and a half cups
instructions: Put the curry paste in a big, heavy pot on medium-high heat. Cook it for 1 to 2 minutes until you see the oils come out. Toss in the red pepper and onion, then stir and cook for about 5 minutes until they are soft. Mix in the coconut milk until everything is blended well. Next, add the fish sauce, and then the chicken stock.

Turn the heat down to low and let it simmer for 15 minutes. Put in the cooked chicken and rice. Stir it on the heat until it is warm all the way through. Just before you serve, add the chopped cilantro.
author: Ginacooks

title: Mexican-Style Farro Dish
description: I picked up how to make Spanish rice while working at a Mexican place years ago. In this recipe, we're using farro instead of rice. I actually think it's even simpler to get right than rice.
ingredients: Kosher salt: 1½ teaspoons, or to your liking
Pearled farro, rinsed and well-drained: 1 cup
instructions: Get your oven hot to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Put butter in a heavy skillet with a good lid and melt it over medium heat. Toss in the onions and salt. Stir them around until they're soft and clear, about 5 minutes. Next, add the cumin, ancho chili powder, and chipotle chili powder; keep stirring for about 1 minute. Mix in the tomato paste and cook it for about 2 minutes on medium heat. Add the oregano and the drained farro. Stir until the farro is fully covered in the spice and butter mix, about 2 minutes.
Pour in the chicken broth. Turn the heat up high and let it start to bubble. As soon as it begins to bubble, give it a stir, then put the lid on. Take it off the heat.
Put the pan into the hot oven and bake until the farro is soft, which will take 50 to 60 minutes. Use a fork to fluff up the grains.
author: Chef John

title: Gluten-Free Autumn Minestrone from Northern Italy
description: Enjoy the comforting tastes of fall from Northern Italy in this gluten-free pasta soup. It's perfect for a chilly evening. You can use any pasta shape you like, even broken spaghetti. If you want to freeze some, leave out the pasta and cook it in the soup after thawing.
instructions: Put the cranberry beans in a big container and cover them with several inches of cool water. Let them soak for 8 hours or overnight, then drain the water.
Use a food processor to shred the carrot, yellow onion, celery, and red pepper together. This makes your sofrito mix.

Warm the olive oil in a 7-quart pressure cooker over medium-high heat. Add the sofrito mix and cook until it softens, which takes about 3 to 5 minutes. Then, add the soaked beans, potatoes, diced carrots, zucchini, pumpkin, and diced onion. Cook and stir for another 3 to 5 minutes until everything is warmed through. Stir in the oregano, rosemary, and bay leaf, making sure the vegetables are well coated with the oil and seasonings.
Pour in enough broth to cover the vegetables by one inch. Close the pressure cooker lid and let it build up pressure for about 10 minutes. Once it starts whistling, cook for another 10 minutes.

Let the pressure release on its own, which takes about 10 minutes, then take off the lid. Taste the soup and add more salt if needed. Pour in more broth so you have enough liquid to cook the pasta. Bring the soup to a boil and add the pasta. Cook, mixing now and then, until the pasta is tender but still a little firm, about 8 minutes. If the soup gets too thick while cooking, add more boiling broth.
Serve the soup into bowls. Top each serving with minced hot pepper and Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.
author: Buckwheat Queen

title: Mexican-Style Hatch Chile Dip
description: This super simple, no-cook dip will make you feel like you're south of the border. It's perfect with tortilla chips!
ingredients: Hatch chile peppers: 5, with stems taken off
Diced tomatoes with roasted garlic: 1 can (14.5 ounces)
Garlic powder: 1 pinch, or to your liking
instructions: Put your oven rack about 6 inches from the heat and turn on the broiler. Cover a baking sheet with foil, then put the Hatch chile peppers on it.

Broil the peppers until their skin turns black and gets bubbly, which takes 5 to 8 minutes. Move the blackened peppers to a bowl and cover it tightly with plastic wrap. Let the peppers steam and cool for about 20 minutes. After that, take off and throw away their skins.

Mix the roasted Hatch chile peppers, regular diced tomatoes, diced tomatoes with roasted garlic, onion, cilantro, and garlic powder in a food processor or blender until it's as smooth or chunky as you like.
author: COOKINGQUEEN75

title: Tuscan Bread and Tuna Salad
description: This salad brings together Italian bread cubes, fresh tomatoes, capers, canned tuna, good olive oil, olives, onion, and cucumber for a special meal.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Italian bread: 2 slices, cut into cubes
Cucumber: 1 medium, peeled and sliced thin
Canned tuna: 1 (5 ounce) can, liquid drained
instructions: Get the dressing ready by mixing the olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Carefully combine the bread, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, tuna, olives, and capers in a large bowl. Pour the dressing over everything and serve right away.
author: BR Cook

title: Sausage and Creamy Pesto Penne
description: This is a fast meal for any weeknight. You can have it on the table in about 15 minutes!
ingredients: Creamy pesto sauce mix (like Knorr®): 1 (1.2 ounce) package
instructions: Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Stir the penne sometimes as it cooks in the boiling water until it's tender but still a little firm, around 11 minutes. Drain the pasta and move it to a bowl.
Put a large skillet on medium-high heat. Cook the sausage in the hot skillet, stirring it, until it's browned and broken up, which takes 5 to 7 minutes. Add this to the pasta.

In a small saucepan, whisk together the pesto sauce mix, milk, and olive oil. Bring this to a boil, making sure to stir it all the time. Turn the heat down to low and let it simmer until it gets thick, for about 3 minutes. Pour this sauce over the pasta and sausage mix, then toss everything to coat it well.
author: BaughHumbug

title: Spicy Buffalo Chicken Noodle Bake
description: This recipe takes all the great tastes from a plate of Buffalo wings and puts them into an easy, cheesy lasagna dish.
ingredients: Chicken stock: 2 cups, or as needed
Salt: 1 teaspoon, or more if you like
Olive oil: 1 tablespoon, or more as needed
instructions: Put the chicken in a big pot in one layer. Pour in enough chicken stock to cover it. Season the stock with paprika, 1 teaspoon of salt, and cayenne pepper. Bring the stock to a boil, then turn the heat down to medium. Let it simmer until the chicken is cooked through and not pink inside, which takes about 15 to 20 minutes. After cooking, shred the chicken.

Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Cook the lasagna noodles in this water, stirring sometimes, until they are soft but still a little firm, around 8 minutes. Drain the water. Lay the noodles out on aluminum foil or parchment paper and spray them with cooking spray so they don't stick together.
Warm up olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook the chopped celery and onion in the skillet, stirring them until they just start to get soft, about 5 minutes.
Turn your oven on to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) to let it heat up.
Mix the cooked onion and celery with the shredded chicken in a bowl. Stir in about a third of the buffalo wing sauce and the blue cheese. Mix everything together well.
In another bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, blue cheese dressing, and the rest of the buffalo wing sauce. Add salt and cayenne pepper to taste. Stir the egg into this mixture.

Spread some of the ricotta mixture on the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish. Lay 3 noodles on top of that. Spread a quarter of the remaining ricotta mix over the noodles. Then add a third of the chicken mix and a quarter of the mozzarella cheese. Put another 3 lasagna noodles on top of the cheese. Repeat these layers two more times, finishing with a layer of ricotta mix and mozzarella cheese on top.
Bake the lasagna in the hot oven until it's cooked through and the top is a light brown color, about 45 minutes. Let the lasagna cool for at least 20 minutes before you cut into it.
author: David Rigie

title: Creamy Thai Red Curry Soup with Shrimp
description: This version of Thai red curry soup uses jasmine rice instead of noodles. We blend the soup until smooth before adding fresh onions and herbs. A bit of lemon juice at the end brightens up the classic flavors. Enjoy this as a light meal, or add more protein or a vegetable side to make it more filling.
ingredients: UNCLE BEN'S® READY RICE® Jasmine: 1 pouch (8.8 ounces)
instructions: Warm 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a big Dutch oven over medium heat. Season the shrimp with salt and pepper. Put the shrimp in the pot and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, or until they turn pink, flipping them once. Take them out and set them aside.

Add the rest of the olive oil, the bell pepper, onion, and garlic to the pot. Cook while stirring sometimes, for about 3 minutes, until they are soft. Mix in the curry paste and ginger. Cook for 1 minute, until it smells good.
Stir in the stock, coconut milk, and rice, making sure to scrape up any bits stuck to the bottom of the pot.

Bring the mixture to a boil over high heat. Then turn down the heat and let it cook, stirring now and then, for about 10 minutes until it thickens a bit. Stir in the fish sauce and brown sugar. Take the pot off the heat.

Use an immersion blender to puree the soup right in the pot. If you don't have one, carefully move the soup in batches to a large food processor or blender, covering the top with a dish towel, and blend until smooth. Put the pureed soup back into the pot.
Stir in the green onions, cilantro, basil, and lime juice. Spoon the soup evenly into 6 bowls and put 3 shrimp on top of each bowl. Serve right away.
author: Uncle Ben's

title: Chicken and Veggie Green Curry
description: I've been making this green curry for years, putting it together bit by bit over time. The vegetables aren't what you'd typically find, but they add good texture and make it more interesting. My family asks for this one a lot, and I hope yours will too. Serve it over some rice.
ingredients: Thai green curry paste: ¼ cup
Ginger: 1 (1/4 inch thick) slice, finely grated
Boneless, skinless chicken breasts: 2, thinly sliced
Baby corn pieces: 1 (15 ounce) can, drained
Red bell pepper: 1, cut into thin strips
Orange bell pepper: 1, cut into thin strips
Thai basil: ¼ cup, thinly sliced (or more if you like)
instructions: Warm the oil in a wok until it starts to shimmer. Put the curry paste, garlic, and ginger in the wok; mix them up and cook until they smell good, about 2 to 3 minutes. Add the chicken slices, stirring them until they are covered. Cook the chicken until it's just a little pink in the middle, for 3 to 5 minutes.

While the chicken is cooking, get a small saucepan. Put the baby corn and bamboo shoots in it, cover them with water, and place the pan over high heat. Bring it to a boil. Drain the water, then cover them with fresh water again.

Pour the coconut milk into the wok. Let it come to a gentle simmer, mixing it now and then, which takes about 5 minutes. Drain the corn and bamboo shoots and add them to the wok. Stir in the fish sauce, palm sugar, and kaffir lime leaves. Bring it back to a simmer and let it cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the bell pepper strips and cook them until they are tender but still have a little crunch, about 3 minutes.
Take the curry off the heat and mix in the Thai basil.
author: Galen Dobbs

title: Quick Ginger Noodle Soup
description: You can make this really great soup in just 30 minutes. It has cooked garlic, crunchy carrot pieces, and rice noodles all in a ginger broth. You top it off with fresh cilantro, green onions, and salty peanuts. It's a light and delicious soup that everyone will like.
ingredients: Swanson® Thai Ginger Flavor Infused Broth: 1 carton (32 ounces)
Carrot: 1 large, peeled and cut into thin 2-inch strips
Wide rice noodles: 1 package (8 ounces), prepared as package says
Fresh cilantro leaves: ⅓ cup, chopped
instructions: Warm the oil in a 2 1/2-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Put in the garlic, then cook and stir it for 45 seconds.
Pour the broth into the saucepan and bring it to a boil. Turn the heat down to medium. Add the carrot and cook for 5 minutes, until it's tender but still a bit firm.
Add the noodles to the saucepan and cook until the whole mix is hot and bubbly. Serve with green onions, cilantro, and peanuts on top, and lime wedges on the side.
author: Campbell's Kitchen

title: Simple Shrimp and Lemon Pasta
description: This meal is a very happy, light dish that's quick to make and full of lemon flavor!
ingredients: Uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined: ½ pound
Lemon zest: ½ teaspoon, or more if you like
Parmesan cheese: 2 tablespoons, or as much as you want
Chopped fresh parsley: 1 tablespoon, or to taste
instructions: Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Put in the penne and cook it, stirring once in a while. It should be tender but still a little firm, which takes about 11 minutes. Drain the pasta and put it aside.

While the pasta cooks, melt the butter in a 10-inch skillet over medium heat. Add the red pepper strips and the garlic; cook these until the peppers are tender but still a bit crisp, about 2 to 3 minutes. Throw in the shrimp and lemon juice; stir them without stopping until the shrimp change to bright pink on the outside and aren't see-through anymore, which takes 4 to 6 minutes. Mix in the cooked pasta and lemon zest, tossing gently to cover everything. Serve it with Parmesan cheese and parsley sprinkled on top.
author: TGRAHAM4

title: Homemade Thai Coconut Chicken Noodle Soup
description: No need to eat out! You can easily whip up this fast and tasty noodle bowl right in your own kitchen.
ingredients: Dried Thai rice noodles: 1 (8 ounce) package
Fresh red chile pepper, minced: 1, or more if you like spice
White sugar: 1 pinch, or to your liking
Fresh basil leaves, chopped: 1 small bunch
instructions: Get a big pot of water boiling. Take it off the heat, put the noodles in, and cover the pot.

Peel the tough outer layers off the lemongrass and throw them away. Roughly chop the pale inside part and put it in a food processor. Pulse it until it's finely chopped, which should take 1 to 2 minutes.

In another big pot, bring the chicken broth to a boil. Add the minced lemongrass, chicken, mushrooms, and red chile pepper. Cook this for 5 minutes. Lower the heat to medium; mix in the coconut milk, ginger, fish sauce, and garlic. Let the soup gently simmer until the chicken reaches at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C) when checked with a thermometer, about 10 to 15 minutes.
Move the chicken to a cutting board, slice it thin, and put it back into the pot. Stir in the lime juice and sugar.
Drain the noodles and put them into individual serving bowls. Pour the soup over the noodles. Top each bowl with a lime wedge, some green onions, and fresh basil.
author: Lux

title: Slow-Cooked Spicy Beef Barbacoa
description: If you enjoy the barbacoa from Chipotle, you'll love making this at home. It's a fantastic, hearty meal. Just put it in a tortilla with black beans, cheese, pico de gallo, and guacamole for a truly delicious experience.
ingredients: Canned chipotle peppers in adobo sauce: 4, or more if you like it spicier
Chuck roast: 1 (4 pound) cut, or more as desired
instructions: Get a blender or food processor. Add the vinegar, lime juice, chipotle peppers in adobo, garlic, cumin, oregano, black pepper, salt, and cloves. Blend on high until the adobo sauce is smooth.
Cut most of the fat off the roast. Then, cut the meat into chunks, about 3 inches big.
Set your oven to preheat at 250 degrees F (120 degrees C).

Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Put the meat in and cook it on all sides until it's browned, which takes 5 to 10 minutes. Move the seared meat to a Dutch oven. Pour the adobo sauce over it, then add the chicken broth and bay leaves.
Bake in the hot oven until the meat is very tender. This will take about 6 hours.
Take out the bay leaves. Use two forks to shred the meat right in the juices. Put it back in the oven and cook for another 30 minutes.
author: She's a cooker

title: Grilled Mahi Mahi by Chef Jimmie Jones
description: This simple recipe from Chef J.J. is great for mahi mahi, a fish that holds up well on the grill and has a light, sweet taste. Enjoy it with a side dish you like, or use it in fish tacos. The recipe comes from Food City's own chef, Jimmie Jones.
ingredients: Food Club® Reduced-Sodium Soy Sauce: 2 tablespoons
Culinary Tours™ Greek Extra-Virgin Olive Oil: 2 tablespoons
Food Club® Pure Ground Black Pepper: ⅛ teaspoon
instructions: Get a glass baking dish and put in the garlic, white wine, lemon juice, soy sauce, olive oil, poultry seasoning, salt, and pepper. Stir it a little to mix everything. Put the mahi mahi steaks in this marinade, then put it in the fridge for 1 hour, turning the fish often.
Warm up an outdoor grill to high heat and put a little oil on the grill grates.

Cook the mahi mahi steaks on the grill for 5 to 6 minutes on each side. Slice 4 pieces from the lemon and grill them too, for about 3 minutes per side. Finish by putting chopped parsley and lemon slices on top of the mahi mahi.
author: Food City

title: Zesty Chicken Fried Rice, Thai Style
description: This is a simple Thai-inspired fried rice recipe. It has nice garlic and cilantro flavors. Serve it with fresh cucumber slices and lime wedges. You can put extra cilantro and a chili fish sauce on top.
ingredients: Boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1/3-inch pieces across the grain: 1 pound
Green onions, thinly sliced: ¼ cup
instructions: In a bowl, mix together the chicken thighs, 2 tablespoons of soy sauce, brown sugar, and black pepper. Cover the bowl and put it in the fridge to marinate for 2 hours, or even overnight.

Warm up a wok or a very big skillet on high heat for 30 seconds. Put the vegetable oil in. Turn the heat down to medium, then add the onion and garlic. Cook and stir these until they smell good, which takes about 2 minutes.
Turn the heat up to high. Put the marinated chicken into the wok. Cook and stir it all the time until it's no longer pink, about 4 minutes.

Move the chicken to one side of the wok. Pour the beaten eggs into the empty space. Let them cook until they just start to firm up, about 2 minutes. Slowly stir the eggs until they are scrambled. Mix them in with the chicken. Season everything with the remaining 3 tablespoons of soy sauce, plus the sugar and white pepper. Stir for 1 minute.

Add the rice to the wok and stir it until it's mixed in well and heated through, about 4 minutes. Take the wok off the heat. Stir in the green onion and cilantro. Mix everything gently until it's combined.
author: natty's pantry

title: Grilled Corn and Veggie Salad
description: This grilled corn salad is bright and full of color. It's a healthy dish that tastes great and works perfectly with a BBQ meal or Mexican food.
ingredients: Monterey Jack cheese: 5 ounces, cut into little cubes
1 orange bell pepper, chopped into small pieces
Black pepper, freshly cracked, as needed
Garlic powder: 1 pinch, or to your liking
instructions: Get your grill ready for medium heat and put a little oil on the grate.
Boil a big pot of water. Put the corn in and cook until it's soft, about 6 minutes. Drain the water.
Place the corn on the hot grill until it gets a little golden, around 5 minutes. Let it cool down for 5 to 10 minutes so you can handle it.

Use a sharp knife to cut the corn kernels off the cobs. Put them into a big bowl. Add the tomato, Monterey Jack cheese, orange bell pepper, cucumber, and cilantro. Stir in the balsamic vinegar, sea salt, pepper, and garlic powder; mix it all together.
author: k8norris

title: Creamy Chicken and Spinach Artichoke Soup
description: This recipe lets you enjoy all the great tastes of spinach artichoke dip, but in a soup that's not quite as heavy.
ingredients: Frozen chopped spinach, thawed: 1 (10 ounce) package
Artichoke hearts, quartered, drained, and chopped: 1/2 (14 ounce) can
instructions: Get a big pot and put the chicken broth, chicken, onion, and garlic in it. Cook this over medium heat until it boils, then turn the heat down. Let it cook gently for about 10 minutes, or until the onion is soft.
