Add the spinach and artichoke hearts to the pot. Bring the soup back to a gentle boil. Drop in the cream cheese in big spoonfuls and keep stirring for about 5 minutes until it's all melted into the soup.
author: MELTROMBONE

title: Grilled Fajita Chicken Salad
description: This recipe makes a great grilled salad with fajita-style chicken. It's low-carb and easy to make. You can add lime wedges and fresh cilantro if you want.
ingredients: Chicken breasts (boneless, skinless), cut into strips: 1 pound
Red bell peppers, cut into 1/4-inch strips: 2
instructions: Put the chicken strips and fajita marinade in a big bowl. Let it sit in the fridge for 1 hour, or even overnight.
Get your outdoor grill ready for medium-high heat. Lightly put oil on the grill grates.
In a bowl, mix the oil, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Clean the romaine lettuce and cut each head in half lengthwise. Brush the cut romaine halves with the oil-garlic mix.
Toss the sliced peppers and onions into the bowl with the oil-garlic mix.
Lay the romaine lettuce halves cut-side down on the oiled grill. Cook just until you see grill marks, about 2 minutes. Take it off the grill and let it cool down.

If you have a grill basket, spread the marinated chicken evenly in it. If not, put the chicken and vegetables on skewers. Grill the chicken for 5 minutes. Flip the chicken in the basket, add the vegetables, and keep grilling until a meat thermometer in the chicken shows 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). This should take about 10 more minutes.
Cut up the grilled lettuce and put it on plates. Divide the cooked chicken and vegetables evenly over the grilled romaine.
author: Baking Nana

title: Roasted Cauliflower and Pasta with Parmesan
description: This dish combines roasted cauliflower and whole garlic with Parmesan and bread crumbs for a comforting meal that's lighter than many others.
ingredients: Cauliflower: 1 medium head, cut into small pieces
Olive oil: 2 tablespoons, or more if you like
instructions: Get your oven hot to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) before you start.
In a big bowl, put the cauliflower, garlic cloves, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Mix them up well. Spread this mix in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Put the baking sheet in the hot oven. Cook until the cauliflower is soft, about 30 minutes, making sure to toss it around at least twice while it cooks.

While the cauliflower roasts, put a big pot of lightly salted water on the stove and bring it to a boil. Add the penne pasta and cook it, stirring sometimes, until it's tender but still a little firm, which takes about 11 minutes.
In a separate bowl, mix the Parmesan cheese, bread crumbs, and cayenne pepper. Set this mix aside for later.

Drain the pasta, but save 1/2 cup of the water it cooked in. Put the pasta into a serving bowl. Add the roasted cauliflower and butter. Stir in the reserved cooking water a little at a time until the sauce is as creamy as you want it. Then, add the lemon juice and the bread crumb mixture, toss everything together, and serve.
author: Rosemary Felle

title: Fresh Vegetable Rolls with Sweet Mango Dip
description: Make these light rolls, full of fresh spring veggies, with a simple mango dipping sauce recipe from Tieghan at Half Baked Harvest.
ingredients: One ripe mango, cut into small cubes
1/2 cup fresh Thai basil and/or cilantro, chopped
One large avocado, peeled, pitted, and sliced thin
Fresh vegetables, thinly sliced or cut into matchsticks (like cucumbers, lettuce, microgreens, carrots, bell peppers): 2 cups total
Salt and black pepper, to taste
instructions: Put all the dipping sauce items, except the basil and cilantro, into a blender. Blend until smooth. Then, add the basil and cilantro, and pulse the blender until they are chopped. Pour this into a bowl, cover it, and put it in the fridge until you serve.
Squeeze a little lime juice over your sliced avocado. Get all your vegetables and herbs ready in a line so they are easy to grab.

Fill a shallow dish with warm water. Take one rice paper sheet at a time and put it in the water for 5 to 10 seconds. Take it out and lay it flat. Near one edge of the wrapper, add 1 or 2 avocado slices, a small amount of fresh cilantro and mint, and a handful of veggies. Sprinkle the veggies with salt and pepper. Fold both ends of the wrapper towards the middle, then roll the sheet up as tightly as you can without tearing it. Place each finished spring roll on a serving plate and cover it with Reynolds Wrap® Aluminum Foil so they don't dry out.
Keep making more rolls with the rest of the ingredients, adding them to the plate as you go. Make sure the spring rolls stay covered with foil all the time.
Serve the spring rolls with the mango dipping sauce and chopped peanuts, if you want.
author: Reynolds Kitchens(R)

title: Baked Chicken Thighs with Creamy Spinach and Tomatoes
description: You can make a full meal with these chicken thighs, veggies, and Italian dressing mix. Just add some crusty bread. It's also great served over pasta, rice, egg noodles, or potatoes.
ingredients: Creamy basil and ricotta pesto (like Barilla®): 2 tablespoons
Dry Italian salad dressing mix (such as Good Seasons®): 1 tablespoon
Salt and freshly ground black pepper: 1 pinch, to taste
instructions: Melt butter in a skillet. Cook the onion until it gets soft and see-through, which takes about 5 minutes. Take the onion out of the skillet and set it aside.
Get your oven ready by preheating it to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

In a bowl, mix together the Neufchatel cheese, chicken broth, pesto, dry Italian salad dressing, garlic powder, black pepper, Italian seasoning, and red pepper flakes. Use an electric mixer to beat everything until it's well blended. Stir in the spinach and the cooked onions. Gently fold in the tomatoes and basil. Put this mixture into a casserole dish.
Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Place the chicken on top of the spinach mixture in the dish.

Bake in the hot oven for 20 to 30 minutes, or until the chicken is no longer pink inside and the juices run clear. If you use a thermometer, the middle of the chicken should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

Take the chicken out of the casserole dish. Put mozzarella cheese on top of each piece. Microwave until the cheese melts, which should be about 1 minute. Serve the chicken with the spinach mixture on top.
author: Yoly

title: Simple Pad Thai with Shrimp and Smoked Sausage
description: This easy pad Thai recipe brings together shrimp and smoked sausage for a tasty meal. Fresh lime juice and cilantro add a bright touch, while chopped peanuts give a satisfying crunch. Feel free to serve it with sriracha and lime wedges.
ingredients: Hillshire Farm® Smoked Sausage: 1 (14 ounce) package, sliced crosswise into 1/2-inch pieces
Small shrimp: ½ pound, peeled and deveined
Fresh cilantro leaves: ¼ cup, chopped
Roasted salted peanuts: ½ cup, chopped
instructions: Prepare the noodles as directed on the package. Rinse them thoroughly with cold water to keep them from sticking, then set aside.
Warm a large skillet over medium heat. Arrange the smoked sausage in a single layer. Cook each side until it's browned, about 6 minutes in total. Transfer the sausage to a plate.
Put the vegetable oil into the same skillet, then add the shrimp, green onions, and garlic. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes, until the shrimp turns opaque.
While that cooks, get a small bowl and whisk together the soy sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, fish sauce, and 2 tablespoons of water.

Return the noodles and smoked sausage to the skillet, then pour in the soy mixture. Stir everything well to combine. Turn the heat up to medium-high and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, or until the noodles are hot. Mix in half of the cilantro and peanuts. Spoon the pad Thai into serving bowls and top with the rest of the cilantro and peanuts.
author: Hillshire Farm(R) Brand

title: French Toast with Panettone
description: After the Christmas holiday, we had a lot of panettone left over and needed new ways to eat it. My grandpa asked for French toast, so I came up with this holiday version of a popular breakfast dish. If your panettone is hard to handle, you can cut it into smaller pieces before cooking. Serve it hot with maple syrup, whipped cream, or whatever else you like.
instructions: In a shallow bowl, whisk the milk, egg, and cinnamon together. Put the panettone slice into this mixture. Make sure both sides get covered and that the panettone soaks up most of the liquid.
Melt the butter in a nonstick skillet over medium-low heat. Place the panettone in the hot butter. Cook it until it turns golden brown, which should take about 5 minutes on each side.
author: Victoria Gellatly

title: Cheesy Waffle Iron Sandwich with Spinach
description: This sandwich is really simple to put together, and kids can help make it or even use the waffle iron if you watch them. If you want a fun, chewy meal, use multigrain or whole wheat bread.
ingredients: One roma (plum) tomato, cut into thin slices
Salt and ground black pepper, as much as you like
Fresh spinach: 1 cup, or to your preference
instructions: Get your waffle iron hot by following what the maker says.
Put the tomato slices out on a flat surface, letting any extra juice run off. Sprinkle salt and pepper on the tomato slices.

Spread 1/2 teaspoon of butter on one side of each bread slice. Place one bread slice, butter-side down, into the hot waffle iron. Spread 1/2 teaspoon of mustard on the bread slice in the waffle iron. Then, put 1/4 cup of spinach, two slices of mozzarella cheese, one teaspoon of onion, half of the tomato slices, and another 1/4 cup of spinach on top. Lay one more slice of bread, butter-side up, on top of the spinach.
Close the waffle iron and cook the sandwich until it's a little brown, which takes about 2 minutes. Do the same thing with the rest of the stuff.
author: Desiree Howell

title: Grilled Chicken and Burrata Sliders
description: These grilled chicken sliders get an amazing creamy texture from burrata cheese.
ingredients: Boneless chicken breasts (thinly sliced or cutlets): 6
BelGioioso burrata cheese (8 ounce package), sliced to keep filling intact: 1
instructions: Take chicken breasts and cut them in half so they fit on a slider bun. Put salt and pepper on both sides of the chicken. Lightly oil a grill or pan-grill and get it hot over medium heat. Cook the chicken on the grill until it's not pink inside anymore, which takes around 5 minutes per side. Move the cooked chicken off to the side.

Grill the buns with the cut side down until they are toasted. To build each sandwich, put a piece of cooked chicken, a tomato slice, a fresh basil leaf, and a burrata slice between two toasted slider buns.
author: BelGioioso Cheese

title: Smoked Sausage and Pepper Hoagies
description: This recipe makes tasty sandwiches. You cook pieces of Hillshire Farm smoked sausage, onions, and peppers in tomato sauce. Then you put the mix into hoagie buns, add mozzarella cheese, and bake until the cheese is melted.
ingredients: Hillshire Farm Smoked Sausage: 1 package (14 ounces), cut into 1-inch pieces
Yellow onion: ½ cup, sliced thin
Red bell pepper: 1 cup, sliced thin
instructions: Get your oven hot to 425 degrees F.

Warm up a big skillet on medium-high heat. Put the sausage, onions, peppers, and tomato sauce in the skillet. Cook for 8-10 minutes, making sure to stir it a lot. Scoop this mix into the hoagie buns and put them on a baking sheet. Sprinkle the shredded cheese on top. Bake for 3-5 minutes, just until the cheese is gooey and melted.
author: Hillshire Farm(R) Brand

title: Italian Potato Salad with Parsley
description: This potato salad is naturally vegan and a popular dish all over Italy. You'll see it at many different kinds of meals, like fancy lunches, family gatherings, regular dinners, and even in cafeterias. Lots of Italians also put cooked green beans in it. If you have any left over, it's great mixed with pesto and pasta. Enjoy your meal!
ingredients: Garlic cloves, peeled and slightly crushed: 2
Flat-leaf parsley, very finely chopped: ½ cup
Salt and freshly ground black pepper: to taste
instructions: Put potatoes and salt into a big pot filled with cold water. Bring this to a boil. Cook the potatoes until they are soft but not falling apart, which takes about 10 minutes, depending on how big they are. Drain them and let them sit until they are cool enough to touch.
While the potatoes cook, mix 3 tablespoons of olive oil and the white wine vinegar in a small bowl. Add the garlic, then set this mixture aside.

Once the cooked potatoes are cool, peel them and cut them into 1-inch cubes. Put the potatoes, green onions, and parsley into a bowl and gently toss them. Season with salt and pepper. Pour the olive oil mixture over everything and gently toss again, being careful not to break the potato pieces.
Just before you serve, put the last 1 tablespoon of olive oil and the red pepper flakes on top.
author: Buckwheat Queen

title: Hearty Pasta Soup with Italian Sausage
description: This pasta soup is easy to make and very satisfying. Pair it with a simple salad and some crusty bread for a full dinner.
ingredients: 1 can (15 ounce) diced tomatoes (with basil, garlic, oregano)
Salt: 1/2 teaspoon, or as you like it
Ground black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon, or as you like it
instructions: Get a skillet hot over medium-high heat. Put the Italian sausage and onion in it. Cook for about 8 minutes until the sausage is brown and broken up, and the onion is soft and clear.

Pour in the chicken broth, diced tomatoes, pasta, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Bring everything to a boil. Turn the heat down and let it gently bubble for about 10 minutes, stirring now and then, until the pasta is soft. Stir in the ricotta cheese and cook for another 2 to 3 minutes until it's all mixed in well.
When serving, put 2 tablespoons of mozzarella cheese, 1 tablespoon of Parmesan cheese, and 1/2 tablespoon of fresh basil on top of each bowl.
author: Yoly

title: Marinated Eggplant Appetizer
description: This recipe makes thin eggplant pieces that are fried until golden, then soaked in a mix of fresh herbs, garlic, olive oil, and white wine vinegar. Let them sit for 8 hours or even overnight. It's really good as part of an appetizer spread.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to your liking
Extra-virgin olive oil: 3 tablespoons, divided, or more if needed
instructions: Take your eggplant slices and sprinkle them with salt. Stack them on a plate, then put another plate on top to weigh them down. Let them sit for 30 minutes.

Wash the eggplant, then use paper towels to dry them off. Get a large skillet hot over medium heat with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Cook the eggplant in batches until each side is light brown, which takes about 2 minutes per side. Add more olive oil if you need to. Put the cooked eggplant on paper towels to drain.

Place the fried eggplant slices in layers in a shallow dish. Sprinkle parsley, basil, sage, garlic, salt, and pepper over them. Drizzle the rest of the olive oil (1 tablespoon) and the white wine vinegar on top.
Put a lid on it and let it marinate in the fridge for 8 hours or all night.
author: Rita

title: Beef and Chorizo Meatloaf with Pasta Sauce
description: This simple recipe brings together ground beef and spicy chorizo sausage, mixed with Italian sauce and common spices, for an easy and tasty dinner.
ingredients: Chorizo sausage: 2 links, skins taken off
Salt and ground black pepper: for taste
instructions: Get your oven hot to 350 degrees F (which is 175 degrees C).

In a bowl, combine the ground beef, chorizo sausage, bread crumbs, the 1/2 cup of pasta sauce, the beaten egg, garlic, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper until everything is mixed well. Form this meat mixture into a loaf shape in a pan. Spread the remaining 1 tablespoon of pasta sauce over the top of the loaf.

Cook this in your preheated oven for about 1 hour, or until the middle is no longer pink. To be sure, stick a quick-read thermometer into the center; it should show at least 160 degrees F (or 70 degrees C).
author: Debbie Paskow Taveira

title: Pasta with Basil Mint Pesto and Green Vegetables
description: I found some fusilli in my kitchen and thought it would be great with green veggies and a pesto sauce. My dish with basil mint pesto turned out really good, if I do say so myself.
ingredients: Sea salt and fresh black pepper: to taste
Fusilli pasta (like De Cecco): 1 (16 ounce) package
instructions: Put the pine nuts in a skillet over medium heat. Cook them until they are golden, which takes about 2 minutes. Take them out and let them cool down on a plate.

Place the pine nuts, basil, parsley, mint, and garlic into a food processor or mini chopper. Pulse it until everything is chopped up finely. Add 1 cup of olive oil and the Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, then pulse again to mix it all together. Season the pesto with salt and pepper.

Get a large pot of lightly salted water boiling. Cook the fusilli in this boiling water, stirring once in a while, until it's firm but still has a bite, about 8 minutes. Drain the pasta, but save 1 cup of the cooking water. Clean out the pot.

Heat the last 1/4 cup of olive oil in the same pot over high heat. Add the asparagus and season it with salt and pepper. Cook it until it's tender-crisp and has some brown spots, about 4 minutes. Stir in the spinach and cook just until it wilts, about 3 minutes. Add the pesto and the fusilli, then toss everything well to coat. If the pesto seems too dry, stir in the reserved cooking water.
author: Cindy Anschutz Barbieri

title: Marinated Seafood Salad, Italian Style
description: This is a recipe I created myself. You can serve it on top of radicchio ribbons, romaine, spinach, or any other salad greens you like, mixed with very thin red onion slices. Don't forget some crusty fresh Italian bread for dipping.
instructions: Get a big pot of water boiling. Put the scallops, shrimp, mussels, and calamari into the boiling water and cook for 2 minutes. Drain them. Peel the shrimp, and take the scallops and mussels out of their shells.
Take the cooked seafood and olives and put them in a large bowl. Toss them with the lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, parsley, chives, and red pepper flakes. Put it in the fridge for 1 hour.
Split the salad greens among 6 plates or bowls. Spoon the seafood mixture over the greens. Decorate with lemon slices and red onions. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
author: Domenica Ann

title: Hearty Beef & Bean Chili
description: This beef chili soup is full of flavor and works great over rice, finished with cheese or sour cream. It's a good choice for having guests over, taking on a camping trip, or making ahead and freezing. Just pour it over rice and add sour cream, Monterey Jack cheese, and tortilla chips if you want.
ingredients: 1 pound rump roast, cut into small cubes
Diced green chile peppers: 1 (4 ounce) can
instructions: In a large pot, heat the oil over high heat. Cook the rump roast until it's brown on all sides, which should take about 5 minutes. Then, add the chopped onions and garlic, cooking them until the onions are soft, about 4 to 5 minutes.

Stir in the chili powder, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, and bay leaves with the meat and vegetables. Cook and stir for about 2 minutes until everything is coated with the spices. Pour in the beef stock, enchilada sauce, green chile peppers, and tomato paste, then bring it to a boil. Turn down the heat, put a lid on the pot, and let it simmer until the meat is tender, around 50 minutes.
Add the pinto beans to the soup, mashing some of them if you want a thicker soup. Let it simmer until it's hot all the way through, about 5 minutes.
author: Tina Menard

title: Creamy Broccoli Soup (No Dairy)
description: This soup has a super smooth feel that will trick you into thinking it has cream, but it's totally free of dairy and tastes great! It's an excellent way to use up broccoli stems you might not need for other food. You can freeze it easily for a quick warm snack or lunch in cold weather. Eat it right away with some black pepper, curry powder, or even shredded cheese (if dairy is okay for you), or freeze it in single servings and heat it up later in the microwave.
instructions: Warm up the olive oil in a saucepan on medium-low heat. Put in the onion and garlic; cook them, stirring often, until they look clear, which takes about 10 to 15 minutes. Add the broccoli stalks, potatoes, broccoli florets, and celery root; mix them so they get covered in oil. Pour chicken stock over the vegetables until they are covered; bring this to a boil.
Turn down the heat and let it gently bubble, stirring sometimes, until the vegetables are soft enough to easily poke with a fork, around 20 to 25 minutes. Take the soup off the heat.

Pour soup and vegetables into a blender, making sure it's not more than halfway full. Put the lid on and hold it down; blend a few times quickly before turning the blender up to its fastest setting. Blend until the soup is light green and smooth, for 45 seconds to 1 minute. Do this again with the rest of the soup, working in batches.
author: JoCanadian

title: Spaghetti with Oven-Baked Cherry Tomato Sauce
description: Make this simple sauce with roasted cherry tomatoes for a tasty spaghetti meal any night of the week.
ingredients: Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
Fresh mozzarella cheese: 1 pound, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
Fresh basil: 1/4 cup, cut into strips
instructions: Warm up your oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Take the top off the garlic head. Put it on aluminum foil. Drizzle some oil on it and wrap it up tight.
Put the wrapped garlic in the hot oven for 25 minutes.

While the garlic cooks, get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Cook the spaghetti in this boiling water, mixing it now and then, until it's soft but still a little firm, about 12 minutes. Drain the water and set the spaghetti aside.
Spread the tomatoes on a baking sheet with edges. Drizzle them with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Put the tomatoes in the oven with the garlic for another 20 minutes.

Take everything out of the oven. Let it cool until you can safely touch it, which takes 10 to 20 minutes. Put the tomatoes in a big bowl and squeeze the cooked garlic over them. Use a potato masher to crush the tomatoes and garlic into a sauce.
Add the spaghetti to the sauce. Mix it all together well. Top with the mozzarella cheese and basil. Add more salt and pepper if you want.
author: mamjm5

title: Cucumber Salad with Thai Flavors, Herbs, and Jalapeno
description: This recipe lets you adjust most items to your liking. I found two jalapenos gave it a good amount of spice. You can finish it with chopped nuts, sesame seeds, or sliced red chilies. Furikake also makes a nice topping!
ingredients: Rice vinegar: 1/3 cup (or more, if you like)
Toasted sesame oil: 1 tablespoon (adjust to your preference)
White sugar: 1 tablespoon (or more, to taste)
Fresh ginger, minced: 1 tablespoon (as much as you like)
Soy sauce: 2 teaspoons (or more, if desired)
Jalapeno pepper: 1, sliced thin (or more, to taste)
Fresh basil sprigs: 2, roughly chopped (to taste)
instructions: In a big bowl, whisk together the rice vinegar, sesame oil, sugar, ginger, lemongrass, and soy sauce. After that, mix in the sliced cucumbers, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, and basil.
author: xiaodaut

title: Quick Turkey Tacos with Old El Paso
description: Get a delicious Mexican-style dinner on the table fast with these easy turkey tacos. They come together in just 20 minutes using Old El Paso seasoning and shells.
ingredients: Old El Paso® taco seasoning mix: 1 (1 ounce) package
Old El Paso® taco shells: 1 (4.6 ounce) package
2 medium avocados, pitted, peeled, then sliced
instructions: Warm the oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add the turkey to the hot oil and cook until it's no longer pink, then drain any excess liquid.
Mix in the taco seasoning and water. Turn down the heat and let it simmer without a lid for 5 to 10 minutes, or until the mixture gets thicker.
Spoon the turkey filling into the taco shells. Finish by adding your favorite toppings.
author: Old El Paso

title: Quick Pantry Apple Pancake
description: Don't have fresh milk on hand? No problem! This simple take on a classic Dutch Baby pancake uses items you likely already have in your kitchen cupboards.
instructions: Warm up your oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Put applesauce in a small pot and heat it over medium heat until it's hot but not boiling. Pour the hot applesauce into a blender. Add the eggs and blend for about 5 seconds until they are mixed. Next, add the vanilla, sugar, salt, and flour, and blend until everything is smooth. Finally, add two tablespoons of melted butter and blend for another 30 seconds.

Place an oven-safe skillet on medium heat. Pour one tablespoon of melted butter into the hot skillet and swirl it around to completely coat the bottom and sides. Immediately pour the pancake batter into the skillet, then put the skillet on the middle rack in your oven.
Bake until the edges are golden brown and the pancake has puffed up, which should take about 20 minutes.
Brush the last tablespoon of melted butter evenly over the finished pancake. If you want, sift powdered sugar over the top.

In a small bowl, mix together the 2 tablespoons of flour, 1/4 cup of sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon. Cut in the 2 teaspoons of butter until the mixture looks like coarse crumbs. Sprinkle this topping over the warm Dutch Baby. Serve right away.
author: Mott's

title: Salmon Dinner with Purple Mashed Potatoes and Green Beans
description: This recipe makes a quick, fancy meal. It features salmon soaked in a soy-miso sauce, cooked in a special oven, and served with smooth purple potatoes and crisp green beans. You might have seen this dish on TV!
ingredients: Dry white wine: 1 tablespoon (or to your liking)
Purple potatoes: 1 pound, cut into small pieces
2% milk: ¼ cup (or to your liking)
Butter: 2 tablespoons, soft (or to your liking)
Salt and ground black pepper: for seasoning
French green beans: ½ pound, ends trimmed
instructions: Put the soy sauce, ¼ cup vegetable oil, miso paste, brown sugar, white wine, and red pepper flakes into a bowl and mix them up. This is your marinade.
Put the salmon pieces in a shallow dish. Pour enough marinade over them to cover, but save the rest of the marinade. Let the salmon sit in the fridge for about 10 minutes.

Heat your oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Lightly oil a cast iron skillet or grill pan and put it in the oven while it heats up. (You can use a countertop induction oven instead; set it to medium-high grill.)

Take the salmon out of the marinade, keeping the marinade aside. Place the salmon skin-side up on the hot skillet. Cook until the bottom is a bit brown, about 2 to 3 minutes. Flip the salmon over and cook for another 8 to 10 minutes, or until it easily flakes with a fork. (If using the induction oven, put the salmon skin-side down on the grill pan, saving the marinade. Cook for 1 ½ minutes. Flip the salmon and cook for 2 ½ to 3 minutes, until it flakes easily.)
Pour the extra marinade into a small pot and heat it until it boils. Then take it off the heat.

Put the potatoes in a big pot and cover them with cold, salted water. Bring this to a boil. Turn the heat down to medium-low and let them simmer for about 20 minutes, until they are soft. Drain the water and put the potatoes back in the pot.

In a separate small pot, heat the milk and 2 tablespoons of butter until it simmers. Pour this warm milk mix over the potatoes, a few spoonfuls at a time. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher until they are as lumpy or smooth as you like.

Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the green beans and chopped garlic. Cook and stir until the beans look bright green and have some brown spots, about 5 minutes. Stir in the 1 teaspoon of butter, salt, and pepper.
Serve the mashed potatoes and green beans next to the salmon. Drizzle the cooked marinade you saved over the top.
author: Carrie Portman

title: Spicy Potato and Cashew Curry from Sri Lanka
description: Forget your usual potato dishes and try this Sri Lankan potato and cashew curry instead. It's packed with flavor and lots of spices. This recipe comes from Shashi Charles.
ingredients: 1 (1 inch) fresh ginger root piece, peeled and cut up
1 green bell pepper, cut into slices
Red potatoes: 6 medium, cut into pieces
1 tablespoon chopped cashews, for putting on top
1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped, for putting on top
instructions: Put the olive oil in a pan and cook the chopped onions, garlic, and ginger for about 15 minutes. After that, add in the mustard seeds, green pepper, and potatoes, and cook them for a few minutes more. Then, pour in the vegetable stock and coconut milk, along with all the spices, and let it all cook slowly for 20 minutes. Finally, stir in the cashews and let it cook for another five minutes.
Sprinkle the curry with parsley and extra cashews when serving. Eat it with rice or naan bread.
author: Potato Goodness

title: Quick Protein Noodle Soup To Go
description: Make a protein-packed noodle soup fast. Put all the dry stuff in a container, then just add hot water and an egg when you're ready to eat.
ingredients: Red pepper flakes: 1/8 teaspoon (or more if you like spice)
instructions: Put the rice noodles, chicken, bok choy, carrot, green onion, dashi powder, nutritional yeast, ginger, black pepper, white pepper, and red pepper flakes into a big bowl with a lid that you can carry around.
Get a small container with a lid and mix the tamari, sesame oil, and miso paste inside. Close it up and shake until it's all blended.

When you're ready to eat, pour hot water into the noodle bowl. Move the noodles to the side, crack the egg into the middle, and stir it with chopsticks right away. Put the lid back on and let it sit for about 3 minutes until the noodles are soft. Take off the lid and pour in the tamari mix.
author: Buckwheat Queen

title: Steak Salad with Lime-Cilantro Dressing
description: Make this steak salad for a dinner that brings a fun, Mexican-inspired taste to your table.
ingredients: Jalapeno pepper: 2 teaspoons, seeded and minced
Salt: ½ teaspoon, or as you like
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
Red onion: ½ cup, thinly sliced
Tortilla chips: 1 cup, or as much as you want
instructions: First, make the dressing: put the jalapeno, garlic, and ginger into a blender and mix until they are chopped very fine. Add the lime juice, cilantro, honey, balsamic, and salt; pulse the blender to mix. While the blender is still running, slowly pour in the oil until everything is well combined.
Turn on your oven's broiler. Put salt and black pepper on the steak, then move it to a baking sheet covered with foil.

Place the steak under the broiler, about 4 inches from the heat. Cook it until a meat thermometer put into the middle reads 135 degrees F (57 degrees C) for medium-rare, which takes 3 to 4 minutes on each side. Let the steak sit for about 10 minutes, then cut it into thin slices against the grain.
In a bowl, mix together the corn, bell pepper, red onion, tomato, and the sliced jalapeno (if you are using it).
Divide the lettuce among 4 plates. Drizzle about 2 tablespoons of dressing over each plate. Put the steak slices on top, then add the corn mixture. Sprinkle with feta cheese and put chips on top.
author: psgnyc114

title: Thanksgiving Leftover Biscuit Bites
description: Here's a fun and different way to use up all those Thanksgiving leftovers you have sitting around!
ingredients: Refrigerated flaky biscuits (like Pillsbury Grands!): 1 package
instructions: Set your oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Get a deep-dish pie plate ready by greasing it.

Take each biscuit, one at a time, and roll it out into a thin circle, about 7 inches across. Put 1 tablespoon of cream cheese in the middle of each circle. Then, add 1 teaspoon of cranberry sauce and 2 tablespoons each of Swiss cheese, stuffing, and turkey. Bring the dough edges up and around the filling, pinching them together until the filling is fully covered by the biscuit dough.

Place these biscuit bombs onto the pie plate with the pinched seam facing down. Do this for all the remaining biscuits, cream cheese, cranberry sauce, Swiss cheese, stuffing, and turkey. Arrange 7 bombs around the edge of the pie plate and put 1 in the center.
Brush the melted butter over the top of each bomb. Sprinkle them with salt and pepper.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes, turning the pie plate once, until they are a deep golden brown color.
Let the bombs sit on a cooling rack for 15 minutes before you eat them. Serve with warm gravy for dipping.
author: Julie Hubert

title: Grilled Steak Burrito Bowl Assembly
description: This isn't just any burrito bowl; it's a full-on flavor party! You get juicy, marinated grilled steak, tasty Spanish rice, bright beans and corn, and a smoky ranch sauce. Plus, all the other good stuff you love. It's great for game day or any time you want a fun meal. Don't forget the lime wedges!
ingredients: Beef tenderloin tips, cut into bite-size pieces: 1 1/2 pounds
Carne asada marinade with jalapeno and garlic (like Frontera): 1 (6 ounce) pouch
Adobo sauce from chipotle peppers: 1 tablespoon
Chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, finely chopped: 1
Adobo sauce from chipotle peppers: 1 teaspoon
Diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, warmed: 1 (14.5 ounce) can
Spanish-style rice mix (such as Rice-A-Roni): 1 (6.8 ounce) package
Southwest-style corn with poblano and red peppers, drained: 1 cup
instructions: Put the beef into a gallon-size bag that seals. Add the carne asada marinade, 1 tablespoon of adobo sauce, and the steak seasoning. Seal the bag and put it in the fridge for 1 hour so the meat can marinate.

Get a small bowl and mix the ranch dressing, the chopped chipotle pepper, and 1 teaspoon of adobo sauce until it's all blended. Cover this dressing with plastic wrap and put it in the fridge until you're ready to eat.

In a big skillet, combine the water, the diced tomato mix, the Spanish rice mix, and the margarine. Bring this to a boil. Turn the heat down to medium-low, put a lid on, and let it cook gently until the rice is soft, which takes about 15 to 20 minutes.
Place the avocado, tomatoes, onion, lettuce, Cheddar cheese, lime, jalapeno pepper, and cilantro into separate small dishes for your burrito toppings.
Put the pinto beans and corn into individual bowls that can go in the microwave. Heat them in the microwave until they are warm, for 2 to 3 minutes.
Heat up a grill pan with ridges over medium-high heat. Put a little oil on it to grease it.

If there's any marinade left on the beef, drain it off. Cook the beef on the grill pan for 2 to 3 minutes on each side until it's medium-rare, hot, and slightly pink in the middle. Move the cooked beef to a plate.

Serve the beef with the rice, burrito toppings, pinto beans, and corn for everyone to build their own bowls. Or, you can divide the rice into serving bowls and put the toppings on top. Drizzle with the chipotle dressing.
author: Culinary Envy

title: Almond Milk Chia Pudding with Blueberries
description: This chia pudding uses almond milk and can be a fast vegan breakfast or a light dessert. You can eat it as is, or put different things on top. I enjoy it with toasted almonds and coconut.
ingredients: Chia seeds: 6 tablespoons (or a bit more)
Maple syrup: 1 tablespoon (or more if you like)
instructions: Put the almond milk, chia seeds, blueberries, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and cinnamon into a blender. Blend until the mixture is smooth.
Pour this mix into three small dishes or glasses.
Put them in the fridge until they are firm, which takes 8 hours or you can leave them overnight.
Serve this dish cold.
author: VAL_51

title: Pesto Chicken and Squash Skillet
description: Here's a fresh take on a classic Italian dish, made paleo-friendly with spaghetti squash. You can add some Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese on top if you like.
ingredients: Spaghetti squash: 1, cut in half longways
Italian chicken sausage: 6 links, skins taken off
Broccoli: 1 head, cut into small pieces
Green bell pepper: 1, cut into small pieces
Fresh basil: 1 pinch, chopped, or as much as you want
Fresh rosemary: 1 pinch, chopped, or as much as you want
Italian seasoning (like Mrs. Dash®): 1 pinch, or as much as you want
Pesto: ⅓ of a 7-ounce container, or as much as you want
instructions: Set your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) to heat up.
Put Italian seasoning on the squash halves and place them cut-side down on a baking sheet with edges. Pour in about 1 inch of water.

Bake the squash in the hot oven until it's soft, which takes about 35 to 40 minutes. Take it out of the oven and let it cool for 10 minutes; the squash will easily pull apart into strands when you scrape it with a fork.

Heat a large skillet or wok on medium heat. Cook the sausage, breaking it up, in the hot pan until it's mostly browned and crumbly, for about 10 minutes. Mix in the broccoli and bell pepper. Turn the heat down to low and add the squash strands. Sprinkle basil, rosemary, and Italian seasoning over everything, then drizzle with olive oil. Stir in 2 big spoonfuls of pesto, adding more to your liking, then add the sun-dried tomatoes. Let it gently cook on low heat for 2 to 5 minutes. Serve it up.
author: tclark23

title: Quick Chicken with Basil and Coconut Milk
description: Get that Thai restaurant vibe right in your kitchen with this easy recipe. It just takes half an hour to make. This meal features fresh basil, chopped jalapenos, chicken, and rich coconut milk, all served over white rice.
ingredients: Chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces: 2 1/2 pounds
Diced jarred jalapeno peppers (like Mt. Olive®): 1/2 cup
instructions: Warm up the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the chicken, onion, and garlic in the hot oil until the chicken no longer looks pink, which takes about 6 minutes.
In a bowl, mix together the coconut milk, sugar, diced jalapenos, rice vinegar, salt, and turmeric.

Turn down the heat to medium, then pour the coconut mixture into the pan with the chicken. Let it come to a simmer, then lower the heat to low. Cook until the chicken is fully done and the sauce gets thick, around 6 minutes. Take it off the heat and stir in the basil.
author: Chef Mo

title: Parmesan and Olive Sausage Stuffing
description: This stuffing recipe features Italian sausage, Parmesan, and olives, along with herbs.
ingredients: Johnsonville® Italian Mild Sausage Links: 1 (19 ounce) package, casings taken off
Green bell pepper: ½ cup, chopped
Sliced black olives: 1 (2.25 ounce) can, drained
instructions: Warm your oven up to 325 degrees F.
Cook the sausage in a large skillet over medium heat until it's no longer pink, then drain off any fat.
Take the sausage out of the skillet and set it aside. Put the butter into the same skillet and let it melt.
Add the chopped celery, onion, green pepper, and garlic to the skillet; cook them until they are soft, which takes about 5 minutes.
In a very big bowl, mix together the cooked sausage, the vegetable mixture, the cubed stuffing, the cheese, the olives, and all the seasonings.
Pour in the chicken broth and the beaten eggs; toss everything to make sure it's well mixed.
Spoon the stuffing into a buttered 3-quart baking dish. Cover it and bake for 1 hour.
Take the cover off; bake for another 10 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and a meat thermometer in the middle reads 160 degrees F.
author: From the Kitchen at Johnsonville Sausage

title: Stir-Fry Chicken with Creamy Peanut Sauce
description: This recipe makes a rich, thick, and spicy peanut sauce from scratch. Serve it over rice noodles, or with steamed jasmine or brown rice. A sweet-and-sour cucumber salad makes a nice, fresh side that goes well with the peanut sauce.
ingredients: Creamy, low-salt peanut butter: ⅔ cup
Red curry paste: 1 tablespoon, or more if you like
Canola oil: ¼ cup, split up
Boneless chicken breasts, cut into ½-inch cubes: 1½ pounds
Minced garlic: 1 tablespoon, or more if you like
Large carrot, cut into thick strips: 1
Sweet red pepper, thinly sliced: ½
Unsalted, dry-roasted peanuts: ½ cup, split up
Chopped fresh cilantro: ½ cup, split up
Red pepper flakes: 1 pinch, or to taste
instructions: In a bowl, mix together the peanut butter, ⅓ cup hot water, brown sugar, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and curry paste. Put the peanut sauce to the side.

Warm up 2 tablespoons of oil in a deep skillet or a big wok over medium-high heat. Put in the chicken, ginger, and garlic. Cook this, mixing all the time, until the chicken is no longer pink inside and the juices run clear, which takes 5 to 7 minutes. Take the chicken out of the skillet and set it aside.

Add ⅔ cup hot water to the skillet. Put in the broccoli, carrot, and green beans. Cover the skillet and let them steam for 2 minutes. Take these vegetables out of the skillet and keep the steaming liquid in a bowl.

Add 1 tablespoon of oil to the skillet. Put in the zucchini, onion, and red pepper; stir-fry these for 4 minutes. Put the steamed broccoli, carrots, and green beans back into the skillet. If you need more oil, add the rest. Keep cooking until the vegetables are soft but still a bit firm, another 3 to 5 minutes. Turn the heat down to medium-low.

Put the cooked chicken back into the skillet. Add the peanut sauce, scallions, ⅓ cup of the peanuts, and ⅓ cup of the cilantro. Mix everything well and warm it through for 1 to 3 minutes. If the sauce is too thick, add the reserved steaming liquid to make it thinner.
Put a lime wedge on top, and sprinkle with the rest of the peanuts and cilantro. Add red pepper flakes.
author: Jeannette

title: Tofu Pad Thai Stir-Fry
description: This well-known Thai meal is light and brings together tastes that are sour, salty, sweet, and spicy.
ingredients: Tofu: 1 package (12 ounces), drained and cut into cubes
Vegetable oil: 3 tablespoons, used in parts
instructions: Put the cornstarch on the tofu cubes in a bowl. Get 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil hot in a big pan or wok over medium heat. Fry the tofu until it's light brown on all sides, about 1 to 2 minutes for each side.
Place the noodles in a bowl, then pour enough boiling water over them to cover completely. Let them soak until they get soft, which takes about 3 minutes. After soaking, drain the water.

In a small pot over low heat, mix together the water, sriracha, soy sauce, sugar, tamarind concentrate, and red pepper flakes. Cook this sauce, stirring often, until all the flavors come together, about 5 minutes.

Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Add the tofu, noodles, and sliced onion to the wok. Cook and stir until the tofu turns golden brown, about 3 minutes. Slowly pour in the sauce, stirring to make sure the noodles are fully coated.

Move the noodle mix to one side of the wok. Break the egg onto the empty side of the wok and stir it until it starts to set, which is about 30 seconds to 1 minute. Gently mix the cooked egg into the noodles. Top the dish with green onions, peanuts, and lime wedges.
author: Van Dana

title: Avocado Tostadas with Spiralized Jicama and Cucumber Salad
description: Make these simple spiralized vegetable tostadas with creamy avocado for a great dish. They are good for warm weather and go well with a cold drink. You can switch out the vegetables or dressing if you want.
ingredients: Mini sweet bell peppers: 2, cut into matchsticks
Garlic salt: 1 pinch, or as desired
instructions: Put the spiralized jicama, cucumber, red onion, and bell peppers into a mixing bowl. Add the lime juice and avocado oil, then toss everything together. Chill this mix in the fridge for about 20 minutes.

Take the mashed avocado and add garlic salt to it. Spread this avocado mix evenly onto the tostada shells. Put the chilled jicama mixture and grape tomatoes on top. Finish by garnishing with cilantro and serving with lime wedges.
author: bd.weld

title: Baked Pork Tacos with Apple-Jalapeno Salsa
description: I wanted to make pork tacos, but I felt like doing something different from my usual carnitas. This recipe was my crazy idea. The special coating keeps the pork moist and flavorful while it bakes, making these the best pork tacos I've had in a long time.
ingredients: All-purpose flour: 2 cups, or more if needed
Water: ¾ cup, or more if needed
White onion, finely diced: ⅔ cup
Jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely diced: ½ cup
Limes, cut into wedges: 2, or as needed
instructions: Get your oven hot to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Put rosemary and fresh black pepper all over the pork.
In a big bowl, mix flour, salt, egg white, and water until it's really smooth. If it's too thin, add more flour. Add the pork shoulder and make sure it's fully covered.
Spoon some of the extra coating into a baking dish or pan. Place the pork in the dish with the fat side up. Use a spoon to put more coating on any bare spots and on the top.
Cook in the middle of the hot oven until the outside is dry and hard, and a meat thermometer in the center reads 185 degrees F (85 degrees C). This will take about 3 1/2 hours.

Let it cool for 15 minutes to an hour. Break the pork into large pieces and move them to a plate. Add some of the juices from the bottom of the pan. Cover with plastic wrap. Put it in the fridge for 8 hours or overnight.
For the salsa, mix apple, onion, jalapeno, cilantro, salt, lime juice, and cayenne in a bowl.
Cut the cold pork into strips, then chop them into 1/2-inch cubes.
Heat a dry, nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Cook the pork in the pan until it's brown, which takes 3 to 5 minutes. Serve the pork on warm tortillas with the salsa and lime wedges.
author: Chef John

title: Easy Black Beans and Rice Skillet
description: This simple recipe for black beans and rice is a flavorful meal that doesn't take much work. You can eat it on its own or use it as a great side dish for any Mexican-style food. If you like, put cheese on top, like Cheddar, American, or Parmesan. Serve it with hot sauce, tortilla chips, avocado, or whatever other toppings you enjoy.
ingredients: Black beans: 1 (15 ounce) can, rinsed and drained
Water: ¼ cup, or as needed
instructions: Warm up 2 tablespoons of coconut oil in a big skillet over medium-low heat. Put in the chili powder, garlic powder, cumin, and coriander; cook them until they smell good, which takes about 30 seconds. Then, add the chopped celery and cook it, stirring, until it gets soft, for 3 to 5 minutes.

Toss in the chopped tomato, frozen corn, oregano, and cilantro; mix everything together. Stir in the black beans and salsa. Let it come to a gentle boil and then cook for 10 to 15 minutes, adding water if you need to keep it from getting too dry.
Take the skillet off the heat and stir in the cooked rice until it's all coated. Add salt to your liking.
author: DannyBoy

title: Zesty Canadian Caesar Salad
description: This is a great, tasty, and cool salad.
ingredients: Garlic cloves, coarsely chopped: 2 (or more if you like)
Hot pepper sauce (like Tabasco®): 4 dashes (or to your liking)
Romaine lettuce, torn into bite-size pieces: 1 head
Real bacon bits: 1/4 cup (or as much as you want)
Parmesan cheese, grated: 4 teaspoons (or to your liking)
instructions: Put the garlic and salt into a wooden salad bowl. Use a fork to smash them together until smooth. Next, mash the capers into this garlic paste. Then, mash the anchovy paste into the garlic mix until it's also smooth.

Using a fork, whisk the olive oil and black pepper into the garlic mixture until it's all mixed well. Stir in the Worcestershire sauce, vinegar, mustard, and hot pepper sauce. Whisk the egg yolks into this mixture, then whisk in the lemon juice. Put the romaine lettuce into the salad bowl and toss it with the dressing.
Sprinkle the salad with the bacon bits, croutons, and Parmesan cheese.
author: aenebe

title: Hearty Vegetarian Soup with Red Lentils and Brown Rice
description: This thick, satisfying vegetarian soup combines red lentils and brown rice to create a meal that really fills you up. I created this recipe when I wanted lentil soup but only had a few things on hand. You can add Parmesan cheese on top if you like.
ingredients: Canned Italian-style diced tomatoes: 1 (14.5 ounce) can
Red lentils: 1 ¼ cups, washed and drained
instructions: Pour the olive oil into a big pot and warm it over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and garlic, then cook and stir these until they get soft, which takes about 5 minutes. Next, mix in the broth, diced tomatoes, red lentils, brown rice, Italian seasoning, celery flakes, white pepper, and marjoram. Bring the soup to a boil, then turn down the heat, put a lid on, and let it cook gently until the lentils fall apart and the rice is soft, about 55 minutes.
Right before you serve the soup, stir in the balsamic vinegar.
author: Sola

title: Deep-Fried Peanut Butter and Jelly Pockets
description: I really like the idea of frying food on white bread, and that got me thinking about frying food inside white bread. These fried peanut butter and jelly pockets are what I came up with.
instructions: Warm up the oil in a deep-fryer or a big saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Use a round cutter to make 3 1/2-inch circles from the bread slices.
Put peanut butter in the middle of two bread circles, leaving a 1/2-inch edge free. Do the same with the jelly on the other two bread circles.
Take one jelly bread circle and one peanut butter bread circle, put them together, and push the edges down to close them. Do this for the rest of the bread circles.

Put the pies into the hot oil and cook until they look golden and feel crispy, which takes about 2 minutes on each side. Move them to a plate with paper towels. Sprinkle with powdered sugar and serve.
author: Chef John

title: Tortilla-Wrapped Hot Dogs
description: Hot dogs wrapped in tortillas make a fun change from a regular bun. They are easy to eat on the go.
instructions: Put the hot dogs in a medium frying pan. Cook them over medium heat, turning sometimes, until they are done on all sides. This should take about 5 minutes.
Lay one slice of American cheese in the center of each tortilla. Put a cooked hot dog on top of each cheese slice. Roll the tortillas up around the hot dogs and cheese.

Put all 4 rolled-up hot dogs on a plate that can go in the microwave. Heat them in the microwave for 10 to 12 seconds. This will melt the cheese and warm the tortillas. Drizzle ketchup and mustard on top of the roll-ups.
categories: Hot Dogs and Corn Dogs Recipes
author: Mackenzie Schieck

title: Hot Dogs with Philly Cheesesteak Topping
description: Imagine a hot dog covered with classic Philly cheesesteak fixings. It's a fantastic idea! These are ideal for your summer barbecue, maybe for the 4th of July. I like using club rolls since they hold up better.
ingredients: Processed cheese spread (like Cheese Whiz®): 1 (8 ounce) jar
instructions: Warm the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Put the diced onion in the hot oil and cook it, stirring often, until it's soft, which takes about 5 to 10 minutes. Move the cooked onion to a separate bowl. In the same skillet, cook the chopped rib-eye, stirring it until the meat isn't red anymore and all the liquid is gone, about 5 to 10 minutes. Mix the cooked onion back in with the rib-eye.
Get a pot of water boiling. Add the hot dogs to the boiling water and cook them until they are heated through, which should take 5 to 10 minutes.
Put each hot dog into a bun. Spoon the rib-eye and onion mix over each hot dog, then add a dollop of cheese spread on top.
categories: Hot Dogs and Corn Dogs Recipes
author: CNM CATERING

title: Savory Egg White Bake with Mediterranean Flavors
description: I made this dish when I wanted to make an egg white frittata more interesting. It ended up tasting much richer than expected. The sun-dried tomatoes really make it special.
ingredients: Canned sliced mushrooms with pieces, drained: 1 (4.5 ounce) can
instructions: Get your oven hot to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8-inch round pan.
Put the sun-dried tomatoes in a bowl with warm water for about 10 minutes to soften them up. Then drain the water and chop the tomatoes.

Heat the olive oil in a small pan over medium heat. Cook the onion and garlic, stirring them until the onion turns clear, which takes about 10 minutes. Add the spinach and cook it, stirring until it's thawed and all the water is gone, about 5 minutes. Mix in the mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, and feta cheese until everything is well combined.

In a bowl, whisk together the egg whites, skim milk, salt, pepper, and basil until it gets very foamy. Gently stir the cooked spinach mix and 1 tablespoon of Parmesan cheese into the egg mixture. Pour this into your prepared pan. Sprinkle the rest of the Parmesan cheese on top.
Bake in the hot oven for about 25 minutes, until the frittata is firm and golden brown on top.
author: sbmj

title: Hearty Vietnamese Beef Stew
description: This Vietnamese beef stew is incredibly tasty, easily the best beef stew I've ever had. It requires a bit of preparation, but the final result is definitely worth the effort. I always make a double batch of this recipe.
ingredients: Beef brisket: 2 1/2 pounds, cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces
Diced tomatoes: 2 (14.5 ounce) cans, drained and crushed by hand
Carrots: 1 pound, peeled and chopped into 1-inch pieces
instructions: First, trim the ends off the lemongrass and cut it into 3-inch sections. Gently pound these pieces with a heavy object until they are bruised.

In a large bowl, combine the lemongrass stalk, fish sauce, ginger, applesauce, curry powder, five-spice powder, and bay leaf. Add the beef and mix everything until the beef is well coated. Put it in the refrigerator to marinate for about 30 minutes.
Warm up your oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
Drain the extra marinade from the beef, but save the lemongrass and bay leaf.

Melt the ghee in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Brown the beef in batches, cooking each side for about 30 seconds. Move the browned beef to a plate. Turn the heat down to medium-low. Add the onion and cook it, stirring, until it becomes soft, which takes about 5 minutes. Mix in the tomatoes and salt. Let it simmer until it thickens into a paste, around 12 to 14 minutes.

Stir the beef, along with the saved lemongrass and bay leaf, into the tomato paste. Turn the heat up to medium and cook, stirring often, for about 5 minutes to let the flavors blend. Set the heat to high. Pour in the water and add the carrots; bring it all to a boil.
Cover the Dutch oven and cook it in the preheated oven until the beef is tender, which will be about 2 1/2 hours. Top with cilantro before serving.
author: Lori Rowley-Sipple

title: Simple Orange and Feta Salad
description: This is an easy, light salad that works well with any meal.
ingredients: Walnuts, coarsely chopped and toasted: 1 cup
Red onion, thinly sliced: ½ cup
Freshly cracked black pepper, to taste
instructions: Get a big bowl and put in the salad greens, mandarin oranges, walnuts, onion, and feta cheese. Pour the raspberry vinaigrette over everything. Mix it all up well. Finish by adding black pepper as you like.
author: Diane Sniffen

title: Hearty Dumpling and Vegetable Soup
description: This soup is full of flavor and will really fill you up.
ingredients: Frozen potstickers with sauce (like Ling Ling®): 20
Dry sherry: ⅓ cup, or more if you like
Orange peel: 1 piece (1 inch), or as much as you want
instructions: Put olive oil in a big pot and heat it on medium-high. Throw in the cabbage and onion; cook until they're a little brown and see-through, about 6 to 8 minutes. Add the carrots, mushrooms, and garlic; cook until they soften up, around 3 minutes. Pour in the broth, potsticker sauce, sherry, ham, ginger, orange peel, and pepper. Turn the heat up to high and bring the soup to a boil.

Turn the heat down to medium; let it cook for about 15 minutes so the flavors mix well. Take out and throw away the orange peel. Put in the potstickers; cover the pot and cook until they're soft, about 10 minutes. Stir in the cilantro.
author: MD4KINGS

title: Rustic Italian Bread Salad
description: This recipe takes a regular salad and turns it into a fun dish for any get-together. It's an Italian classic that uses bread as a main ingredient.
ingredients: 1 large cucumber, peeled, seeded, and chopped
Fresh basil leaves, torn: 12 (or more if you like)
instructions: Take the bread and break, chop, or crumble it into small pieces. Put these pieces into a big bowl.
Add all the cut-up vegetables to the bowl with the bread and mix them together.
Pour in the vinegar and olive oil. Add the chopped garlic and the torn basil leaves.
Mix everything really well. Add salt and pepper until it tastes right.
Let the salad sit at room temperature for 1 to 2 hours before you serve it.
author: Chateau Ste Michelle

title: Sweet and Spicy Island Chili
description: This chili brings a taste of the Islands with its distinct sweet and spicy flavors. It's a truly unique dish that pairs wonderfully with tortilla chips and a cold drink.
ingredients: 1 can (15 ounce) black beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: Warm the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic; cook for about 2 minutes, stirring until they soften. Next, put in the ground pork and ground sirloin; cook for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring until the meat is browned. Drain any extra grease from the pot.

Crush the whole tomatoes by hand and toss them into the pot with their juices. Pour in the beef broth. Mix in the black beans, raisins, chili powder, cumin, cinnamon, salt, allspice, and cloves. Bring the mixture to a boil, then lower the heat and let it simmer, covered, for about 30 minutes until the raisins are soft.
Stir the halved green olives and slivered almonds into the pot. Continue to simmer for another 30 minutes to let the flavors blend together.
author: Saveur

title: Honey-Sweetened Italian Meringue Buttercream
description: This recipe is great for those who want to skip refined sugar, as it uses only honey for sweetness! You'll get enough frosting to cover a single layer cake or around 40 cupcakes.
instructions: Get a small saucepan and put the honey in it. Warm it up over medium heat until a thermometer in the pan shows 240 degrees F (115 degrees C).

While the honey gets hot, use a stand mixer with the whisk attachment to beat the egg whites until they form stiff peaks. Slowly pour the hot honey into the egg whites while the mixer is still running at medium-high speed. Keep the mixer on until the mixing bowl feels cool to the touch.

Gradually add the soft butter in pieces, making sure the mixer is still running. Then, add the vanilla extract. Keep mixing for up to 10 minutes until the mixture comes together and looks like buttercream.
author: Jana

title: Breakfast Arepas with Corned Beef Hash
description: These arepas come with corned beef hash, black beans, fresh avocado, and tomato, all topped off with a poached egg. It's like a breakfast sandwich from south of the border.
ingredients: HORMEL® Mary Kitchen® Corned Beef Hash: 1 can (15 ounces)
Cooked black beans: 1 cup, rinsed and drained
instructions: Warm up a skillet over medium-high heat. Put the onion and oil in the skillet and cook until the onion is soft and clear, about 4 minutes. Add the can of corned beef hash and the black beans. Keep cooking until everything is hot and a little bit crispy, which takes 4 to 6 minutes. Take the skillet off the heat.

Get a large saucepan and fill it with 2 to 3 inches of water. Bring the water to a boil. Turn the heat down to medium-low, then pour in the vinegar. Keep the water just barely simmering. Crack one egg into a small bowl, then carefully slide the egg into the simmering water, holding the bowl right above the water's surface. Do this for the rest of the eggs. Cook the eggs until the whites are firm and the yolks are thick but not hard, taking 2 ½ to 3 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to take the eggs out of the water. Gently blot them on a kitchen towel to get rid of extra water, then put them on a warm plate.

Cut each arepa in half across the middle. Put the corned beef hash mix on the bottom halves of the arepas. Place slices of tomato and avocado on top, then add a poached egg. Put the top halves of the arepas back on and serve.
author: Buckwheat Queen

title: Unbaked Baileys® Cheesecake Truffles
description: These cheesecake balls are coated in chocolate and have a boozy kick. You don't need to bake them, and they're ready in about 15 minutes, not counting the chilling time between steps.
ingredients: 25 milk chocolate-topped butter cookies (like Le Petit Ecolier), crushed
Irish cream liqueur (such as Baileys®): ⅓ cup
instructions: In a bowl, mix together the crushed cookies, mascarpone cheese, and Irish cream liqueur until everything is well combined.

Get a baking sheet ready by lining it with parchment paper. Take small amounts of the cookie mix with a melon baller or a small cookie scoop and roll them into twenty 1-inch balls. Put these balls on the lined baking sheet and chill them in the refrigerator for about 45 minutes.

Put the white chocolate in the top part of a double boiler over water that's gently simmering. Stir often, making sure to scrape down the sides with a rubber spatula to keep it from burning, until the chocolate is fully melted, which takes about 5 minutes. Dip the cheesecake balls into this melted chocolate and put them back in the fridge to chill until the chocolate is completely firm, about 1 hour.

Next, put the dark chocolate in the top part of a double boiler over gently simmering water. Stir it often, scraping the sides with a rubber spatula to prevent burning, until the chocolate has melted, about 5 minutes. Drizzle this melted dark chocolate over the chilled cheesecake balls. Let them sit until the chocolate hardens, around 30 minutes.
author: coachchris

title: Louisiana-Style Chicken and Sausage Pasta
description: This is my own recipe for pastalaya, put together after trying several recipes from Southern Louisiana. I've never timed myself making it, so the cooking times might not be exact. Hope you like it! Goes well with some crusty bread.
ingredients: Large sweet onion (like Vidalia®), finely chopped: 1
Large green bell pepper, finely chopped: 1
Skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces: 1 pound
Crushed tomatoes (such as San Marzano®): 1 (28 ounce) can
Uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined: 1 pound
Parmesan cheese, to taste: ¼ cup
instructions: First, melt butter in a big pot over medium heat. Put in the sausage and cook it for 2 minutes. Then, add the chopped celery, onion, bell pepper, and garlic; cook these until they are soft, which takes 5 to 7 minutes. Next, add the chicken and cook it until it's no longer pink inside and the juices run clear, about 5 to 7 more minutes. Stir in the tomatoes, paprika, Creole seasoning, and cayenne pepper; bring this mixture to a simmer and let it cook for 10 minutes.

Pour the broth into the pot and bring it to a simmer again. Add the penne pasta and let it simmer for 8 minutes. Add the shrimp. Keep simmering, stirring all the time, until the pasta is tender but still a little firm, and the shrimp are fully cooked, which is about 7 more minutes.

Stir in the cream. Then, mix in the thyme, oregano, and basil. Cook until everything is just warmed through, about 3 to 5 more minutes. Serve it with green onions and Parmesan cheese sprinkled on top.
author: Bevin

title: Turkey and Quinoa Enchilada Pot
description: This hearty stew combines ground turkey, quinoa, and enchilada sauce. Remember to mix in some lime juice right before you serve it.
ingredients: Uncooked quinoa: 1 and a half cups
Diced tomatoes and green chiles (undrained): 1 (10 ounce) can
instructions: Get a large skillet hot over medium-high heat. Put the turkey in and cook it, stirring often, until it's brown and broken apart, which takes about 5 to 7 minutes. Pour off any grease and throw it away.

Take the cooked turkey and mix it with the enchilada sauce, black beans, quinoa, diced tomatoes and chiles, water, corn, salsa, onion, green bell pepper, chili powder, garlic, and cumin in a slow cooker.
Let it cook in the slow cooker on High for about 4 hours, or until the quinoa is soft and all the flavors have come together. Stir in the Cheddar cheese and cilantro at the end.
author: JonSnyde

title: Quick Meat-Free Shirataki Pad Thai
description: This easy recipe for vegetarian pad Thai with shirataki noodles lets you make your favorite dish at home and save money.
ingredients: Tofu: 1 (12 ounce) package, cut into chunks
instructions: Put the shirataki noodles into a bowl with hot water; set this aside.

Warm the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook the tofu in it, stirring, until it's a light brown color and done, which takes 5 to 10 minutes. Move the tofu to a plate, but keep the skillet on the heat.

In a small bowl that can go in the microwave, whisk together the soy sauce, lemon juice, sugar, peanut butter, and sriracha sauce. Heat this until the peanut sauce is smooth and melted, about 20 seconds. Mix it well.

Cook the eggs in the hot skillet, stirring them until they are scrambled and cooked through, around 5 minutes. Stir the mushrooms and tofu into the eggs. Add half of the peanut sauce and mix everything thoroughly.

Drain the shirataki noodles and add them to the egg mixture. Pour in the rest of the peanut sauce. Sprinkle 1/4 cup of cashews into the tofu-noodle mix and stir well. Turn the heat down to medium-low and let it simmer until the sauce gets thick, 5 to 7 minutes.
Move the tofu-noodle mixture into a serving bowl. Top it with the remaining cashews, bean sprouts, and lime wedges.
author: Andrew05

title: Pasta with Scallops and Crispy Bacon
description: This dish is a fast, good-for-you meal. It's nice enough for special occasions or when you have company. It really shines when you use fresh scallops. You can get most of the work done while the water heats up and the pasta cooks. It's very simple to put together.
ingredients: Sea scallops: 1 pound, cut in half across the middle
Lemon zest: 1 pinch, or more if you like
instructions: Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Cook the linguine in the boiling water until it's soft but still a little firm when you bite it, which takes around 11 minutes; then drain the water away.

Put a skillet on medium heat; cook and stir the onion and bacon until the onion is soft and the bacon is crunchy, taking about 6 minutes. Add the scallops, garlic, red pepper flakes, black pepper, and salt; cook and stir these until the scallops are done, which is about 1 minute. Mix in the wine; let it cook for 1 minute.
Take the skillet off the heat and stir the parsley into the scallop mix. Pour the scallop mixture over the linguine and put lemon zest on top.
author: denisef

title: Chopped Salad with Italian Meats
description: This salad is really good and simple to enjoy. It's especially good served with some delicious garlic bread.
ingredients: Capicola, thinly sliced and diced: 3 pieces
Freshly grated mozzarella cheese: 2 tablespoons (or as much as you like)
Italian-style salad dressing: 2 tablespoons (or as much as you like)
Grated Parmesan cheese: 2 tablespoons (or as much as you like)
instructions: In a bowl, combine the chopped romaine lettuce and radicchio. Add the diced Roma tomato, salami, pepperoni, garbanzo beans, olives, and mozzarella cheese; stir everything together well. Pour the Italian-style salad dressing over the salad; mix again thoroughly. Top the salad with Parmesan cheese.
author: Zero

title: Quick Salmon Patties
description: This is a simple recipe for when you need a fast dinner. It goes great with Caesar salad and some garlic bread.
ingredients: Canned salmon: 2 cans (14.75 ounces each), drained and flaked
instructions: Get a medium bowl and put in the salmon, crushed cornflakes, and onion. Stir in the eggs. Add the basil, oregano, and thyme for flavor. Shape this mix into 1-inch balls. Roll each ball in the flour to give it a light coating.

Warm up the oil in a big, heavy skillet or a deep fryer until it reaches about 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cook the salmon balls in groups for around 15 minutes, until they turn golden brown. After cooking, put them on paper towels to drain.
author: Cheryl

title: Ground Beef Fried Rice, Thai Style
description: This fried rice recipe uses ground beef and is a great example of simple Thai cooking from home. You'll love the tasty mix of soy sauce, fish sauce, and fresh tomato in this fried rice dish.
ingredients: Sesame oil: 3 drops, or more if you like
Green onion, finely chopped (white and light green parts): 1
Ground beef, cooked and crumbled: 1/2 pound
Salt and black pepper, to taste
instructions: First, warm the vegetable oil and sesame oil in a wok or a big skillet. Put in the bell pepper, onion, and green onion; cook these for 2 minutes. Add the cooked ground beef, sprinkle garlic powder over everything, and cook for another minute.

Next, stir in the diced tomato, fish sauce, and soy sauce; cook this mix for 2 minutes. Add the rice and stir it all together until it's warmed through, which will take 7 to 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, then squeeze the lime wedges over the top.

Pour the beaten egg into a separate, small pan and let it cook for 30 seconds. Gently lift the edges of the egg so any uncooked liquid egg flows underneath the parts that are already cooked and touches the hot pan. Shake and tilt the pan to move the raw egg around. Keep doing this until the top of the egg is firm, about 4 minutes.
Divide the rice into two servings. Place half of the cooked egg on top of each serving.
author: Diana71

title: Chicken with Ginger-Flavored Broth and Yellow Jasmine Rice
description: This dish features chicken breast strips that are cooked until golden, mixed with crisp-tender vegetables, and simmered in a ginger-infused broth. A smooth blend of coconut milk, cilantro, and jalapeno peppers is added to the mix. It's served alongside jasmine rice, offering a burst of great flavors.
ingredients: Boneless, skinless chicken breast halves, cut into thin strips: 1 ¼ pounds
Small eggplant, cut lengthwise into quarters, then crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick slices: 1
Large red bell pepper, cut into 2-inch-long strips: 1
Large onion, cut in half and into 1/2-inch-thick slices: 1
Swanson® Thai Ginger Flavor Infused Broth: ¾ cup
instructions: Cook the rice following the package directions. Make sure to add the turmeric to the water you cook it in.
Warm 1 tablespoon of oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Put the chicken in and cook it, stirring often, until it gets brown. Take the chicken out of the skillet.

Put the rest of the oil into the skillet. Add the eggplant, red pepper, and onion, then cook them for 5 minutes, stirring sometimes, until they are tender but still a little crisp. Toss in the garlic and cook and stir for 1 minute. Pour in the broth and bring it to a boil. Turn the heat down to medium. Cook for 8 minutes, stirring once in a while.
Put the coconut milk, chopped jalapeno peppers, and cilantro into a blender. Cover it and blend until the mixture is smooth.
Stir the coconut milk mixture into the skillet. Return the chicken to the skillet. Cook until the chicken is fully done. Serve the chicken mixture with the rice.
author: Campbell's Kitchen

title: Zesty Tuna Poke with a Spicy Twist
description: This poke salad is a classic dish with some heat. It's good as a starter, or you can eat it for lunch or dinner on top of lettuce.
ingredients: Ahi tuna, cut into 1/2-inch cubes: 1 pound
Fresh cilantro, chopped: 2 tablespoons (or more if you like)
Sesame oil: 2 teaspoons (add more to your liking)
Sriracha sauce: 1 teaspoon (or adjust to taste)
instructions: Put the tuna, green onion, macadamia nuts, cilantro, lime juice, sesame oil, ginger, red pepper flakes, and sriracha sauce into a bowl together. Then, put it in the fridge for 2 hours.
author: Coffee Girl

title: Coconut Oil Pasta with Mixed Vegetables
description: This is a simple recipe that puts a new spin on classic pasta with oil. It's a quick, healthy meal that most kids will enjoy. You can easily change it up by adding different herbs and spices. It's a favorite in my house for both toddlers and adults.
ingredients: Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper: to taste
Grated Parmesan cheese: 1 tablespoon, or as desired
instructions: First, get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Put in the elbow macaroni and cook, stirring now and then, until it's a bit soft, which takes about 3 minutes. Then, add the frozen vegetables. Keep cooking and stirring until they are tender but still a little firm, about 5 minutes. Pour everything into a bowl to drain.

Put the coconut oil into the same warm pot. Add the macaroni and veggie mix, garlic powder, sea salt, and pepper. Stir everything up for 1 to 2 minutes until it's all mixed together. Finish by putting Parmesan cheese on top.
author: RainbowJewels

title: Hearty Chicken and Corn Chowder with Green Chiles
description: I got a lot of Hatch green chiles in August and wanted to use them up in a soup for winter. They turned out spicier than I thought, so I used rice and corn in the soup to help calm down the heat. My parents enjoyed it a lot when I shared it with them. Then, my friends at work also loved it, so I shared the recipe with them too. I hope you all like it as much as they did. It's a nice, comforting meal. You should serve it with some cheese on top.
ingredients: Hatch chile peppers: 3, cut in half with seeds removed
Water: 4 cups, or more if needed
Ground cumin: 1/2 teaspoon, or to your liking
Chicken stock concentrate (like Knorr Homestyle): 3 1/2 teaspoons
Processed cheese food (such as Velveeta): 1/2 of an 8-ounce package
instructions: Place an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source, then turn on your oven's broiler. Put aluminum foil on a baking sheet; arrange the chile peppers on it with the cut side down.

Broil the chile peppers until their skins are black and bubbly, which should take 5 to 8 minutes. Move them to a bowl and cover it tightly with plastic wrap. Let the peppers steam as they cool for about 20 minutes. After they cool, take off and throw away the skins.

Put the chile peppers in a large stockpot. Add the 4 cups of water, corn, chicken breasts, carrots, chicken stock concentrate, garlic, cumin, and poultry seasoning. Bring everything to a boil, then lower the heat and let the chowder simmer for about 1 hour, until the chicken is very tender.
Take the chicken and green chile peppers out of the stockpot. Pull them apart into small pieces and put them back into the chowder.
Stir the rice and processed cheese into the chowder. Keep stirring for about 5 minutes, until the cheese has completely melted. If the chowder is too thick, you can add more water to thin it out.
author: snowwhiteRN

title: Quick Ground Turkey & Salsa for Tacos
description: This recipe is super simple to make. You just mix ground turkey and salsa ranchera in a pressure cooker. It's great for tacos, burritos, or even on top of a salad.
ingredients: Salsa ranchera (7 ounce can, like HERDEZ®): 1
instructions: Warm up the oil in your pressure cooker (like an Instant Pot®) using the Saute setting. Put in the ground turkey; cook and mix it around until it's mostly brown, which takes about 5 minutes. Then, stir in the salsa ranchera.
Put the lid on and lock it. Set the pressure cooker to high pressure for 15 minutes, following your cooker's directions. It will take about 10 to 15 minutes for the pressure to build up.
Carefully let the pressure out using the quick-release method, as your cooker's instructions say. This usually takes around 5 minutes. After that, unlock and take off the lid.
author: bd.weld

title: Stir-Fried Udon Noodles with Pork and Veggies
description: After trying out my new wok, I made this stir-fried udon dish, and I thought it turned out quite well. My husband enjoyed it, so it must be decent. It's a pretty straightforward recipe to make.
ingredients: Frozen Asian vegetable medley: 2 packages (10 ounces each)
Pork tenderloin, cut into strips: 1 pound
instructions: Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Put the udon in the boiling water and cook, mixing sometimes, until the noodles are soft but still a little firm when you bite them, which takes 10 to 12 minutes. Drain them and put them aside.
While the noodles cook, in a big bowl, mix the vegetable oil, cornstarch, garlic, and ginger until the cornstarch disappears. Throw in the frozen vegetables and toss them to get a light coating.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, water, vinegar, and sugar.

Heat the sesame oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Cook the pork strips in the hot oil, stirring them around, until they just start to brown, about 5 to 7 minutes. Add the frozen vegetables and cook, stirring all the time so they don't burn, for about 2 minutes. Stir in the soy sauce mixture. Add the drained udon and stir-fry until the vegetables are soft and the pork strips are no longer pink inside, which takes about 2 more minutes.
author: Aliz

title: Swirled Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: I took a well-known chocolate chip cookie recipe and made some big changes. I split the dough, making one part chocolate with white chips. Then, I used a special method from my cookbook, Marbled, Swirled, and Layered, to combine the two doughs in a crisscross pattern. I also added flaky salt on top, which helps cut the sweetness and gives a nice little crunch.
ingredients: Unsweetened Dutch-process cocoa powder: ⅔ cup
instructions: Get your oven hot to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

In a bowl, put the butter, white sugar, brown sugar, vanilla, baking soda, and salt. Use a mixer to cream them until the butter sticks to the bowl's sides and the color is even, about 2 minutes. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing in each one fully before adding the next. Stir in 2 cups of the flour with the mixer on low speed until it's all mixed in. The dough will be very soft.

Take about half of the dough and move it to a different bowl. Mix the remaining ½ cup of flour into the first half of the dough, then stir in the semisweet chocolate chips until they are spread out. Mix the cocoa powder into the other half of the dough, then stir in the white chocolate chips until they are spread out.

Roll a tablespoon of each dough into a ball. Lightly tap each ball on your counter to make one side flat. Push the flat sides of a light and a dark dough ball together to make one bigger ball, then flatten it into a disk that is half dark and half light. Cut this disk in half with a knife, cutting straight across the seam where the two doughs meet. Flip one of the halves over, then firmly press the halves back together. You should now have a disk with 4 alternating colored sections. Do this for all the leftover dough. Put the cookies on the baking sheet, leaving about 2 inches between them. Sprinkle flaky sea salt on top.
Bake for 10 to 12 minutes, until the cookie edges start to look golden brown. Let them cool on the baking sheet for 10 minutes. Then, move them to a wire rack to cool down completely.
author: eatthelove

title: Grilled Eggplant with Fresh Herbs
