description: This simple Italian side dish is super easy to make. We often prepare it in the summer when our garden is full of basil and parsley. It's also good with zucchini!
instructions: Get your outdoor grill ready. Turn it to medium-high heat and put a little oil on the grates.
Lightly brush both sides of the eggplant slices with some olive oil. In a small bowl, mix the rest of the olive oil with the minced garlic and salt.
Place the eggplant on the hot grill. Cook them, flipping sometimes, until they are soft and have brown marks. This will take about 3 to 4 minutes on each side.
Put the grilled eggplant on a serving plate. Brush the eggplant with the olive oil and garlic mix until it soaks it all up. Finish by shaking the chopped basil and parsley over them, then serve.
author: Kim's Cooking Now

title: Leftover Turkey and Stuffing Soup
description: Our family always makes this soup after Thanksgiving. You won't find another recipe quite like it!
instructions: Over low heat, melt the butter in a large stockpot. Add the celery, carrots, and onion to the pot; cook them, stirring, until they are soft, which takes 8 to 10 minutes. Mix in the turkey, stuffing, tomatoes, and parsley. Pour in the turkey stock. Bring the soup to a boil, then lower the heat and let it simmer, partly covered, for about 1 hour so the flavors can blend.

Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Cook the egg noodles in this boiling water, stirring sometimes, until they are tender but still a bit firm, about 7 to 9 minutes. Drain the water from the noodles.
Put the warm noodles into deep bowls. Then, pour the soup over the noodles.
author: AuLait

title: Creamy Baked Pasta with Asiago, Mushrooms, and Radicchio
description: This dish is a stepped-up version of classic mac and cheese. It's rich and creamy, making it the ultimate comfort food. The slight bitterness from the radicchio is key to balancing out how rich the dish is, so don't skip it.
ingredients: Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
Radicchio: 1 large head, halved, cored, and thinly sliced
Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, freshly grated: 1 ½ cups, divided
instructions: Get a large pot of lightly salted water boiling. Put the shell pasta in the boiling water and stir it sometimes until it's still firm when you bite it, which takes about 9 minutes. Then, drain it.
Warm your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Use butter to coat a 9x13-inch baking dish.

Pour olive oil into a big pot and heat it over medium heat. Add the mushrooms, onion, and some salt and pepper. Cook and stir this mix until the mushrooms turn brown and the onion looks clear, about 7 minutes. Next, add the radicchio, garlic, and sage; cook until the radicchio softens and the garlic smells good, around 3 minutes. Take the pot off the heat and mix in the pasta.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Whisk in the flour and cook until it gets foamy. Pour in the milk, whisking all the time, until the mix boils and gets thick, about 5 minutes. Take it off the heat; whisk in the Asiago cheese, heavy cream, 1 cup of Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, ½ teaspoon of salt, and ¼ teaspoon of black pepper until the sauce is melted and smooth.

Pour this sauce over the pasta mix; stir everything until it's well combined. Move the pasta to the baking dish you prepared. Sprinkle the rest of the ½ cup Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese and the panko on top.
Bake in the hot oven until it's bubbly, for about 30 minutes. Then, broil it until the top is golden brown, which takes about 1 minute.
author: stefychefy

title: No-Bake Layered Cookie Dessert
description: My granddaughters absolutely love this dessert, and it's something we make every Christmas for them. We decorate it with sprinkles that match the holiday. You can also switch things up by using ginger snaps instead of chocolate wafers for a different taste.
ingredients: Frozen whipped topping, thawed: 1 (16 ounce) container
instructions: Put a 1-inch layer of whipped topping into the bottom of the graham cracker crust. Place a layer of cookies over the whipped topping. Add another layer of whipped topping on top of the cookies. Keep making alternating layers until you run out of cookies and whipped topping. Chill the pie for at least 24 hours so the cookies can get soft. Just before you serve it, put the sprinkles on top.
author: Betsy Chadbourne

title: Pumpkin Pie Without Dairy, Eggs, or Gluten
description: This recipe makes a pumpkin pie filling that doesn't use dairy or eggs. You can put it in any pie crust you like. I personally enjoy using a gluten-free graham cracker crust, like the Mi-Del® one from Whole Foods. My 3-year-old thinks it tastes just like a Libby's® Pumpkin Pie!
instructions: Get your oven hot to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Put the pumpkin puree, tofu, sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, salt, vanilla extract, ginger, and cloves into a blender. Mix it until it's very smooth, stopping to scrape down the sides if you need to. Pour this mixture into your pie crust.

Bake the pie in the hot oven for about 15 minutes, or until it starts to turn a little brown. Then, turn the oven down to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and keep baking for 40 to 50 minutes. The pie is done when a knife stuck in the middle comes out clean.
Place the pie in the fridge and let it get cold and firm. This will take 8 hours or you can leave it overnight.
author: Veronica Ruff

title: Quick Sorghum Flour Crepes (Gluten-Free)
description: I truly enjoy crepes, but since I can't eat gluten, I thought I'd never have them again. Luckily, the first crepes were made with buckwheat flour, which doesn't have gluten. I like those, but they need to sit overnight. As a mom with little kids, I often need something fast. So, I tried using sweet white sorghum flour instead. It made a light batter that held its shape well and had a soft feel and mild taste. These are great for either sweet or savory crepes. You can fill them with things like ham and cheese, chicken with your favorite sauce, smoked salmon, strips of beef, vegetables, eggs, or even fruit and yogurt. Use whatever you like!
ingredients: Sorghum flour (like Bob's Red Mill® 'Sweet' White): 1 cup
instructions: Get a skillet warm over medium-high heat after lightly buttering it.
Put the almond milk, eggs, sorghum flour, melted butter, and salt into a blender. Blend until the batter is smooth and all mixed together.

Pour about a quarter cup of batter onto the hot pan and quickly swirl it around to make a thin layer. Cook this until the top looks dry and the edges start to come up from the pan, which takes 2 to 4 minutes. Turn it over and cook for just a few more seconds on the second side. Move the cooked crepe to a plate. Keep doing this with the rest of the batter to make around 8 crepes.
author: maria joesaar

title: Grilled Flank Steak with Arugula and Balsamic Glaze
description: This flank steak and arugula salad is great for a barbecue with friends. It's easy to grill and enjoy a relaxed meal.
ingredients: White cheddar cheese (good quality): ½ pound
Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper, as needed
instructions: To make the marinade, whisk together the 3 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, 6 tablespoons olive oil, Dijon mustard, minced garlic, minced shallot, 1 teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon pepper. Put the steak in a zip-top bag, pour the balsamic mixture over it, seal the bag tightly, and put it in the fridge for 8 hours or overnight.

Heat your grill. Place the marinated steak on the hot grill. Cook each side for 5 minutes. After 2 and a half minutes, turn the steak 90 degrees to make a diamond pattern. Take the steak off the grill when its inside temperature reaches 140 degrees F (60 degrees C). Brush the steak with the 3 teaspoons of balsamic vinegar, add some salt, then cover it and let it sit for 10 minutes.

While the steak rests, grate the cheese and cut the cherry tomatoes in half. Slice the steak thinly and arrange it over a bed of arugula. Finish by adding the cherry tomatoes, cheese, a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil, and freshly cracked pepper on top.
author: Chateau Ste Michelle

title: Salmon Cooked in Foil with Lemon and Herbs
description: Making salmon in a foil pouch is a super healthy cooking method since you don't need any extra fat. I like to flavor mine with a special mix of marjoram, lemon, and star anise, but you can definitely use different herbs and spices if you want.
ingredients: Salt and fresh black pepper, to taste
instructions: Get your oven hot to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Warm up some olive oil in a skillet on medium heat. Cook the onions in it until they're soft and brown, which takes about 10 minutes. Mix in the marjoram and a little salt. Take the skillet off the heat.

Put the lemon slices in one layer in a clean skillet over high heat. Cook them for about 3 minutes until they're a bit browned on both sides. Add the star anise and water, then bring it to a boil. Remove from heat.

Get a baking pan big enough for the salmon and line it with aluminum foil, making sure you have extra foil hanging over the sides. Spread the onions in a single layer on the bottom. Put the salmon fillet on top, skin-side down. Rub salt and pepper all over the fish. Cover it with the lemon slices and star anise. Fold the foil edges up over the salmon to make a packet, sealing it up tight.
Bake it in the hot oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until the salmon easily pulls apart with a fork. Take it out of the oven, carefully open the foil, and serve.
author: Natalie Titanov

title: Chicken, Spinach, and Herb Pasta with Browned Butter and Mizithra
description: It can be tough to find recipes for Mizithra cheese that aren't just plain browned butter pasta. This recipe puts a fresh spin on that classic dish. It's a great choice for warm summer evenings. I often use a George Foreman grill for the chicken.
ingredients: Seasoned salt: 1 teaspoon, or as you like
Freshly ground black pepper: to taste
instructions: Get a large pot of lightly salted water boiling. Add the linguine and cook until it's tender but still a little firm, which takes about 11 minutes. Drain the pasta once it's done.

Lightly spray a grill pan with cooking spray and heat it over medium heat. Put seasoned salt on both sides of the chicken. Cook the chicken for about 5 minutes per side, until it's no longer pink in the middle and the juices run clear. An instant-read thermometer should show at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C) in the center. Let the chicken cool a bit.
Put butter in a small saucepan and melt it over medium heat. Bring it to a low simmer and cook until the butter smells like caramel and has almost stopped making foam, which takes 5 to 10 minutes.

In a big bowl, mix the cooked linguine, chicken, spinach, basil, and thyme. Pour the browned butter over everything. Toss it all well to combine. Add the Mizithra cheese and pine nuts, then toss again. Finish by sprinkling with freshly ground black pepper.
author: wynter

title: Creamy Zucchini and Brie Soup
description: This soup has a smooth texture and a gentle taste. It's good for cold winter evenings or you can serve it chilled when it's warm out.
ingredients: Salt and ground black pepper, to taste
Brie cheese, cut in small pieces: 4 ounces
instructions: Warm up the oil in a big pot on medium heat. Put the zucchini, onion, and garlic in the hot oil and cook them, stirring, until water comes out of the zucchini, which takes about 10 minutes.

Pour the chicken stock and milk into the pot. Let it come to a boil, then turn the heat down to medium-low. Mix in the ground sage, salt, and pepper with the stock. Let it gently cook for 20 minutes. Add the Brie cheese and stir until it fully melts into the liquid, taking 5 to 7 minutes.

Pour the soup into a blender, making sure it's no more than half full. Put the lid on and hold it down. Give it a few quick pulses, then let it blend. Push the blended soup through a strainer into a clean pot. Blend the rest in batches until it's all smooth.
Stir the cream into the smooth soup and put the pot on medium-low heat. Cook it until it's hot all the way through, about 5 minutes. Put fresh sage leaves on top of each serving.
author: WLOUHOFF

title: Fun Santa Cupcakes for Christmas
description: These adorable cupcakes, made to look like little Santas, were a big hit with my kids during Christmas. They're super simple to decorate, and your children can easily join in the fun.
instructions: Spread a thin layer of vanilla frosting on each cupcake. Get a small bowl and put the red sprinkles in it. Dip the bottom third of each frosted cupcake into the sprinkles to form Santa's hat. For the hat's white trim, arrange about 6 white chocolate chips, flat side facing up, along the edge of the red sprinkle section. Put one more white chocolate chip on top to be the pom-pom.
For Santa's face, use 2 mini chocolate chips for the eyes and a red candy-coated chocolate piece for the nose. Sprinkle coconut flakes over the bottom third of the cupcake to create the beard.
author: barbara

title: Holiday Rice Cereal Trees
description: These festive Rice Krispies® Christmas trees offer a delightful holiday project for children. They use the classic crispy rice cereal recipe and are adorned with various candies.
ingredients: Green food coloring: 3 drops, or more if needed
Crispy rice cereal (like Rice Krispies®): 6 cups
Pretzel sticks: 14, or as many as needed
Candy stars: 14, or as many as needed
instructions: Get a 9x13-inch baking pan ready by spraying it with cooking spray.

Warm butter in a big saucepan on low heat. Add the marshmallows and stir all the time until they are fully melted and smooth, which takes 3 to 5 minutes. Mix in the food coloring, 3 to 4 drops at a time, until the color looks right. Keep stirring until the color is even. Take the pan off the heat and put in the crispy rice cereal. Use a buttered spatula to stir until all the cereal is coated and green.
Pour the cereal mix into the pan you prepared and press it down firmly. Sprinkle the top with sprinkles and press those in too. Let it sit and get firm for 20 to 30 minutes.

Cut the cereal mix in the pan in half lengthwise to make two long parts. From each part, cut out about 6 or 7 small triangle shapes for trees and move them to a plate. Carefully push one pretzel stick into the bottom of each triangle to make a "trunk"; if a triangle breaks apart, just squeeze it back together.
Pipe frosting onto the triangles to look like garland, and put a candy star on top of each one.
author: Happyschmoopies

title: Strawberry and Walnut Salad for Summer
description: I wanted to bring something different to a backyard party, so I created this salad. It brings together ideas from various salads I've enjoyed before. You can find my recipes for balsamic vinaigrette and creamy orange soy dressings on this site; both go really well with this dish.
ingredients: Small red onion, sliced thin into rings: 1
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Warm your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spread the walnuts out on a baking sheet.
Bake in the hot oven for 5 to 7 minutes, until the walnuts start to turn golden and smell toasty. Take them out and let them cool for about 5 minutes.
Get a big bowl and mix the cooled walnuts, strawberries, iceberg salad, baby spinach, feta cheese, red onion, and black pepper together.
author: Janna

title: Green Tea Powder Pancakes
description: Weekends are for relaxing and having a nice brunch, especially after working hard all week. It just feels right to make one of our favorite brunch foods: classic pancakes. There's something about a pile of soft, buttery breakfast cakes that makes the morning feel like dessert, even more so with chocolate chips in them. Have a great brunch! Put more white chocolate chips, honey, and butter on top, then eat up.
instructions: In a bowl, mix the flour, matcha, baking powder, and salt. Make a space in the middle of this dry mix. Put in 1 cup plus 1 tablespoon of cashew milk, the egg, olive oil, and vanilla. Stir the batter quickly until it's just mixed, and some small flour lumps are still there. Add the chocolate chips, then stir again for a short time.

Lightly grease a small pan and warm it over medium-low heat. Spoon 2 to 3 spoonfuls of batter into the middle of the pan, spreading it out with the back of the spoon. Cook until tiny bubbles appear and pop, which takes about 1 minute. Flip the pancake and cook until the edges are a light golden brown, about 1 more minute.
author: Aiya America

title: Coconut Milk and Pumpkin Puree Soup
description: The spices in this recipe blend together wonderfully, creating a truly delicious and flavorful soup. This dish is sure to impress even the pickiest eaters. Using organic vegetables will make the soup a beautiful color and give it a richer taste. Most people won't even realize you've used coconut milk instead of heavy cream, making it not only tasty but also packed with the health benefits of coconut. You can serve it with a spoonful of plain Greek yogurt, some chopped parsley, or a drizzle of good quality, cold-pressed extra virgin olive oil. Enjoy the vibrant, golden color!
ingredients: Small pumpkin or buttercup squash: 1 (peeled, cut into 1-inch cubes, 4 cups)
Flaked sea salt: 1 teaspoon, or to taste
instructions: Set your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Wrap the sweet potato in aluminum foil, then put it on an oven-safe dish to catch any drips.
Bake the sweet potato in the preheated oven until it's soft, which takes about 45 minutes.
While the sweet potato roasts, arrange the pumpkin, carrots, and onions on a baking pan. Brush them with olive oil, then sprinkle with salt, allspice, and white pepper.
Place them in the preheated oven and bake until soft, for 30 to 40 minutes.

Once the sweet potato and squash are cool enough to touch, peel them. Transfer them to a large saucepan, then add the carrots, onions, nutmeg, cumin, coriander, ginger, salt, and pepper. Stir in the chicken stock and coconut milk. Bring the soup to a boil, then lower the heat and let it simmer until it smells fragrant, about 20 minutes. Take it off the heat.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until it's smooth.
author: Pip

title: Zesty Oven-Baked Chicken with Cheesy Grits and Chorizo Sauce
description: This recipe takes a classic Southern comfort food and gives it a kick with some Mexican-inspired flavors.
ingredients: Mexican-style hot sauce (like Cholula®): ¼ cup
Chicken breasts, skinless and boneless, cut into 1-inch strips: 1 pound
Shredded Mexican cheese blend: ½ (8 ounce) package
Crumbled Cotija cheese: 1 teaspoon, or to taste
instructions: In a big bowl or a zip-top bag, combine the buttermilk and hot sauce. Mix them up well. Put the chicken strips in this mixture and let them sit for 4 hours, or even overnight.
Get your oven hot to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Put a wire rack on a baking sheet and spray it with cooking spray.

Mix the bread crumbs, flour, paprika, salt, garlic powder, black pepper, onion powder, oregano, thyme, and chili powder in a bowl. Take the chicken out of its marinade and coat it completely in the crumb mixture. Place the coated chicken onto the prepared wire rack.
Cook the chicken in the hot oven for about 30 minutes, until it's not pink inside and the juices are clear.

At the same time, pour the milk, water, salt, and pepper into a large pot. Bring it to a boil over high heat. Turn the heat down to low and add the grits. Put a lid on it and cook for 20 minutes, stirring every few minutes so it doesn't get lumpy. Take it off the heat, then stir in the Mexican cheese and butter until everything is mixed together and creamy.

While the chicken and grits are cooking, put the chorizo, onion, bell pepper, and jalapeno in a large skillet. Cook over medium-high heat for 5 to 7 minutes, until the meat is browned and the vegetables are soft. Pour out any extra grease from the skillet. Stir in the garlic and keep cooking over medium-high heat for about 30 seconds, until you can smell it.

Add the cherry tomatoes, vegetable broth, Worcestershire sauce, and hot sauce to the skillet. Turn the heat down to low and let it simmer for about 15 minutes, stirring sometimes, until the sauce gets thicker. Pour in the heavy cream; let it simmer more until the sauce is thick enough to coat a spoon, which should take about 5 more minutes.
Put the grits into a bowl, then spoon the chorizo sauce over them. Place the spicy baked chicken on top. Sprinkle with Cotija cheese if you like.
author: My Hot Southern Mess

title: Quick Fried Noodles with Seafood and Veggies
description: This is a simple and speedy Asian meal that I really enjoy making and eating.
ingredients: Green chile peppers: 3, cut into slices
Ground white pepper: 1 tablespoon, or just enough for your taste
Squid: 1, cleaned and cut into rings, or use more if you like
Fresh spinach: 4 ounces, cut up small
Fresh rice noodles: 18 ounces, rinsed and drained
instructions: Get a wok or big skillet hot over medium-high heat with the vegetable oil. Put in the onions, green chiles, garlic, and ginger; cook them, stirring, until they look golden, which takes about 2 minutes. Mix in the soy sauce, white pepper, and salt; cook for another minute.

Toss the prawns and squid into the wok; cook and stir until the prawns become pink, about 2 to 3 minutes. Add the spinach and carrot; cook until the spinach softens, which is another 2 to 3 minutes. Put in the noodles; mix everything together until it's all combined.
author: Djenna

title: Warm Chicken Salad with Fennel and Lemon
description: This dish brings together warm, roasted chicken and garlic for lots of flavor. Fresh fennel, onion, and celery add a great crunch. It's all served over a bed of arugula. You'll really enjoy this recipe!
ingredients: Roasted chicken (2 pounds), meat off bones and cut into bite-size pieces: 1
Fennel bulb, cored and thinly sliced: 1
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
instructions: Get a skillet hot with the olive oil over medium heat. Cook the garlic, stirring it, until it's soft and turns golden brown, about 3 to 5 minutes.
Pour in the lemon juice, then take it off the heat and let it cool down.
In a big bowl, mix the chicken, fennel, celery, red onion, and parsley together.
Add the cooled garlic and olive oil mixture, mayonnaise, lemon zest, salt, and pepper to the bowl and stir everything well.
Spread the arugula out on a serving plate, then spoon the chicken salad on top of it.
author: KrissyHipp30

title: Hearty Vegan Chickpea and Vegetable Soup
description: This soup features chickpeas and lots of vegetables in a tomato base. The fennel seeds add a special touch that makes every bite interesting.
ingredients: Grape tomatoes: 18, cut in half lengthwise
Salt and ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Put the garbanzo beans in a big container and add enough cool water to cover them by several inches. Let them soak for 8 hours or overnight, then drain the water.

Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a big pot. Add the garbanzo beans, then turn down the heat and let them simmer until they are almost soft, which takes about 45 minutes. Drain the beans and rinse them with cold water until they are cool.
Spread the garbanzo beans on a baking sheet and take off their skins.

Heat the olive oil in a big pot over medium heat. Cook the onion, stirring it, until it gets soft, about 3 minutes. Add the celery, carrots, garlic, and fennel seeds, then cook and stir for 4 minutes. Stir in the garbanzo beans, vegetable broth, and tomatoes. Let the soup simmer until the garbanzo beans are fully tender, about 15 minutes. Add the grape tomatoes and spinach leaves, and cook for 2 more minutes.
Season the soup with parsley, oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper. Mix everything well and take the pot off the heat. Cover the pot and let the soup sit for 10 minutes before you serve it.
author: PalouseBrand

title: Traditional Thai Pad Thai Noodles
description: This well-known Thai dish offers a great mix of spicy, sweet, salty, and sour flavors. Our recipe is like the traditional Bangkok version, not overly saucy like many restaurant dishes you might find in the West. Every bite is packed with flavor, lightly coated in a delicious sauce. Serve with lime wedges, fish sauce, sugar, white pepper or chili flakes, and vinegar on the side so everyone can adjust the taste to their liking.
ingredients: Raw peanuts: 2 tablespoons, or more if you like
Thai chile peppers: 6, seeded and chopped fine, or more if you like it spicier
Shallot: 1, chopped fine, or more if you like
Garlic cloves: 3, chopped fine, or more if you like
Boneless chicken: 1 pound, cut into 1/4-inch strips
Extra-firm tofu: ⅓ cup, cut into thin sticks
Ground white pepper: ½ teaspoon, or to taste
Large shrimp: ¼ pound, peeled, deveined, tails removed
instructions: Put the noodles in a big bowl and cover them with hot water. Let them sit for about 10 minutes until they are soft but still a bit firm. Then, drain the water.

Heat a wok or a large skillet on medium-high heat until it starts to smoke. Pour in the oil and let it heat until it looks shimmery. Add the peanuts and cook them for 1 to 2 minutes, stirring often, until they are roasted. Take the peanuts out of the wok.

Stir the chopped chile peppers, shallot, and garlic into the oil. Cook them for about 30 seconds until the garlic just starts to turn brown. Add the chicken and tofu, cooking for 4 to 5 minutes until the chicken is no longer pink inside and its juices are clear. Stir in the noodles quickly to mix them and stop them from sticking. Add the sugar, tamarind paste, fish sauce, and white pepper. Keep stirring constantly for about 2 minutes until the sauce gets thicker.

Push the noodle mix to one side of the wok. Crack the egg into the empty space. Stir the egg for 1 to 2 minutes until it's scrambled, then mix it into the noodles. Add the shrimp and cook for 2 to 3 minutes until they turn opaque. Finally, add the roasted peanuts, bean sprouts, chives, and lime juice. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 more minutes to combine all the flavors.
author: Bud W

title: Quick Thai-Style Chicken Wraps
description: These wraps are a great choice for a simple meal you can make ahead. Get all your ingredients ready in advance, then put everything together in about 5 minutes for a speedy lunch. You can use store-bought peanut sauce if you like, or prepare your own for a fresher taste.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
Lettuce leaves: 1 small head, or as desired
Carrots, peeled and cut into matchsticks: 3
instructions: Put the chicken between two sheets of plastic wrap on a sturdy, flat surface. Use a towel underneath to lessen noise. Pound the chicken flat with the smooth side of a meat mallet.
Warm up a grill pan over medium-high heat.

Put the chicken on the hot grill pan. Lightly season it with salt and pepper. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Flip the chicken and cook for another 3 to 5 minutes, until it's no longer pink inside and the juices run clear. A thermometer in the center should show at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
In a bowl, mix together the rice vinegar, cilantro, honey, lime juice, and red pepper flakes to make a dressing.
Move the cooked chicken to a cutting board and cut it into strips. Add these strips to the dressing and toss to coat.

Lay down some lettuce on each tortilla. Then add the carrots and sliced roasted red bell pepper. Top with the chicken strips. Drizzle any extra dressing over the lettuce. Roll up the tortilla around the filling. Do the same with the other tortilla.
author: Stefani

title: Chrystal's Crab Nachos
description: These yummy nachos are a tribute to a restaurant I loved that isn't around anymore.
ingredients: Shredded reduced-fat Cheddar cheese: 1/2 of an 8-ounce package
instructions: Get your oven hot to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Spread out the tortilla chips on a baking sheet that isn't greased, making sure they are in one layer.
In a bowl, mix the imitation crabmeat, sour cream, mayonnaise, onion, and dill. Put about one tablespoon of this mix on top of each chip. Then, sprinkle Cheddar cheese and paprika over them.
Put the baking sheet in the hot oven. Cook until the Cheddar cheese melts, which should take 6 to 8 minutes.
author: Chrystal Oates

title: Pan-Fried Chicken and Black Bean Wraps
description: These chimichangas skip the deep fryer and are pan-fried instead, making them a little lighter than the usual version. You can serve them with sour cream and guacamole, and try them with a glass of 14 Hands Hot to Trot too!
instructions: Warm a large saucepan over medium heat. Pour in the first tablespoon of oil, then add the onion and minced garlic. Cook them until they just turn see-through, which takes about 5 minutes. Stir in the oregano, cumin, and chili powder, cooking for another minute. Next, mix in the black beans, chicken, and salsa. Bring this to a boil and let it cook until everything is hot, about 5 minutes. Take it off the heat and stir in the Cheddar cheese, green onions, cilantro, and salt.

Warm your tortillas to make them soft and bendy. You can do this in a warm oven or on a hot stove burner. Lay the softened tortillas on a flat surface and divide the filling evenly among them. Fold the sides of each tortilla toward the middle, then roll them up tightly like a burrito.
Preheat your oven to 400 degrees F.

Heat the remaining cup of oil in a separate saute pan over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, brown the chimichangas on all sides, working in batches. Move the browned chimichangas to a baking pan, then put them in the oven and bake until they are thoroughly heated, about 15 minutes.
author: 14 Hands Winery

title: Morning Banana Yogurt Bowl
description: This is a great meal to make when you're camping. All the items are easy to pack: a banana, a small container of yogurt, a small bag of muesli, or some trail mix. You can use any kind of fresh fruit you want.
ingredients: One banana, cut in half from end to end
Sliced strawberries: 1/4 cup, or more if you like
Blueberries: 1/4 cup, or more if you like
instructions: Put the banana halves in a bowl for serving, then spoon the yogurt on top. Sprinkle the muesli over the yogurt. Finish by adding the strawberries and blueberries on top.
author: Bush Cook

title: Pumpkin and Sausage Bread Pudding with Sun-Dried Tomatoes
description: This warm bread pudding is full of cheese and has a nice crunch. It's a surprising but tasty way to use pumpkin. With sausage in it, you can serve it as a main dish or a big side. It would be great for Thanksgiving or a holiday breakfast.
ingredients: Softened butter: 1 teaspoon, more if needed
instructions: Get your oven hot to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Use butter to grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Put the sausage, pumpkin, onion, and sun-dried tomatoes into a large skillet. Cook this mix on medium heat, stirring it until the sausage turns brown, which takes about 5 to 8 minutes.

Move the sausage mix to a big bowl. Add the bread, heavy cream, Cheddar cheese, eggs, milk, Gruyere cheese, salt, and pepper to it. Mix everything together. Then, spread this mixture into the baking dish you prepared.
Cook it in the hot oven until it looks puffy and golden. This should take 30 to 45 minutes.
author: RusticJoyfylFood

title: Ham and Cheese Potato Bites
description: These simple cups are made by baking small potato nuggets into a shell, filling them with diced ham, and then melting Monterey Jack cheese on top, finished with fresh green onions.
ingredients: Frozen fried potato nuggets (like Tater Tots): 1/2 of a 32-ounce package
Cubed ham (Farmland brand suggested): 1/2 of a 16-ounce package
instructions: First, get your oven hot to 425 degrees F. Spray 12 muffin cups (each 2 1/2 inches wide) with nonstick cooking spray. Put 4 potato nuggets into each muffin cup. Bake these for 12 minutes. Take the muffin tin out of the oven. Use the bottom of a 1/4-cup measuring cup to press the potatoes down into the bottom and up the sides of each cup. Put the tray back in the oven and bake for another 12 minutes.

Next, put the ham into the potato cups, splitting it evenly. Bake for 10 more minutes, or until the potato cups look crispy and brown, and the ham is heated all the way through. Take the tray out of the oven.
Then, sprinkle the cheese over the ham in each cup. Bake for 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the edges look golden. Take the cups out of the muffin tins. Top with green onions or chives.
author: Farmland

title: Simple Butter Pie Crust
description: You only need flour, butter, salt, and water to make this tasty dough.
ingredients: Unsalted butter, cubed and frozen for 20 minutes: 1/2 cup
Ice water: 4 tablespoons, or extra if needed
instructions: Put the flour, butter, and salt into a food processor. Pulse it quickly about 15 times until the butter pieces are about the size of peas and covered in flour. Then, add the water and keep processing until all the flour is wet and the dough starts to clump together.

Lay two long pieces of plastic wrap in an 'X' shape and sprinkle some flour on them. Empty the dough onto the middle of the plastic wrap. Wrap it up, pushing the dough into a flat disk about 4 inches wide. Use a rolling pin to smooth the top, then flip it over and do the same to the other side.

Put it in the fridge for at least 4 hours, or ideally overnight. You can also put it in a freezer bag and freeze it for up to 3 months. If frozen, let it thaw in the fridge overnight before you use it.
author: MrsWheelbarrow

title: Lentil Salad with Italian Flavors
description: This salad is great for a light lunch or as a side with your evening meal. The Italian tastes come together wonderfully.
ingredients: Balsamic vinaigrette dressing: 1/4 cup, or more if needed
instructions: Get 4 cups of water boiling in a saucepan, then add the lentils. Put a lid on it and let it simmer until the lentils are soft, which takes about 35 minutes. Drain the water and let them cool down completely.

Split the cooled lentils among four salad plates. On top of the lentils, arrange slices of mozzarella cheese, prosciutto, and fresh basil leaves. Finish by drizzling balsamic vinaigrette over each salad.
author: schmerna

title: Quick Potato and Sausage Breakfast Bowls
description: This recipe for breakfast bowls, featuring potatoes, sausage, and eggs, comes from Lori Rice as part of the U.S. Potato Board's Potato Lovers Club Program.
ingredients: Fresh cilantro leaves: 1 cup, finely chopped (divided)
Green onions: 3, sliced (white and green parts kept separate)
Sour cream or plain Greek yogurt: for serving
instructions: Poke each potato several times with a fork. Cook them in the microwave on high for about 9 minutes, or follow your microwave's directions. Once they are soft, carefully move them to a cutting board and slice each potato in half. Let them cool down.

While the potatoes cook in the microwave, begin preparing the sausage. Put the sausage in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Break it up into small pieces and stir it sometimes. Cook until it's no longer pink, which takes about 10 minutes.
As the sausage cooks, chop all your vegetables and herbs. Coarsely chop the spinach. Finely chop the cilantro. Slice the green onions and keep the white parts separate from the green tops.

When the sausage is almost done, crack the eggs into a medium bowl. Whisk in ¼ teaspoon of black pepper, the garlic powder, and chili powder. Keep whisking until the egg whites and yolks are fully mixed, about 15 seconds.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Pour in the eggs. Cook, stirring now and then, for about 5 minutes. Stir in the spinach and cook just until the eggs are done and the spinach starts to wilt, for 1 or 2 more minutes.

While the eggs cook, you can start on the potatoes. Roughly chop the potatoes (leave the skins on) and put them in a medium bowl. Stir in the white parts of the green onions, half of the chopped cilantro, the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil, the remaining ¼ teaspoon of black pepper, and the sea salt. Mix these ingredients into the potatoes, making sure the potatoes stay in chunky pieces.

To put the bowls together, arrange equal amounts of potatoes, eggs, and sausage in each of 4 bowls. Crumble the cotija cheese and sprinkle an equal amount over each bowl. Divide the rest of the cilantro and the green parts of the green onions, sprinkling them into each bowl. Add your favorite toppings and serve.
author: Potato Goodness

title: Mushroom and Artichoke Heart Soup
description: This soup brings together a lovely blend of light, fresh tastes. It's bound to become a top choice for you.
ingredients: Butter: ½ cup, split into two parts
Carrots: 2, peeled and cut into small pieces
Artichoke hearts: 2 cans (14 ounces each), drained and sliced
instructions: Take ¼ cup of the butter and melt it in a big pot over medium heat. Toss in the carrots, celery, and green onions. Cook and stir this mix for about 10 minutes until it starts to brown. Then, add the portobello mushrooms and cook them until they get soft, which takes 3 to 4 minutes.
Pour the chicken broth into the pot. Add the artichoke hearts, thyme, oregano, cayenne pepper, and bay leaves. Let the soup simmer for 15 to 20 minutes so the flavors can blend together.

In a small skillet, melt the other ¼ cup of butter on low heat. Stir in the flour and cook it for about 1 minute until it forms a paste. Pour in the milk. Bring this mixture to a simmer and stir it constantly for about 5 minutes until it thickens.

Pour the thickened milk mixture into your soup. Slowly stir in the heavy cream. Let the soup simmer for 3 to 5 minutes until it thickens a bit and is hot all the way through. Remember to take out the bay leaves before you serve it.
author: Jenn&Steve

title: Mini Baked Potato Hand Pies
description: These small hand pies taste just like a loaded baked potato, but they're wrapped in a flaky, buttery crust! They're great for a quick snack or a light meal. You can serve them with extra sour cream for dipping.
ingredients: Thick-cut bacon: 3 slices, cut into 1/4-inch pieces
Yukon Gold potatoes: 1/2 pound, cut into small cubes
instructions: Put the bacon in a nonstick pan and cook it over medium-high heat. Stir it sometimes until the fat starts to melt, which takes about 3 minutes. Add the chopped green onions and keep cooking until the bacon is crispy, about 1 more minute. Move the bacon and onions to a plate using a spoon with slots.

Place the potato cubes into the same pan and mix them around to get them coated in the bacon grease. Cook the potatoes on medium-high heat for 4 minutes, stirring them now and then so they don't stick. Take the pan off the heat and put a lid on it. Let the potatoes cool down.
Once the potatoes are cool, mix in the bacon and green onions. Then, stir in the Cheddar cheese and sour cream. Season everything with pepper.
Turn your oven on to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Get a baking sheet ready by putting parchment paper on it.

Roll out the pie crusts on a flat surface. Use a 3-inch biscuit cutter or a glass to cut out 24 circles. Take 12 of these circles and put a spoonful of the potato mix in the middle of each, making sure to leave space around the edges. Put the other 12 circles on top of these, pressing down gently.

Pick up each hand pie and pinch the edges together to close them. Put them back on your work surface and use a fork to press the edges together firmly. Place the finished pies on the baking sheet you prepared. Do this for all the remaining pies.
Use a pastry brush to put the beaten egg on top of all the pies.
Cook the pies in the hot oven until they turn golden brown, which should take 18 to 20 minutes.
author: Kim's Cooking Now

title: Grilled Vegetable and Bread Salad
description: Make a fantastic summer meal with this Italian-style bread salad. It uses multigrain bread, ripe tomatoes, grilled zucchini, eggplant, and fresh arugula for a fresh take on panzanella.
ingredients: Nature's Own® Perfectly Crafted Multigrain Bread: 6 slices
Zucchini: 1 medium, cut in half lengthwise
Yellow squash: 1 medium, cut in half lengthwise
Japanese eggplant: 1 medium, cut in half lengthwise
Assorted color tomatoes: 1 pound, cut into 1-inch pieces
instructions: Take 2 tablespoons of the olive oil and brush it onto the bread, zucchini, squash, eggplant, and red onion. Season these items with salt, garlic powder, and black pepper.

Place the zucchini, yellow squash, eggplant, and red onion on a grill rack directly over medium-high heat. Close the grill cover and cook for 6 to 8 minutes until they are tender. Make sure to turn them over halfway through cooking. Once done, take the vegetables off the grill and let them cool down a little.

Put the bread on the grill rack directly over medium-high heat. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes until it's toasted and has some char marks. Flip the bread once while it cooks. Remove the bread and set it aside.

Cut the grilled and cooled vegetables into 1-inch pieces. Put them into a very large bowl. Pour in the remaining 3 tablespoons of olive oil and the red wine vinegar, then toss everything together. Add the arugula, tomatoes, 1 cup of Parmesan cheese, and basil, then gently mix to combine.
Cut the grilled bread into 1-inch pieces. Add these bread pieces to the vegetable mixture and gently toss to combine them.
Serve this dish right away, or you can let it sit at room temperature for up to 30 minutes. If you want, sprinkle with extra Parmesan cheese before serving.
author: Nature's Own

title: Grilled Shrimp Salad with Italian Dressing
description: This recipe makes a tasty salad with grilled shrimp.
ingredients: Medium uncooked shrimp, peeled and deveined: 1 pound
instructions: Get your outdoor grill ready for medium-high heat and put a little oil on the grate.
Cook the shrimp on the grill until they are bright pink outside and the meat is not see-through, about 2 minutes on each side. Let them cool for 10 minutes, then move them to a bowl that's not metal.

Pour the Italian dressing and lime juice over the shrimp that have cooled down, and mix to cover. Add the chopped red bell peppers, onion, celery, and cilantro; mix them gently. Cover the bowl and put it in the fridge for 1 hour.
Put the lettuce on a plate for serving. Spoon the shrimp mixture on top and then serve it.
author: Bernice Dray

title: Carrot Fettuccine with Creamy Ham Sauce
description: Transform carrots into thin, gluten-free noodles using a peeler or spiralizer. Then, cover them in a rich sauce made with white wine, cream, peas, ham, and butter.
ingredients: Sliced ham, cut into thin strips: ¼ pound
instructions: Shave the carrots into long, fettuccine-style strands using a vegetable peeler.
Put the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once the foam goes away, add the onion and ham. Cook and stir these for 3 minutes.
Toss the carrot strands, garlic, and wine into the skillet with the onion mixture. Turn the heat down to low and put a lid on it. Cook for about 10 minutes, stirring now and then.
Pour the cream and peas into the skillet. Bring this mix to a boil. Turn the heat down, cover, and let it simmer for 5 more minutes. Stir in the mustard, salt, and pepper.
author: Virginia Vohasek

title: Classic Ham and Pepper Omelet
description: This recipe makes a great Western omelet. Feel free to include red bell peppers or sausage if those are your favorite additions.
ingredients: Green bell pepper, chopped: ¼ cup
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
instructions: First, melt 1 teaspoon of butter in a small skillet on medium heat. Add the mushrooms, bell pepper, and green onions to the pan. Cook them until they are soft, which takes about 5 minutes. Stir in the ham and cook for about 1 minute until it's warmed through. Season this mix with salt and pepper. Transfer the filling into a small bowl and keep it warm.
Take the eggs and beat them in a bowl. Season them with salt and pepper.

Put the same skillet back on medium-high heat. Add the last 1 teaspoon of butter and let it heat until it gets foamy. Pour in the beaten eggs and cook for 30 seconds. Use a spatula to lift the edges of the omelet. This lets the uncooked egg flow underneath to touch the hot pan. Gently shake and tilt the pan to move the uncooked egg around. Keep doing this until the top looks set, but is still a bit moist and soft, about 2 minutes.
Spread the warm filling over one half of the cooked omelet. Fold the other half of the omelet over the filling, then slide the omelet onto a plate.
author: aDsm

title: Sweet and Savory Grilled Peach Flatbread with Goat Cheese
description: Make pizza night special with this easy-to-share flatbread that mixes sweet and savory flavors, perfect with Chateau Ste. Michelle wines.
instructions: Get your grill hot to medium-high. Once it's ready, spray or brush each peach quarter with cooking spray or olive oil. Put the peaches cut-side down on the grill just until you see grill marks, about 2 to 3 minutes. Take them off and put them in the fridge.

Heat your oven to 400 degrees F. Break up the goat cheese and grate the fontina cheese; set these aside. Put your flatbreads on a baking sheet with parchment paper. Brush each flatbread with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and add a light sprinkle of salt. Slice or cube the chilled peach.
Split the goat cheese and fontina cheese evenly between the two flatbreads, then arrange the peaches on top.
Put the flatbreads in the oven and bake for 8 to 10 minutes. Take them out and scatter the chopped arugula over them.
author: Chateau Ste Michelle

title: Swirled Chocolate and Mint Cookies
description: These cookies are a blast for kids to help make, especially when they get to squish the dough balls together to create the swirly look. Cream cheese makes them rich and chewy. Just be sure your butter and cream cheese are soft before you start, so everything mixes well. The food coloring is not a must; you can skip it or add more for a brighter green.
instructions: Warm up your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Get a baking sheet ready by lining it with a silicone mat or parchment paper.

In a bowl, combine the 1 3/4 cups sugar, butter, cream cheese, baking powder, salt, peppermint extract, and vanilla extract. Beat these items with a mixer until they are well combined, which should take about 2 to 3 minutes. Mix in the egg until it's fully blended. Add 2 cups of the flour and mix on low speed for 2 to 3 minutes, until it's all together (the dough will be very soft).

Split the dough into two roughly equal parts and place one part in a different bowl. In one half of the dough, mix in the food coloring (if you're using it) and the remaining 1/2 cup of flour. Mix the cocoa powder into the other half of the dough. Pour the 1/2 cup sugar into a small bowl.

Take about 1 teaspoon of the green dough and roll it into a small ball; do this for all the green dough. Do the same with the chocolate dough. For each cookie, arrange 4 small dough balls in a line, alternating colors: green, chocolate, green, chocolate. Press the 4 small dough balls together and gently roll them into one larger ball. Roll this larger ball in the sugar; place it on the prepared baking sheet, leaving about 2 inches between each cookie. Keep doing this until all the dough is used.

Bake the cookies until their edges start to turn a light golden color, about 13 to 15 minutes. Let them cool on the baking sheet for 10 minutes. Afterwards, move them to a wire rack to cool completely.
author: eatthelove

title: Mango Coconut Vegan Smoothie Bowl
description: This is a tasty plant-based smoothie made with mango, coconut, and vanilla flavor.
instructions: Put the mango chunks, almond milk, banana, coconut cream, and vanilla extract into a blender. Blend until the smoothie is thick and smooth. Pour this mix into a bowl.
Sprinkle the flaked coconut, goji berries, and chia seeds on top of the smoothie bowl.
author: barbara

title: Spinach Salad with Pomegranate and Almonds
description: This easy salad features a simple homemade dressing. It combines crisp almonds and bright pomegranate seeds, making it a hit even with those who usually avoid vegetables. This recipe from Allrecipes Magazine draws inspiration from Jamie's Cranberry Spinach Salad.
instructions: Get a small saucepan and melt the butter over medium heat. Then, put in the almonds; cook them, stirring often, until they're lightly browned.
For the dressing, mix the oil, sugar, both vinegars, sesame seeds, poppy seeds, onion, and paprika together in a bowl.
In a big bowl, combine the spinach, the toasted almonds, and the pomegranate seeds. Pour the dressing over everything and toss until coated.
author: Allrecipes Magazine

title: Comforting Squash Risotto
description: A straightforward and satisfying meal featuring butternut squash prepared as a creamy risotto.
ingredients: Cooked and mashed butternut squash: 1 pound
Parmesan cheese, finely shredded: 8 tablespoons, split
Salt and black pepper, to taste
instructions: Get your broth ready by pouring it into a medium saucepan. Cover it up and let it warm over medium-low heat for about 10 minutes.

Warm the oil in a big saucepan on medium heat. Put in the onion and cook it until it's clear, which takes 6 to 8 minutes. Add the rice, then cook and stir for 1 minute. Pour in the wine and let it bubble, mixing all the time, until it's all soaked up, around 2 minutes. Add 1/2 cup of the warm broth and let it bubble, stirring often, until it's gone, for about 5 minutes. Keep doing this with the rest of the broth, adding 1/2 cup at a time and mixing until all the liquid is absorbed and the rice is soft and smooth, which takes another 25 minutes.

While the rice is cooking, mash up your cooked squash. Mix the mashed squash into the rice along with 6 tablespoons of Parmesan cheese, the sage, salt, and pepper. Stir until the cheese is melted. Add the rest of the Parmesan on top and eat right away.
author: Sara s

title: Fresh Tuna Salad with Mint-Lime Dressing
description: This recipe is my closest attempt at making a restaurant favorite at home. The salad will have a good amount of dressing, which is how it's served at the restaurant. It just doesn't taste as good with less dressing. I usually use about three-quarters of the dressing, but you can use more or less depending on what you like.
ingredients: Fresh ahi (yellowfin) tuna steak: 1 (3 ounce) piece
Salt and ground black pepper: 1 pinch, to taste
instructions: In a bowl, mix together the olive oil, lime juice, cilantro, garlic, mint, lemon juice, and 1/8 teaspoon salt. Put the dressing in the fridge for at least one hour or overnight for the best taste.
Get your outdoor grill hot on high heat and oil the grill grates.
Put the salad greens, romaine lettuce, mango, peanuts, cucumber, and chow mein noodles into a salad bowl and toss them together.
Sprinkle the tuna on all sides with salt and black pepper.

Place the tuna on the hot grill. Cook until the outside is browned and seared, but the inside is still red. This takes about 1 1/2 minutes on each side for rare tuna. After cooking, cut the grilled tuna into slices.
Arrange the avocado slices and grilled tuna on top of the salad; add the dressing as you like.
author: sweetie26

title: Roasted Small Potatoes with Italian Seasoning
description: You can get these potatoes ready and baking quickly, making them a simple side for your main meal.
ingredients: Baby potatoes, scrubbed and cut in half: 24
Dry Italian-style salad dressing mix: 1 package (0.7 ounce)
instructions: Get your oven hot to 400°F (200°C). Put foil in a baking dish or on a sheet with a rim.

Put the cut potatoes in a big plastic bag that seals. Pour in the olive oil and the Italian dressing mix. Close the bag and shake it well so every potato piece gets covered. Move them to the baking dish you got ready.
Bake in the hot oven until the potatoes are soft. Flip them over halfway through the cooking time. This should take about 30 minutes.
author: Jules

title: Savory Rice and Lentil Porridge
description: This well-known South Indian breakfast is made mostly from rice and lentils. You can eat it any time of day. It pairs well with spicy chutney and vatral-kozhambu, which is a spicy and sour sauce.
ingredients: Water: 4 cups, or as you like
Fresh ginger root, minced: 1 (1 inch) piece
instructions: Get a large skillet hot over medium heat. Put the rice and lentils in. Cook and stir them until they smell good and are lightly toasted, about 3 to 4 minutes. Then, rinse them off.

Put the rinsed rice and lentil mix into a rice cooker or pressure cooker. Add 1 tablespoon of ghee and the salt. Pour in the water. Cook it using the machine's directions until the rice and lentils are soft and pasty, taking 20 to 25 minutes. Stir and mash it until it's a smooth paste.

Warm up 1 tablespoon of ghee in a skillet on medium-high heat. Add the black pepper and cumin seeds. Cook until the seeds start to pop, which should be 2 to 3 minutes. Mix this cumin stuff into the rice and lentil mixture.
Tear the curry leaves into pieces and stir them into the rice and lentil mix. Put in the ginger next. Add more salt if needed.

Heat the last 1 tablespoon of ghee in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir the cashews until they are toasted and smell good, about 2 to 4 minutes. Sprinkle these toasted cashews over the rice and lentil mixture.
author: Mojo jojo

title: Tomato, Mozzarella, and Basil Pastries
description: These vegetarian pastries are great for anyone eating less meat or on a plant-based diet. They have a yummy inside of mozzarella, tomato, and fresh basil. They are light but still fill you up, making them a simple and tasty meal for friends and family.
ingredients: Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
instructions: Put the tomatoes and basil together in a bowl. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the mozzarella cheese and olive oil. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese on top. Let this sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes.
Get your oven hot to 400°F (200°C). Spray two baking sheets with cooking spray to grease them.

Lay out the pastry discs on a flat surface. Wet the edges of each disc with a little water. Put a big spoonful of the tomato mix in the middle of each disc. Fold the pastry over and use a fork to press the edges closed.
Move the finished empanadas to the greased baking trays. Brush mustard on top of each one, then sprinkle sesame seeds over the mustard.
Bake in the hot oven until they are golden brown, which takes about 20 minutes. Let them cool down for 5 minutes before you eat them.
author: Fioa

title: Cool Cucumber and Wood Ear Salad
description: This cool cucumber and wood ear mushroom salad is a good way to get flavor and nutrients. Wood ear mushrooms are often found in Asian stores and go great with cucumber in this dish.
ingredients: Dried wood ear mushrooms: ½ ounce
Chopped Thai chile pepper: ½ teaspoon
instructions: Put the mushrooms in water for 15 to 20 minutes until they get soft. Drain them, then put them in a pot on medium heat and boil for 2 minutes. Drain again and let them get cool.

Get a bowl and mix the lime juice, soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, sugar, and chile pepper together. Add the cucumber, mushrooms, and sesame seeds to the bowl and toss everything. Put it in the fridge for at least 1 hour before you eat it.
author: MyNutriCounter

title: Simple Cornmeal Griddle Cakes
description: These griddle cakes are a common snack in places like Colombia, Venezuela, and Panama. They are great with toppings like cheese, salsa, cream cheese, or butter. I like to melt cheese right on top while they cook, which makes them taste even better!
ingredients: Butter: 1 tablespoon, or more if needed
instructions: In a bowl, mix the water, cornmeal, and salt. Let the mixture sit for about 5 minutes until the water is soaked up. Shape the dough into flat cakes, about 5 inches wide and half an inch thick.
Put some butter on a griddle. Cook each cake one at a time over medium-high heat. Cook them until they are a bit brown, which takes about 3 minutes on each side.
author: Jennifer M

title: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto, Tomatoes, and Broccoli
description: This simple recipe brings together fresh zucchini noodles, bright tomatoes, and healthy broccoli with a flavorful pesto sauce for a tasty meal.
ingredients: Salt and ground black pepper: 1 pinch, to taste
instructions: Warm up 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a medium-sized skillet or saute pan on medium heat. Toss in the broccoli, cherry tomatoes, and pesto. Cook these ingredients, stirring often, for 5 to 10 minutes. Next, add the zucchini noodles and keep cooking and stirring for about 5 more minutes, until the vegetables are soft.
Take the pan off the heat. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper over everything. Let it sit for 3 to 5 minutes before you serve it.
author: alohakellygirl

title: Turkey Taco Soup
description: This recipe makes a taco soup using ground turkey. Finish it off with some cheese and sour cream when serving.
ingredients: Reduced-sodium taco seasoning mix: 1 (1.25 ounce) package
Dark red kidney beans: 1 (15 ounce) can
instructions: Get a big pot hot over medium-high heat. Put the ground turkey in the hot pot and cook it until it's brown and broken up, which takes about 5 to 7 minutes. Pour out any fat.
Toss the diced onion into the pot and stir it around on medium heat until it's see-through, about 5 minutes. Pour in the beer and taco seasoning, stirring until the beer has cooked down.
Mix in both cans of diced tomatoes, the black beans, kidney beans, corn, and green chiles. Let it gently cook on medium-low heat for 1 hour.
author: ZELEPUNKIN

title: Ancho Chili Chicken with Asian Flavors
description: This chicken dish has a great flavor from ancho chili peppers and a few other spices. It's good with a mandarin orange salad and some greens. A nice Riesling wine goes well with it. You can also put the chicken on bamboo sticks that have soaked in water for 20 minutes, then cook them over a flame.
ingredients: 1 big dried ancho chile pepper, torn into pieces
1 pound of chicken breast, cut into thin slices
instructions: Put the torn ancho chile, soy sauce, brown sugar, lemon grass, ground turmeric, and ground allspice into a big bag that seals. Add the chicken to the bag and shake it up until all the chicken is covered. Put it in the fridge for at least 1 hour to marinate.

Move the chicken to a skillet and cook it on medium heat. Cook until the middle of the chicken is not pink anymore and the juices are clear. This usually takes about 10 minutes. Use a meat thermometer to check; it should show at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C) in the thickest part.
author: ally-gator

title: Thai Basil Pork Stir-Fry
description: This is a popular Thai dish called Pad Krapao. It's really good served with rice, and you can put a fried egg on top if you want.
ingredients: Hot chile peppers: 3 large, cut into thin slices
Chile paste in soybean oil: 1 tablespoon
instructions: Warm up 3 tablespoons of oil in a wok on high heat. Toss in the chopped garlic and sliced chile peppers, cooking them until the garlic starts to turn brown, which takes about 30 seconds. Add the pork and stir-fry it until it's browned, around 3 minutes. Pour in the dark soy sauce, sweet soy sauce, and fish sauce. Keep cooking and stirring until about half of the liquid is gone, which takes roughly 3 minutes.

Add the chile paste, onion, and bell pepper to the wok. Stir-fry everything until the pork is fully cooked, which should take 5 to 6 minutes. Mix in the basil leaves and season with the pepper. Stir it all together well.
author: Gingi Sheppard

title: Thai-Inspired Fresh Spring Rolls
description: These spring rolls are packed with fresh ingredients and are a lighter option. They take a bit of effort to put together, but your friends will love them, making the time worthwhile.
ingredients: Red bell pepper: 1, cut into thin strips
Mango: ½, cut into thin strips
Large carrot: 1, peeled and cut into thin strips
Green onions (white parts only): 4, cut into thin strips
Minced dried Thai chile peppers: ½ teaspoon
instructions: Get a bowl and put in the bell pepper, mango, carrot, green onions, and cilantro. Mix everything until the veggies are spread out evenly.
In a separate bowl, stir together the cashew butter, sesame oil, ginger, garlic, and Thai chiles until the dressing is fully combined.
Take a big bowl and fill it with boiling water. Dip one rice paper sheet into the water until it gets soft; this will take 2 to 5 seconds.
Place two softened rice papers on your work surface, one on top of the other. Put some dressing in the middle, then layer the vegetable mix on top of that.

Fold in the sides of the rice paper, then roll it up. Gently press down on the vegetables as you roll to make the spring roll tight. Do this for all the remaining rice papers. Let them sit for 2 to 5 minutes. Cut them on an angle before serving.
author: Jodi Rice

title: Pork Noodle Bowl with Red Curry Sauce
description: This dish brings together my love for Thai curry and noodle bowls. It might not be traditional, but it's a satisfying meal.
ingredients: Honey: 1 tablespoon, or as you like
Boneless pork loin chops, cut into thin strips: 1 ½ pounds
Fresh cilantro, chopped: ¼ cup, or to taste
instructions: Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Cook the noodles in the boiling water until they're tender but still a little firm, stirring sometimes, which takes about 2 minutes. Drain them and put them aside.
At the same time, mix the soy sauce, honey, and fish sauce in a small bowl until they're well combined; set this mix aside.

Heat a large nonstick skillet on medium for 1 to 2 minutes. Pour in the vegetable oil. Add the curry paste, garlic, and ginger paste; stir them around until they smell good, for about 1 minute. Add the coconut milk a bit at a time, stirring as you pour to keep the sauce from breaking apart.

Put in the pork strips, carrots, and snap peas and cook until the pork is done, which is about 5 minutes. Toss the drained noodles into the skillet, then add the soy sauce mixture. Let it simmer until the sauce gets thicker, for 4 to 5 minutes.
Divide the pork and noodle mix into serving bowls. Top each serving with cilantro, lime zest, and the lime juice. Serve it right away.
author: thedailygourmet

title: Creamy Seafood Risotto with Lemon
description: This yummy dish gets its great flavor from white wine, lemon, and butter. It's a nice meal for a fancy dinner or just for your family.
ingredients: Seafood Broth (CAMPBELL'S® 30% Less Sodium Ready To Use): 1 carton (900 ml)
Dry white wine (like Sauvignon Blanc): 1/2 cup
instructions: Warm up the carton of seafood broth in a pot. Make sure it gets hot but doesn't boil.

In a separate pot with a heavy bottom, melt 4 and 1/2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Cook the chopped shallots in it for 2 to 3 minutes until they look see-through. Put the rice into this pot. Stir the rice around for 2 to 3 minutes until every grain is covered in butter and starts to get a little toasted.

Turn the heat up high and pour in the white wine. Use a wooden spoon to stir the rice really well. Once the wine boils, turn the heat down so it's just gently bubbling. Stir almost all the time to make the rice release its starch and create a creamy sauce. Be careful not to let the rice stick or sizzle on the pot's bottom.

When most of the wine has cooked away, add half of the warm seafood broth. Keep stirring almost non-stop until this liquid is almost gone, then pour in the rest of the warm broth. Continue heating and stirring until the sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Adding and stirring in all the broth should take about 15 to 20 minutes.

Add the shrimp, parsley, lemon zest, and the last tablespoon of butter. Cook and stir until the rice is soft and the shrimp turns pink and firm, but still tender, which takes about 5 minutes. The risotto should be loose and creamy when it's done.
author: Campbell's Canada

title: Fast Tomatillo Guacamole Dip
description: This creamy, zesty, and spicy guacamole might become your go-to dip. It's great with tortilla chips or as a topping for your favorite tacos.
ingredients: Jalapeno pepper: 1, seeded and chopped (add more if you like extra spice)
Garlic: 1 clove, chopped (or more, to your liking)
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
instructions: Put the chopped avocado, tomatillo, onion, jalapeno, garlic, lime juice, cilantro, cumin, salt, and pepper into a blender. Blend for 2 to 3 minutes until everything is smooth.
author: Jill Garcia Schmidt

title: Banana and Yogurt Layered Dessert
description: These simple layered treats are special! When creamy instant pudding and zesty Greek yogurt combine, you can enjoy this dessert for breakfast if you want. It's a sweet snack that offers lots of protein and good stuff for you.
ingredients: Instant vanilla pudding mix (2.5 ounces): 1 package
instructions: Put your banana slices in a bowl. Toss them with the lemon juice so they don't turn brown.
Get a bowl and whisk together the heavy cream, Greek yogurt, and vanilla pudding mix. Keep whisking until the pudding is thick and smooth.

Grab four 8-ounce clear glasses. Put 2 tablespoons of crushed cookies at the bottom of each. On top of the cookies, add 2 to 3 tablespoons of the pudding mix and 3 to 4 banana slices. Do these layers two more times.
author: RusticJoyfylFood

title: Cool Crab and Cabbage Slaw
description: When the weather gets warm, this crisp and chilled salad is just right. You can serve it with a red wine vinaigrette or any dressing you like.
ingredients: Sliced black olives (2.25 ounce can), drained: 1
instructions: In a big mixing bowl, combine the crabmeat, cabbage, celery, radishes, olives, and green onions. Keep mixing until everything is spread out well.
author: bd.weld

title: Rich Flourless Chocolate Cookies
description: These simple cookies are great for anyone who loves chocolate. They're quick to make, don't use any flour, and are naturally gluten-free.
instructions: Get your oven hot to 400°F (200°C). Spray two baking sheets with cooking spray.

Put the finely chopped bittersweet chocolate in a double boiler over simmering water. Keep stirring and scraping the sides with a rubber spatula so it doesn't burn. Take it off the heat and let it cool down a bit.
In a big bowl, use an electric mixer to beat the egg whites until they form soft peaks. Slowly add in 1 cup of the confectioners' sugar until the mix looks like soft marshmallow creme.

In another bowl, whisk together 1/2 cup of confectioners' sugar, the cocoa powder, cornstarch, and salt. Beat this sugar mix into the egg white mix on a low speed until you have a soft meringue. Stir in the cooled melted bittersweet chocolate and the chopped dark chocolate until the cookie dough gets firm.

Put the last 1/2 cup of confectioners' sugar in a bowl. Take about a tablespoon of dough, roll it into a ball, and then roll the ball in the confectioners' sugar until it's fully covered. Do this for all the dough and sugar. Put the cookies 2 inches apart on the baking sheets and sprinkle coarse salt on top of each one.

Bake the cookies in the hot oven until cracks show on top, which should take 9 to 10 minutes. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheets for 10 minutes, then move them to a wire rack to cool all the way.
author: jamiebrooke5761

title: Meatless Tempeh, Lettuce, and Tomato Sandwich
description: For those who enjoyed BLTs before going vegetarian, this is a fantastic meat-free option. It gives you all the classic tastes without any meat. The texture of tempeh isn't like bacon, but I prefer it over other bacon substitutes I've tried.
ingredients: Mayonnaise: 2 teaspoons, or as much as you like
Whole wheat bread: 2 slices, made into toast
instructions: Warm up the oil in a pan over high heat. Put the tempeh bacon into the hot oil and cook until it gets a light brown color, about 2 to 4 minutes on each side.

Spread mayonnaise on one side of each piece of toast. On one slice of toast (mayonnaise side up), stack one piece of lettuce, one tomato slice, and the tempeh bacon. Place the other tomato slice and lettuce leaf on top of the tempeh. Finish by putting the other slice of toast on top, with the mayonnaise side facing down.
author: Stacey

title: Creamy Tahini Ice Cream with Strawberry and Almond
description: Get ready for a delicious dessert experience with this tahini ice cream. It's a popular flavor you'll love.
ingredients: Full-fat coconut milk (two 14-ounce cans), chilled overnight
Pitted dates: 5, soaked in hot water for 30 minutes then drained
instructions: Put your ice cream maker's base in the freezer for a minimum of 12 hours.

Mix the coconut milk, half a cup of strawberries, tahini, dates, and almond extract together in a fast blender. Blend until the strawberries are broken down and everything is mixed well, about 1 minute. Pour this mixture into your ice cream maker and let it churn as the maker's instructions say, for 5 to 10 minutes.
When the mixture starts getting thicker, add in the rest of the strawberries (the other half cup) and the sliced almonds. Keep mixing until it's thick, another 10 to 20 minutes.
Eat this right away as a soft-serve, topped with more strawberries and sesame seeds. Or, you can put the ice cream in the freezer for 1 to 2 hours to make it firmer.
author: Angela Sackett  Superhotmama

title: Grilled Garden Vegetable Salad from Sicily
description: This recipe from Sicily is a good way to use fresh vegetables from your garden. It's nice served cold as a summer salad or next to a steak. You can also put it on bread or over lettuce.
ingredients: Eggplant, large: 1, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch slices
Sweet onion, large: 1, peeled and cut in half
Red bell pepper: 1, cut in half and seeds removed
Green bell pepper: 1, cut in half and seeds removed
instructions: Get your outdoor grill ready for medium-high heat. Lightly put oil on the grill grates.

Put the eggplant, onion, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, and zucchini on the grill. Cook them until they are a bit soft and have grill marks on both sides. This will take 15 to 30 minutes. Take the vegetables off the grill and cut them into cubes. Move them into a big bowl.
Add the tomatoes, vinegar, olive oil, basil, salt, and pepper to the bowl. Mix everything really well. Put it in the fridge for 8 hours or overnight. Mix it again before you serve it.
author: impellizzeri kitchen

title: Chocolate Cookies with Marshmallow Frosting
description: These soft chocolate cookies use hot cocoa mix to get that classic taste everyone loves. They're finished with a sweet marshmallow topping and are a hit with families around Christmas.
ingredients: Instant hot cocoa mix: 8 (1 ounce) packets
instructions: Warm up your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

In a big bowl, put the hot cocoa mix, 1/2 cup butter, and eggs. Use an electric mixer to beat them until smooth. Slowly add the flour, baking powder, and salt, mixing everything well. Spoon small amounts of dough onto baking sheets that aren't greased.
Bake in the hot oven until the edges are dry, which takes about 8 minutes. Let the cookies sit on the baking sheets for 5 minutes. Move them to wire racks for them to cool down all the way.
In a small bowl, mix the confectioners' sugar and milk together.

Put marshmallows and 1 tablespoon of butter into a bowl that's safe for the microwave. Heat it in the microwave until the marshmallows melt, about 30 seconds. Use a fork to stir this into the confectioners' sugar mix until it's smooth.
Pour the marshmallow topping over the cooled cookies. Let them sit until the topping hardens, about 15 minutes.
author: Stacey Hahn

title: Cottage Cheese Bowl with Hummingbird Cake Flavors
description: Get all the great taste of Hummingbird Cake in a bowl that's a bit healthier for you.
ingredients: Maple syrup: 1 tablespoon (adjust to your liking)
instructions: In a bowl, mix the cottage cheese, maple syrup, pineapple juice, vanilla extract, cinnamon, nutmeg, and allspice until everything is well combined. Split this mixture into two separate bowls.
Place pineapple chunks, banana slices, pecans, and coconut on top of each bowl. Eat right away.
author: Kim

title: Spicy Kimchi Corned Beef with Root Vegetables
description: Forget your usual corned beef and cabbage. This recipe gives a popular holiday meal a Korean spin. The spicy kimchi adds a savory kick to everything, especially the vegetables. The potatoes are amazing because they soak up so much flavor. Don't forget to top it with some fresh green onions.
ingredients: Cold water: 1/2 cup, or more if needed
Celery ribs, cut into large pieces: 2
instructions: Put one jar of kimchi into a pot. Place the corned beef on top, then cover it with the second jar of kimchi. Pour in the water. Cover the pot and bring it to a simmer on high heat. Turn the heat down to low. Keep it covered and cook until the beef is very tender, which will take 2 to 3 hours. Every so often, flip the beef over and put the kimchi back on top of it.

Take the corned beef out and put it into a bowl. Bring the kimchi liquid back to a simmer on high heat. Add in the potatoes, carrots, and celery. Cover the pot, turn the heat to medium-low, and cook until the vegetables are almost tender, about 20 to 25 minutes. Reduce the heat to low and put the beef back into the pot. Cover it and cook on low until the meat is hot all the way through, which is about 15 minutes. Taste the liquid and add more water if it needs it.
Cut the corned beef into thin slices. Put it in a bowl with the cooked vegetables, and spoon some of the cooking liquid over everything.
author: Chef John

title: Red, White, and Blue Marshmallow Ice Cream Bowls
description: Celebrate with these festive red, white, and blue dessert bowls. They're a sweet way to enjoy the holiday.
ingredients: Water: 1 tablespoon, or a bit extra if needed
instructions: In a bowl, mix the marshmallow creme with 1 to 2 tablespoons of hot water until it's smooth. Stir in enough food coloring until you get the blue color you want.
Put the ice cream into a big bowl. Use a wooden spoon to make it softer. Mix in the blue marshmallow stuff to make a swirly look. Cover the bowl and put it in the freezer for at least 8 hours.
Split the ice cream among 8 bowls or sundae glasses. Put the strawberries on top.
author: Sammy Mila

title: Roasted Zucchini and Pesto Orzo Pasta
description: I created this recipe after learning about how good orzo is for you. It's a really good and light meal that will make you want more. The best part is it tastes even better as leftovers for lunch.
ingredients: Garlic powder: 1 pinch, or as much as you like
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
Cherry tomatoes: 8, cut in half, or more if you want
instructions: Get the oven hot to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Put the zucchini in a bowl. Add 2 tablespoons of oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix everything until the zucchini pieces are coated. Spread them out on a big baking sheet.
Bake the zucchini in the hot oven for 10 minutes. Flip the pieces over and keep baking for about 10 more minutes until they are soft and a bit brown.

While that's cooking, boil a big pot of water. Add the orzo and vegetable bouillon. Cook until the orzo is soft but still a little firm when you bite it, about 8 minutes. Drain the water and set the orzo aside.

Heat the rest of the olive oil in a large pan. Cook the chopped onion until it starts to turn brown, about 5 minutes. Stir in the pesto sauce. Cut the cooked zucchini rounds into 4 pieces and add them to the pan. Put in the cooked orzo and mix until it soaks up the pesto. Add the cherry tomatoes last; stir for about 30 seconds. Top with Parmesan cheese.
author: Maristela

title: Fried Bread Tacos with Zesty Shredded Beef
description: This recipe puts a different spin on regular tacos. It uses a light, puffy bread that is fried, then filled with creamy refried beans, beef that's been slow-cooked until tender and spicy, and classic toppings like shredded cheese, lettuce, salsa, and sour cream. Most of the time spent cooking is hands-off, thanks to the slow cooker. You can have this meal ready to eat in about 30 minutes once you start frying the bread.
ingredients: Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
Pinto beans, 15-ounce can, rinsed and drained: 1
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
instructions: Put the cubed beef chuck, beef broth, chopped onion, red wine vinegar, 2 tablespoons of chili powder, grated garlic, 2 teaspoons of cumin, salt, and black pepper into a slow cooker and mix them up.

Cook this on High until the beef is soft, which takes about 4 hours. Take the beef out of the slow cooker and put it on a cutting board. Use two forks to pull the beef apart into shreds. Put the shredded beef back into the slow cooker. Keep cooking on High for about 1 hour so the flavors blend well. Pour off any extra liquid.
In a big bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and 1 teaspoon of salt. Pour in the milk and mix until a ball of dough forms.

Sprinkle some flour on a clean surface and knead the dough until it's smooth, about 5 minutes. Let the dough sit for about 5 minutes. Divide it into 4 equal parts and roll each part into a round shape about 1/4-inch thick. Use your finger to poke a hole in the middle of each round.

Heat vegetable oil in a deep-fryer or a big saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). The oil should be about 1 1/2 inches deep. Fry each dough round until both sides are golden brown, about 1 to 2 minutes per side.

Warm up 1/4 cup of olive oil in a small pot. Add the pinto beans, 1 tablespoon of chili powder, 1 teaspoon of cumin, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Stir and mash the beans until they are hot, which takes about 5 minutes.
Put the warm pinto bean mixture and the shredded beef on top of the fried bread.
author: hwiggins

title: Creamy Corn and Pumpkin Soup
description: This easy pumpkin soup can be made ahead. It's great by itself or with grilled salmon and asparagus. Finish it off with nutmeg, cayenne pepper, and toasted coconut.
instructions: Put the creamed corn and onion into a blender. Blend until smooth, then push it through a strainer into a pot. Add the pumpkin, broth, orange juice, cornstarch, coriander, salt, nutmeg, and black pepper. Stir everything together well and bring it to a boil. Keep stirring sometimes for about 5 to 10 minutes. Mix in the heavy cream next; warm it up without letting it boil, which takes about 5 more minutes.
author: CRACKITEEJONES

title: Shrimp and Snap Pea Noodles
description: This is an easy and tasty pasta dish that helps you get some extra veggies, like snap peas, into your meal. If you add some garlic bread, you'll have a nice, light, and fresh dinner for two people.
ingredients: Uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined: 12
instructions: Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Cook the linguine in the boiling water until it's tender but still a little firm, which takes 8 to 10 minutes. Save 2 tablespoons of the water the pasta cooked in, then drain the pasta. Put it aside for now.

Warm up the olive oil and chile oil in a deep, large pan over medium heat. Cook the diced shallot and minced garlic in the hot oil until they are soft and smell good, about 2 to 3 minutes. Add the sugar snap peas and bell pepper; keep cooking until the peas start to get soft, around 5 minutes. Take this mix out of the pan and put it in a bowl.

Pour the wine into the pan and let it cook until it has reduced a bit, for 5 to 7 minutes.
