Mix the saved pasta water and cornstarch in a bowl until the cornstarch is gone, then stir this into the wine with the paprika. Put the vegetables back into the pan and add the shrimp. Cook the shrimp until they turn bright pink on the outside and their meat is no longer see-through, 3 to 4 minutes.
Take the pan off the heat. Stir in the pasta, butter, lemon juice, and basil until everything is covered and the butter has melted. Serve it right away.
author: Shyla Lane

title: Whole Wheat Waffles (No Dairy)
description: These waffles are made without dairy, are good for you, and taste great!
instructions: Put the margarine and oat milk together. Warm them in the microwave for 30 to 60 seconds. Mix until all the margarine melts.
Pour the oat milk mix into a blender. Add in the whole wheat flour, the all-purpose flour, both eggs, the wheat germ, maple syrup, and vanilla. Blend everything until it's mixed well.

Get your waffle iron hot as the maker tells you. Put one-fifth of the batter onto the hot iron. Cook until the waffle turns golden and the iron stops steaming, which takes about 5 minutes. Do this for the rest of the batter.
author: Julie

title: Classic French Croque Madame
description: This recipe shows you how to make a classic French sandwich, often found in bistros. After trying this version, your regular ham and cheese will seem boring. Make sure to use real Gruyere for the best flavor!
ingredients: Salted butter: 4 tablespoons, softened and divided
Ground black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon, or to taste
Fresh dill: 1 teaspoon, chopped, or to taste
instructions: Position an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and turn on your oven's broiler.

Melt 1 1/2 tablespoons of butter in a saucepan on medium-low heat. Whisk in the flour and stir until it turns slightly brown, which takes about 3 minutes. Pour in the milk and bring it to a boil, stirring all the time. Once it boils, quickly lower the heat and let it simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in half of the Gruyere cheese, salt, pepper, and nutmeg; heat for about 2 minutes until the cheese melts. Take it off the heat and set it aside.

Spread about 1 teaspoon of butter onto 2 pieces of bread. Top each with 1 tablespoon of the cheese sauce, then lay a slice of ham on each. Spread 1 teaspoon of butter on the other 2 bread slices, then put Dijon mustard on top and sprinkle with the rest of the Gruyere. Place all 4 bread pieces on a baking sheet.

Broil in the hot oven for 2 to 3 minutes, until the cheese is almost melted. Take them out of the oven, put the toast slices together to make 2 sandwiches, and pour the rest of the cheese sauce over each sandwich. Put them back under the broiler for about 2 minutes, until the sauce starts to brown.

While the sandwiches are broiling, warm the remaining butter in a nonstick skillet on medium-high heat. Carefully crack 2 eggs into the skillet, making sure they don't touch. Season them with salt and pepper. Add the water, cover the skillet, and cook until the whites are firm but the yolks are still runny, about 2 minutes.
Place an egg on top of each sandwich and sprinkle with dill. Serve right away.
author: C R Henning

title: Plant-Based Margherita Pizza with Cauliflower Crust
description: This plant-based pizza offers a lighter meal option, different from typical heavy pizzas. It's a great activity for kids to help prepare, perhaps for a special day like Father's Day.
instructions: Get your oven ready by preheating it to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a big bowl, whisk together the ¼ cup water and flaxseed meal. Let this sit for 5 minutes.

Put a steamer basket into a saucepan and fill with water just up to the bottom of the basket. Bring the water to a boil. Add the cauliflower, put on the lid, and steam until it's very soft, about 3 to 6 minutes. Let it cool down for at least 10 minutes.
In a food processor, grind the oats, rosemary, ½ teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon garlic powder until it looks like flour.

Place the cooled cauliflower into a fine cheesecloth and squeeze out as much water as you can. Put the dried cauliflower into the bowl with the flaxseed-water mix and stir well. Then, mix in the oat mixture. Shape the dough into a ball and put it on the prepared baking sheet.
Press the dough ball down into a circle. Place another sheet of parchment on top and use a rolling pin to flatten the dough to about ¼-inch thick.
Bake the crust in the hot oven until it feels firm, which takes about 15 minutes. Take it out of the oven, but keep the oven on.
Put the cashews in a pot and cover them with water; bring this to a boil. Turn the heat down to medium-low and let them simmer until they're soft, about 15 minutes. Drain the water.

Blend the boiled cashews, 1 ¼ cups fresh water, tapioca starch, nutritional yeast, cider vinegar, ½ teaspoon salt, and ¼ teaspoon garlic powder in a blender until smooth. Pour this mixture into a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly, until it gets thick, about 5 minutes.

Warm the olive oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook the chopped garlic until it smells good, about 2 minutes. Add the crushed tomatoes, balsamic vinegar, maple syrup, 1 teaspoon salt, red pepper flakes, oregano, and black pepper. Let the marinara sauce simmer until the flavors come together, about 10 minutes.

Fill the blender halfway with the marinara sauce. Cover it and hold the lid down with a potholder; pulse a few times before letting it blend continuously. Pour it into a bowl. Do this again for any remaining marinara sauce.
Spread the marinara sauce over the cauliflower crust. Put the 'mozzarella cheese' on top and add the sliced cherry tomatoes.
Bake in the hot oven until the sauce is bubbly and the crust turns golden brown, around 8 minutes. Finish by topping with basil.
author: MyNutriCounter

title: Green Monster Popcorn Treat
description: This marshmallow popcorn is super sticky and gooey, great for Halloween. Just mix in green food coloring and candy eyeballs to make a slime monster snack!
instructions: Put the popcorn into a big bowl.

Warm up brown sugar and butter in a saucepan on medium heat, mixing often, until they melt together. Stir in the marshmallows until they are melted and smooth. Mix in the green food coloring until the color is all over. Pour this mix over the popcorn and stir until every piece is covered. Sprinkle in the candy eyeballs.
author: Ashlee Marie Prisbrey

title: Creamy Lemon Pie
description: This lemon pie is super creamy and makes a perfect sweet treat for a warm day. You can add whipped cream on top.
instructions: In a saucepan, mix the sugar and cornstarch. Add the milk and stir until it's smooth. Cook this mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly, until it gets thick and bubbly, which takes about 10 minutes. Turn down the heat and keep cooking and stirring for another 2 minutes. Take it off the heat.

Take a little bit of the hot mixture and stir it into the egg yolks. Then, pour the egg yolk mixture back into the pan with the rest of the hot filling. Bring it to a light boil, cooking and stirring for 2 minutes. Take it off the heat. Stir in the butter and lemon zest. Gently mix in the lemon juice. Let it cool down to room temperature for about 30 minutes.
In a cold glass or metal bowl, use an electric mixer to beat the cream until it forms soft peaks.
Fold the whipped cream and sour cream into the lemon filling. Pour this into the pie shell you prepared. Put it in the fridge for at least 2 hours before you eat it.
author: Marie Clare

title: Neapolitan Holiday Vegetable Salad
description: This is a classic holiday salad from Naples, Italy, often called Insalata di Rinforzo. It looks great with its bright mix of regular cauliflower, green Romanesco, and dark green broccoli. Olives and red pickled peppers give it extra flavor. It's dressed with a lemon vinaigrette, and sometimes capers and anchovies are added too.
ingredients: Romanesco cauliflower: 1 head, cut into florets
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
Green Italian olives: 10, or more if you like
Black Italian olives: 10, or more if you like
Papaccelle (pickled sweet peppers): 2, sliced into strips
instructions: Get a big pot of lightly salted water boiling. Put the broccoli in and cook it without a lid until it's just soft, about 1 and a half minutes. Take it out with a slotted spoon and put it on a plate to cool, but keep the water in the pot.
Add the regular cauliflower to the boiling water. Cook it until it's just soft, about 3 minutes. Use the slotted spoon to move it to a plate to cool, and again, save the water.
Stir the Romanesco cauliflower into the same boiling water. Let it cook until it's just soft, about 3 minutes. Drain the water and let the Romanesco cool down.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper to make your dressing.

Arrange the cooled broccoli, cauliflower, and Romanesco cauliflower in layers on a round serving plate. Place the green and black olives and the strips of papaccelle on each layer. Pour the dressing over everything.
author: linacavezza

title: No-Bake Graham Cracker Bites
description: These simple snacks are super tasty and disappear quickly! I'll show you two ways to make them: one with sweetened condensed milk and another option if you don't have that. Both versions are really good!
ingredients: Sweetened condensed milk (like Eagle Brand®): 1 (14 ounce) can
Chocolate chips: 18, or more if you want
instructions: Get a bowl and put your crushed graham crackers and melted butter in it. Next, pour in the condensed milk and toss in the walnuts. Stir everything together until it's all mixed well.
Form the mixture into balls that are about the size of a walnut. Put them on a tray. Push one chocolate chip gently into the middle of each ball.
Put the tray in the fridge for about 15 minutes, or until the balls are solid.
author: sweetfanatic

title: Breakfast Oatmeal with Salsa and Veggies
description: Here's a new way to enjoy oatmeal. It's full of good-for-you vegetables, cheese, and salsa, making it really good and good for you. Even if you usually don't like oatmeal, you might want to try this.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste: 1 pinch
instructions: Put 1 cup of water, 1/2 cup of oats, and 1/8 teaspoon of salt into a bowl that can go in the microwave. Cook it on high in the microwave until the oats soak up the water and get soft, which takes about 2 1/2 to 3 minutes.

Warm up a nonstick pan on medium heat. Add the onion, red bell pepper, olives, and black beans. Cook them, mixing sometimes, until they get soft, for about 5 minutes. Put salt and pepper on them. Mix the cooked onion and pepper, salsa, and Cheddar cheese into the warm oatmeal.

Heat up another nonstick pan over medium heat. Cook the egg until it's done how you like it, taking 3 to 5 minutes. Put the fried egg on top of the oatmeal. Finish it off with the diced avocado and a dollop of sour cream.
author: Skye

title: Pasta Salad with Homemade Pesto
description: My daughter, who is 10, and I put together this simple and tasty pasta salad. It has her favorite pesto taste. You can eat this salad as a main dish for a light meal or serve it on the side.
ingredients: Red onion, finely diced: ½ cup
Mayonnaise: 1 tablespoon, or as much as you like
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
instructions: Get a big pot of water boiling, adding a little salt to it. Put the fusilli into the boiling water and stir it sometimes. Let it cook until it's soft but still a little firm when you bite it, which takes about 12 minutes. Then, drain the water out.
Put the basil, Parmesan cheese, pine nuts, oil, and garlic into a food processor. Mix them up until you have pesto.
Throw the pasta with the pesto. Then, mix in the red onion, radicchio, and mayonnaise. Add salt and pepper to taste. Put it in the fridge for at least 30 minutes before you eat it.
author: mpkneip

title: Sweet Hawaiian Bread Breakfast Bake
description: This easy breakfast casserole uses Hawaiian sweet bread. Feel free to change up the fillings; you could swap bacon for sausage, use different kinds of cheese, or even add mushrooms. It's very flexible!
ingredients: Shredded Swiss cheese: ½ cup, split
Shredded Cheddar cheese: ½ cup, split
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
instructions: Get your oven ready by preheating it to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Cut each roll into 8 small cubes. Spread these cubes out on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Place them in the hot oven and bake until they are nicely toasted, which takes about 10 minutes.

Put the toasted bread cubes into a 1 1/2-quart baking pan. Sprinkle 1/4 cup of Swiss cheese, 1/4 cup of Cheddar cheese, half of the bacon, and 2 green onions over the bread. Give the pan a shake to help the toppings settle down into the bread.

In a bowl, mix the eggs, half-and-half, milk, salt, and pepper together. Pour this mixture over the bread cubes, making sure to press the cubes down into the liquid. On top, sprinkle the rest of the Swiss cheese, Cheddar cheese, bacon, green onions, and Parmesan cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes, until the center of the strata is hot.
author: toastyfrenchy

title: Chimney Santa Cupcakes
description: These cute cupcakes show Santa's legs sticking out of a chimney, making them great for any holiday get-together with kids.
instructions: Put a thick layer of white frosting on top of each cupcake. Use a small spatula or the back of a spoon to make it look like snow.
Place the rest of the frosting into a piping bag fitted with a small round tip. On the base of each cupcake, pipe rows of rectangles, making them staggered, to look like bricks.
Make 24 small log shapes from the red fondant for Santa's legs. Take the black fondant and form 24 boots or shoes. Divide the white fondant into 24 small balls and press them flat into circles.
Attach the white fondant circles to the bottom of each red leg using a little water. Stick a black boot onto the end of each red leg, then use a spoon to make indentations for the soles.
Pinch one end of each leg to make it a bit thinner. Push the thin ends of two legs into each cupcake. Do this for all the remaining legs and cupcakes.
author: Magda

title: Grain Bowl with Quail Eggs, Avocado, and Mozzarella
description: This recipe makes a simple lunch or dinner. It has sorghum grains seasoned with Sriracha salt, cumin, avocado oil, and vinegar. Then it's topped with fresh avocado, quail eggs, Kumato® tomato, and buffalo mozzarella cheese.
ingredients: Sriracha salt: 1/2 teaspoon (or to your liking)
instructions: Get a saucepan and put the water and sorghum in it. Bring them to a boil. Turn the heat down to medium-low, put a lid on, and let it cook gently for about 1 hour until the sorghum is soft and all the water is gone.
Put the eggs in a saucepan with water and bring it to a boil for 4 minutes. Take the pan off the heat, cover it, and let the eggs sit for 5 minutes.
In a bowl, mix the cooked sorghum with the Sriracha salt and cumin. Pour 1 tablespoon of avocado oil and the vinegar over this mix and stir it well. Divide this into 2 separate bowls.
Rinse the quail eggs under cold water. Peel them and cut each egg in half. Place these egg halves on top of the sorghum mixture.

Tear the mozzarella cheese into pieces with your hands. Split this cheese between the 2 bowls of sorghum. Rip up the basil leaves and sprinkle them over the mozzarella. Divide the avocado, tomato, and radishes between the bowls.
author: Buckwheat Queen

title: Quick Fruit & Acai Smoothie Bowl
description: This easy acai bowl recipe is a family favorite. You can customize it with whatever fruits, yogurt, or granola you like best.
ingredients: Mango, peeled and chopped: 1/2 (or more if you want)
instructions: Put the banana, almond milk, 3 blackberries, 4 strawberries, ice cubes, coconut yogurt, and acai powder into a blender. Blend until everything is smooth. Pour this mix into a bowl. Then, put mango, granola, coconut, the remaining 3 blackberries, the remaining 4 strawberries, blueberries, almond butter, and honey on top of the bowl.
author: Chef Toronto

title: Quick & Easy Gumbo with Split Peas
description: This recipe began as a way to use up ingredients from the pantry and fridge, and it turned into the easiest (and healthier) gumbo you'll ever make. The split peas, which I didn't care for much before, magically give it the thickness, color, and flavor that usually comes from a roux, cooked peppers and celery, gumbo file powder, and rice — but without needing any of those things. It tastes even better the next day as the peas continue to break down and make the broth thicker.
ingredients: Low-sodium chicken broth (like Swanson® Natural Goodness®): 4 cups
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Warm the oil in a 4-quart Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the onion and a pinch of salt; cook, mixing, until the onion is soft but not brown, about 5 minutes. Turn the heat up to medium-high. Put in the sausage and cook, stirring, until it's browned, which takes 3 to 5 minutes.

Pour in the chicken broth, split peas, and bay leaves into the Dutch oven; bring it to a boil. Turn the heat down to low and let it simmer, with the lid on, until the split peas are soft and start to break apart, 25 to 30 minutes. Mix in the zucchini and simmer until it's tender, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Take out the bay leaves before serving.
author: Nicholio

title: Grilled Nectarine and Ricotta Toast with Honey
description: This creamy, sweet ricotta toast is great for brunch or a light snack. Grilling the fruit gives it a nice caramelized taste. It's finished with sweet honey, crunchy almonds, and a bright touch of fresh mint. Make sure to use a sturdy, thick bread like sourdough so it can hold all the toppings.
ingredients: One large nectarine, pitted and cut into 8 wedges
Honey: 2 teaspoons, or to your liking
instructions: Get your outdoor grill ready for medium-high heat and put a light coat of oil on the grate.
Pour 1 teaspoon of olive oil onto a small plate. Put the nectarine wedges on the plate and make sure all sides are coated with oil. Brush both sides of the bread with the 2 tablespoons of olive oil.

Put the nectarines on the hot grill and cook them for 1 to 2 minutes on each side; then take them off and put them on a plate. Once the nectarine wedges have cooled down a bit, cut each wedge in half lengthwise so you have 16 pieces total.
Place the bread slices on the hot grill and cook until you see grill marks and the bread is toasted, which should be about 1 minute per side; then move them to a plate.

Spread the ricotta cheese onto each piece of toast. Arrange 8 nectarine slices on each toast and sprinkle with almonds. Finish with mint and drizzle honey over the top. Cut each toast in half and serve.
author: France C

title: Creamy Chicken and Leek Fettuccine with Gorgonzola
description: This pasta dish features chicken, leeks, and a rich, creamy Gorgonzola sauce. It tastes great the day you make it and also makes wonderful leftovers. You can leave out the chicken to make it vegetarian, and feel free to use colorful fettuccine if you like.
ingredients: Skinless, boneless chicken breasts (large): 2, cut into bite-sized pieces
Leeks (large): 2, chopped (or more if you want)
Garlic cloves: 2, chopped (or more if you want)
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
instructions: Get a big pot and fill it with water that's lightly salted. Bring it to a rolling boil. Cook the fettuccine in the boiling water until it's soft but still has a little bite, which takes about 8 minutes. Drain the pasta, then mix it with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Keep it warm and set it aside.

In a skillet, heat up the rest of the olive oil and the butter over medium heat. Put the chicken and leeks into the skillet. Cook and stir everything until the leeks are soft, the chicken isn't pink anymore, and its juices run clear, which should be 5 to 7 minutes. Add the garlic and cook it for 1 to 2 minutes until it smells good. Pour in the chicken broth and cook for another 2 to 3 minutes. Then, pour in the heavy cream. Turn down the heat and let it simmer for about 5 minutes, until it gets thick.

Stir the Gorgonzola cheese and walnuts into the skillet with the chicken. Keep simmering for 2 to 3 minutes until the cheese is melted. Add salt and pepper to your liking. Toss this mixture with the cooked pasta. Finish by putting parsley on top.
author: Robin

title: Autumn Salad with Persimmon, Goat Cheese, and Pomegranate
description: This salad is a great mix of tastes and textures. The sweet persimmon goes well with the tangy pomegranate and creamy goat cheese. Add some crunchy almonds, and you've got a perfect fall dish.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste
instructions: Cut the persimmon into 1/4-inch thick rounds, then cut each round into four pieces.
Put the chopped spinach in a salad bowl. Layer the persimmon pieces, pomegranate seeds, goat cheese, and sliced almonds on top.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, orange juice, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper. Pour this dressing over the salad and gently mix. Serve right away.
author: Kim's Cooking Now

title: Creamy Root Vegetable Soup with Bacon Topping
description: I saw a potato and parsnip soup on a restaurant menu and thought that combination would work well together. I brainstormed some ideas and decided to roast the vegetables first, add smoked paprika, and a strong garnish. I'm happy with how it turned out and really like the color!
ingredients: Potatoes: 1 1/2 pounds, peeled and cut into chunks
Parsnips: 1 pound, peeled and cut into chunks
Freshly ground black pepper: to taste
Bacon strips: 4 slices, cooked and crumbled
instructions: Set oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Get a rimmed baking sheet ready by lining it with parchment paper.

Place potatoes, parsnips, onions, and garlic on the prepared baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with paprika, salt, and pepper. Toss everything to coat evenly, then spread back into a single layer.
Bake in the hot oven until the vegetables have browned in spots, which should take around 40 minutes.
Move the roasted vegetables into a big pot. Pour vegetable broth over them. Bring to a simmer; cook until the vegetables are very soft, about 30 minutes. Take the pot off the heat.
Carefully use an immersion blender to puree the hot soup until it's smooth. Mix in the half-and-half until it's fully combined. Add salt to taste.
Serve the soup by ladling it into bowls. Top each bowl with a few dollops of creme fraiche, crumbled bacon pieces, and chopped chives.
author: LauraF

title: Fudgy Brownies with Crackle Tops
description: These brownies are so good, you'll never want store-bought or boxed ones again. They bake up with a lovely, light, crackly top and have a perfect fudgy texture inside.
ingredients: Semisweet chocolate (like Baker's®): 8 (1 ounce) squares, chopped
Unsweetened dark cocoa powder: ½ cup
instructions: Get your oven ready by preheating it to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Use shortening to grease a 9x13-inch baking pan.
Put the chocolate and butter into a big, heavy saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring all the time, until they melt, which takes about 5 minutes. Take the pan off the heat.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa, and salt.

Using an electric mixer, beat the eggs in a large bowl on high speed until they are mixed well. Slowly add the white sugar and brown sugar. Keep beating until the mixture is three times its original size and very pale yellow, which will be at least 10 minutes. When you lift the beaters, the mixture should fall in ribbons. Gently fold in the melted chocolate-butter mix and the vanilla. After that, fold in the flour mix. Pour this batter into your prepared pan.
Bake in the hot oven for 28 to 32 minutes, or until a toothpick put into the middle comes out almost clean. Let the brownies cool down before you cut them into 16 pieces.
author: RainbowJewels

title: Quick Chicken Ramen Bowl
description: This ramen dish is a family hand-me-down, first from my grandpa, then my dad, and now me. It's really good when it's chilly outside.
ingredients: Dried minced onion: 1/8 teaspoon (or to your liking)
Ramen noodles (3 ounce package) with its seasoning packet: 1
instructions: Get a medium saucepan and pour in the water. Put in the chicken, onion, Creole seasoning, and hot sauce. Heat this until it's boiling hard. Then, add the noodles, turn the heat down to medium, and let it cook for 3 minutes.
Take the pan off the heat. Mix in the seasoning packet that came with the noodles and the pepper Jack cheese. Give it a little time to cool down before you eat it.
author: Caitlyn Durham

title: Quick Ratatouille Pizza Bread
description: This easy recipe uses ready-made pizza dough, mozzarella, and fresh basil to make a great meat-free flatbread. It's perfect for using up leftover ratatouille.
ingredients: Spiralized Sheet-Pan Ratatouille (or other prepared ratatouille): 1 and 1/2 cups
Red pepper flakes: 1 pinch, or to your liking
instructions: Get your oven hot to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Lightly oil a baking sheet and then sprinkle cornmeal on it.

On a surface dusted with a little flour, roll out the dough into a rectangle or oval that's about 10x12 inches. Move this dough to the baking sheet you prepared. Brush olive oil over the dough. Put the ratatouille and mozzarella on top.

Cook in the hot oven until the crust turns golden, which takes about 15 minutes. Sprinkle the basil over it. Drizzle with the balsamic glaze and then add the red pepper flakes. Slice it into 8 pieces.
author: Juliana Hale

title: Simple Keto Salad for Warm Weather
description: This is my go-to low-carb salad for lunch during the summer.
ingredients: Cherry tomatoes, cut in half: ¾ cup
instructions: Get a bowl and put in the spring mix, tomatoes, cucumber, salami, onion, and blue cheese. In a separate, small bowl, quickly mix the vinegar and oil. Pour this dressing over your salad, then gently toss everything together.
author: ZOMBYCHIK3

title: Holiday Tree Cupcakes
description: Quickly make festive cupcakes for the holidays! Just pipe green frosting onto your favorite cupcakes to look like a Christmas tree, then add different candies and sprinkles for ornaments.
ingredients: Green food coloring: 2 drops, or more to get the right color
Sprinkles, colored sugar, or small candies: 1/4 cup
instructions: Take 1/2 cup of vanilla frosting and put it in a bowl. Use a knife to put a thin layer on top of each cupcake. Put the cupcakes in the fridge for 30 minutes so they are easier to decorate.

Get the other 2 cups of vanilla frosting and mix it with the green food coloring in a bowl. Keep stirring until all the frosting is green. If you want a darker green, add one more drop of food coloring at a time until you like the color.

Put the green frosting into a piping bag. Hold the bag straight up over each cupcake and pipe the green frosting in a circle around the edge, then keep going inwards to make a tree shape. Do this for all the other cupcakes.
Put sprinkles, colored sugar, or candies on the Christmas trees to make them look like ornaments.
author: Kris

title: Granola Crust Cheesecake for Breakfast
description: This recipe offers a spin on cheesecake that's good for the morning. It uses a granola crust with flax meal and honey instead of sugar, making it a better choice to start your day. You can add fresh berries on top if you like.
ingredients: One large lemon, juiced and zested
instructions: Set your oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Get a 9-inch springform pan ready by greasing it.
Put oats, almonds, coconut, flax meal, ground ginger, and salt into a bowl and mix them up.

In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, lemon zest, the ⅓ cup of honey, egg, and vanilla until everything is fully mixed. Add this wet mix to your oat mixture. Use a wooden spoon or your hands to stir until it's all combined. Press this mix firmly into the bottom and up the sides of the springform pan so the crust is about 1/3-inch thick all around.

Bake in the preheated oven for about 25 minutes, until the edges turn golden brown and the bottom of the crust is firm. Take it out and let it cool completely in the pan for about 1 hour. Use a knife to go around the edges of the pan, then carefully take the crust out of the springform pan.

In a bowl, use an electric mixer to whip the Neufchatel cheese on medium-high speed until it's completely smooth. Add the Greek yogurt, honey, lemon juice, lemon zest, and vanilla extract. Beat on medium-high speed until the mix is smooth and well combined. Taste it and add more honey if you want it sweeter.
Pour this filling into your cooled crust. Put the cheesecake in the fridge for at least 1 hour. Keep it cold until you're ready to serve.
author: Kim

title: Fruity Brunch Pizza with Brie
description: Here is a fruit pizza recipe that looks great and tastes good. You can eat it warm, at room temperature, or a little cold. It's perfect as the main dish for brunch, or you can serve it as an appetizer or side. If you want a grown-up dessert, just add some honey or warm orange marmalade on top. I can't wait to hear what you think of this recipe!
ingredients: Black pepper, freshly ground: ⅓ teaspoon, or to your liking
Brie cheese round (8 ounces), cut into thin slices
One fresh peach, cut into slices
instructions: Warm up your oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly put oil on a pizza stone or baking sheet.
Warm canola oil in a pan over medium heat. Cook the onion in the hot oil until it's soft, about 5 to 7 minutes. Put in the rosemary, pepper, and salt.

Carefully move the cooked onion mix to a blender. Add water, then gently blend it until smooth. Spread this smooth mix over the pizza crust you prepared. Put the Brie cheese, raspberries, and peach slices on top.
Bake in the hot oven until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbling, which takes 6 to 8 minutes. Finish by putting fresh basil on top.
author: Idena Suzanne

title: Simple Spaghetti Cold Salad
description: This pasta salad recipe is super simple and has a country feel to it. It's great served with some good crusty bread.
ingredients: Olive oil: 6 tablespoons (or more if you like)
Anchovy fillets: 2 cans (2 ounces each), chopped
Minced garlic: ¼ teaspoon (or to your liking)
Red pepper flakes: 1 pinch (adjust to taste)
instructions: First, get a big pot of water boiling; add a little salt to it. Cook the spaghetti in the boiling water until it's done but still a bit firm, which takes about 12 minutes. Drain the water, then put the spaghetti in a large bowl.

Pour the olive oil over the spaghetti and toss it so everything is coated. Next, add the chopped anchovy fillets, garlic, balsamic vinegar, lemon juice, red pepper flakes, and black pepper, then mix it all together. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and put it in the fridge until it's cold.
author: Allrecipes Member

title: Dairy-Free Vanilla Cake with Cookie Frosting
description: This is a super sweet cake! It's a classic American-style vanilla cake, very sweet, topped with an amazing cookies-and-cream frosting. You can use store-bought vegan cookies or make your own. Either way, it's a sweet treat you'll love!
ingredients: Vegan butter, cubed, room temp: 1 cup
Soy milk, room temp: 2 1/2 cups, or more as needed
Soy milk: 3 tablespoons, or more as needed
instructions: First, heat your oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Then, grease two 6-inch cake pans and line them with parchment paper.

In a bowl, use an electric mixer on low to beat 1 cup of vegan margarine until it's soft. Gradually add 2 cups of powdered sugar and 2 tablespoons of vanilla paste, mixing on medium-low speed until creamy.
Get another bowl and sift together the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Mix these dry ingredients well.
Pour 2 1/2 cups of soy milk into a separate bowl and stir in the vinegar until it thickens. After that, add the vegetable oil and mix it all together.

Add small amounts of the flour mix and the soy milk mix to the sugar mix, one after the other, beating on low speed until all ingredients are combined. Split the batter evenly between your two prepared cake pans; don't fill them more than 3/4 full.
Put the pans in the preheated oven and bake for 80 to 90 minutes, or until a toothpick put into the middle comes out clean.
Take the cakes out of the oven and let them cool down completely, which takes about 30 minutes.

For the frosting, put shortening and vegan butter into a stand mixer bowl. Use a paddle attachment and mix on medium-low speed until fluffy. Add the vanilla paste and mix it in. Slowly add powdered sugar and soy milk until the frosting is the thickness you want. Then, slowly add the cookie crumbs and mix until they are combined. Put the frosting into a piping bag.
Put one cooled cake layer on a plate and spread frosting on the top and sides. Place the other cake layer on top and cover the whole cake completely with frosting.
author: Sara Kidd

title: Creamy Vegan Mac and 'Cheese' with Veggies
description: Get ready for a super tasty mac and cheese that's totally plant-based. It's made without any oil and uses simple things you probably have, all done in about 15 minutes. Even picky eaters and meat-lovers will enjoy this one!
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the macaroni and cook, stirring now and then, until it's tender but still a bit firm, which takes about 8 minutes. Drain the pasta once it's done.

Put the potatoes in a big pot and cover them with salted water, then bring it to a boil. Turn the heat down to medium-low and let them simmer until they're soft, around 20 minutes. Drain the water. Once the potatoes are cool enough to handle, peel and chop them into small pieces.

Combine the cooked potatoes, onion, carrot, and garlic in a small pot over medium heat. Pour in 2 tablespoons of water and cook until the vegetables are soft enough to blend and most of the water has evaporated, about 3 minutes. Take the pot off the heat. Move the cooked vegetables to a blender. Add the 3/4 cup water, cashews, soy milk, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, salt, paprika, and cayenne pepper. Put the lid on the blender, holding it down with a potholder, then pulse a few times before blending until everything is smooth.

Heat 2 tablespoons of water in a nonstick pan over medium heat. Add the broccoli and cook until it's soft but still has a slight crunch, about 5 minutes. Transfer the broccoli to a large serving bowl. Pour the sauce over the broccoli and mix well until everything is fully coated.
author: nutriciously

title: Easy Smoked Pulled Pork
description: I've used this cooking method for many years, and it always makes perfect pulled pork. You'll get meat that is soft, moist, and falls apart easily. This approach works just as well for smaller or larger cuts of pork. The most important thing is the meat's final temperature inside. Smoking meat takes a whole day, but it's really worth the time spent! I like to use different kinds of wood chips, like maple, apple, and bourbon barrel. Eat it with your favorite sauce.
instructions: Make several cuts in a crisscross shape on the pork butt's fatty side. Spread mustard over the top. Rub the BBQ seasoning into the meat, making sure it gets into the cuts. Cover it with plastic wrap and put it in the fridge for 8 hours or overnight.
Warm up a smoker to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Put in wood chips as the maker suggests.

Put the pork butt on a rack with a pan underneath to catch drips. Smoke it until the meat's inside temperature reaches 200 to 203 degrees F (93 to 95 degrees C); this will take 10 to 16 hours, depending on how big the pork butt is and the temperature outside.
Take the pork butt out of the smoker, wrap it in foil, and let it sit for 1 hour. Pull out the bone and shred the pork.
author: France C

title: Flatbread with Pesto, Chicken, and Salad Topping
description: My 10-year-old daughter created this recipe. It's like a salad on a pizza, which she calls a 'Saladizza,' based on a flatbread sandwich she loves. This meal is tasty, good for you, and very fresh. It works well for either lunch or dinner.
ingredients: Olive oil: 1 tablespoon, or as much as you need
Grilled chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces: 10 ounces
instructions: Get an outdoor grill ready for medium heat, and put a little oil on the grate.
Brush olive oil on one side of each flatbread. Turn them over and put 1 tablespoon of spinach pesto and 1/4 cup of mozzarella cheese on each.

Put the flatbreads on the grill with the oiled side down. Cook them until the cheese melts, which takes about 2 to 3 minutes. Move the flatbreads to a plate that can handle heat. On top of each, put 1 cup of romaine lettuce, 2 1/2 ounces of grilled chicken, 1/4 of the chopped tomatoes, and 1 teaspoon of Parmesan cheese.
author: innermuse

title: Big Stuffed Italian Bread Loaf
description: This recipe makes a savory stuffed bread that tastes just like the one from Zenari's restaurant. It's a full meal inside a loaf of bread.
ingredients: Frozen bread dough: 1 (1 pound) loaf, thawed
Olive oil: 1 tablespoon, or as you like
instructions: Put the dough into a big bowl. Cover it with plastic wrap and let it sit in a warm spot until it's twice its size, which takes 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Roll out the dough into a 17x20-inch rectangle, about 1/4-inch thick, on a large piece of parchment paper. Brush olive oil over the dough. Sprinkle the basil and oregano on top. Layer the mortadella, then provolone cheese, capicola ham, Genoa salami, tomatoes, and mushrooms over the dough.

Roll the dough up lengthwise into a log shape. Brush the top of the log with the beaten egg. Sprinkle sesame seeds on it. Move the log to a baking sheet. Cover it with plastic wrap and let it rise until it looks puffy, about 30 minutes.
Get the oven hot to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
Bake the bread in the hot oven until it's golden brown, which should take about 45 minutes. Let it cool for 5 minutes before you cut it.
author: davey

title: Colorful Couscous Salad with Kale and Feta
description: This bright and fun salad, packed with good-for-you ingredients and no extra oils or sugar, is a favorite in our home. It's great for making ahead, as it stays fresh for several days, making it perfect for lunches throughout the week.
instructions: Take the kale leaves off their stems. Chop the leaves very fine. In a big bowl, rub the kale with oil for about 30 seconds until it turns dark green and smells nice. Toss in the diced cherry tomatoes and some kosher salt. Then, add the feta cheese, cranberries, couscous, pumpkin seeds, and sunflower seeds.
Pour the lemon juice over everything and mix it all together until well combined.
author: sissyneck

title: Stuffed Peppers with Ratatouille and Cheese
description: Ever thought about putting bell peppers inside other bell peppers? Well, this recipe does just that! We take our favorite Ratatouille dish and use it to fill bell peppers, baking them twice and topping with Italian cheeses. It's a great meat-free dinner for any night of the week.
ingredients: Red bell pepper: 1, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
Salt and cracked black pepper: to taste
Large red bell peppers: 2, cut in half lengthwise and seeds removed
Shredded Italian cheese blend: 1 cup, split
instructions: Get a big pot and pour in the olive oil. Put it over high heat. Add the chopped onion and garlic, then cook for 2 minutes. Turn the heat down. Add the tomatoes, eggplant, zucchini, bell pepper, tomato sauce, herbes de Provence, salt, and pepper. Mix in the wine, then put a lid on and let it simmer for 10 minutes. Take the lid off and keep simmering until the vegetables are just soft, which will take 12 to 15 minutes. Keep the ratatouille warm in the pot until you're ready for it.
Heat your oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Place the cut pepper halves into a 2-quart baking dish with the cut sides facing down.
Put them in the hot oven and bake for 10 minutes.

Flip the peppers over so the cut sides are up. Take 2 cups of the ratatouille and mix it with 1/2 cup of the Italian cheese blend. Spoon this mixture into the pepper halves. Cover the dish loosely with foil and bake until the peppers are soft and the filling is hot all the way through, about 25 minutes.

Take the foil off the peppers. Sprinkle the rest of the cheese on top. Keep baking until the cheese melts, which should be about 5 more minutes. Put parsley on top for decoration and add a pinch of black pepper.
author: Juliana Hale

title: Orecchiette Pasta with Turkey Meatballs and Spinach
description: This recipe for orecchiette, spinach, and meatballs came about by combining two separate recipes into one delicious meal.
ingredients: Sweet Italian turkey sausage (casings removed): 12 ounces
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
Grated ricotta salata cheese: ½ cup
instructions: Get a large pot of lightly salted water boiling on high heat. Add the orecchiette and bring it back to a boil. Cook uncovered, mixing now and then, until the pasta is tender but still a bit firm, which takes around 12 minutes.
Put the spinach into a big colander. Take out 1 cup of the pasta cooking water and set it aside. Drain the pasta in the colander, letting the hot pasta wilt the spinach.
Roll the turkey sausage meat into 20 to 30 small balls.

Warm 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat. Add the meatballs and cook them, turning now and then, until they are browned and no longer pink inside, about 5 to 6 minutes. Place them on paper towels to drain.

Pour out any leftover drippings from the skillet. Heat 3 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Stir in the garlic, salt, and red pepper flakes until you can smell them, for about 1 minute. Put the cooked pasta, spinach, and meatballs into the skillet.
In a small bowl, whisk together the reserved pasta water and the egg. Stir this mixture into the skillet until the sauce gets a bit thicker, taking 3 to 4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Divide the pasta into separate bowls. Sprinkle with the ricotta salata cheese and drizzle with the last 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
author: Stephen Simons

title: Vegan Tempeh Breakfast Patties
description: Here's a simple, plant-based swap for breakfast sausage that has no cholesterol. You can make these ahead of time to have a fast meal during the week.
ingredients: Garlic: 3 cloves, crushed (or more if you like)
Olive oil: 1/2 teaspoon, or as much as you need
instructions: Put the grated tempeh, tamari, crushed garlic, dried sage, smoked paprika, black pepper, and red pepper flakes into a saucepan. Cook this mixture gently, stirring often, until all the liquid is gone. This takes about 7 minutes.
Mix the flour into the tempeh mixture. Let it sit in the pan to cool down for about 15 minutes, until it's not too hot to touch. Then, form the mixture into patties that are about 2 inches wide.

Warm up a skillet on medium heat and add a little olive oil to coat the bottom. Cook the patties until they are nicely browned, about 3 minutes on each side. After cooking, put them on paper towels to soak up extra oil.
author: WellRed

title: Pork Chops with Apple and Bell Pepper Gravy
description: This recipe features marinated pork chops pan-fried with a mix of apples, different colored bell peppers, and onions. It's all brought together with a warm, comforting gravy, perfect for a cool evening.
ingredients: Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
Large apple, peeled, cored, and cubed: 1
instructions: In a bowl, combine the apple cider, olive oil, Dijon mustard, vinegar, rosemary, paprika, salt, and pepper. Trim any excess fat from the pork chops, then put them into this mixture. Place in the fridge for 30 minutes.
Take the pork chops out of the marinade. Keep the marinade for later.
Warm a nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Cook the pork chops in the hot pan until they are browned, about 5 minutes on each side.
While the pork chops are cooking, put the cubed apple, sliced bell peppers, and sliced onion into the reserved marinade for 10 minutes.

Add the marinated apple to the pork chops in the pan; cook until it turns brown, which should take 3 to 5 minutes. Pour the remaining marinade, peppers, and onion into the pan and let it simmer without a lid for 20 minutes. Remove the pork chops, apples, and peppers from the pan and arrange them on a serving dish.
Mix the flour and milk into the liquid left in the pan; let it simmer until it thickens, about 2 to 3 minutes. Drizzle this gravy over the pork chops.
author: Haley James

title: Layered Coffee Caramel Ice Pops
description: These ice pops feature layers of coffee, sweet milk, and caramel, making them a cool and tasty snack.
ingredients: Cold brew coffee concentrate (for 1:1 mixing): 1/2 cup
Chocolate-covered espresso beans, chopped roughly: 2 tablespoons
instructions: For the milk layer, get a large measuring cup with a spout. Whisk the 1/2 cup milk, 1/4 cup sweetened condensed milk, and vanilla together until they're mixed well. Divide this mixture evenly among 6 (3-ounce) ice pop molds. Put them in the freezer for about 2 hours, until they're firm but not completely frozen. This is when you put the sticks in. Set a timer and check often; if they freeze solid, the sticks won't go in and your layers might split apart.

To make the coffee layer, use a large measuring cup with a spout. Whisk the coffee concentrate, 6 tablespoons milk, and 2 tablespoons sweetened condensed milk until they're fully combined. Pour this mixture over the milk layer in each mold, splitting it evenly. Freeze for about 2 hours, until this layer is also firm but not totally frozen.

For the caramel layer, put 1 tablespoon of caramel sauce on top of the coffee layer in each mold. Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of espresso beans over the caramel in each one. Freeze until everything is solid; this will take at least 8 hours and they can be stored for up to 2 weeks.
author: SandyG

title: Rich Seafood Pasta with Clam Sauce
description: This seafood pasta recipe is sure to impress your dinner guests. While the ingredients are a bit expensive, the delicious outcome is definitely worth it. If you happen to have any leftovers, simply mix the pasta with the sauce and store it in the fridge; the linguine will soak up the flavors and taste even better the next day.
ingredients: Artichoke hearts: 1 (14 ounce) can, drained and chopped
All-purpose flour: 1 teaspoon, or as needed
instructions: First, melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a pot over medium-high heat. Add the scallops and shrimp to the hot butter. Cook them until the shrimp turn pink, which takes about 5 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes, artichoke hearts, mushrooms, and pesto with the shrimp. Continue cooking until everything is heated through, about 5 minutes.

Next, pour in the clam juice, whipping cream, Romano cheese, white wine, garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, and the linguine with the shrimp mixture. Roll the rest of the butter in flour, then add it to the pot and mix well. Bring the pot to a boil, then turn the heat down to medium-low. Let it simmer for about 10 minutes until it's hot all the way through and the flavors have blended.

While the sauce simmers, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook the linguine in the boiling water until it's tender but still firm to chew, about 11 minutes. Drain the pasta. Serve by ladling the pasta into bowls and spooning the shrimp mixture over the top.
author: GCROUTHAMEL

title: Air-Fried Okra with Chili-Lime Spice
description: Making okra in an air fryer is easy and tastes great. Using Tajin spice gives it a special zesty and hot flavor.
instructions: Get your air fryer ready by setting it to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Take a bag that seals and put the whole okra inside. Add the oil, chili-lime seasoning, and salt. Close the bag and shake it well until the okra is covered all over with the oil and spices. Let it sit for a few minutes while the air fryer heats up.
Empty the bag's contents into the air fryer basket. Cook this for 6 minutes. Give the basket a shake, then cook the okra until it's crunchy on the outside, which takes about 6 more minutes.
author: Buckwheat Queen

title: Pizza-Stuffed Dinner Rolls
description: These rolls are stuffed with all your favorite pizza fillings. They are simple to make and taste great.
ingredients: Frozen yeast dinner rolls (whole, like Rhodes®): 16
instructions: Get a baking sheet ready by spraying it with cooking spray. Put the frozen rolls on top to thaw out. Cover them with plastic wrap or a cloth and let them thaw and get bigger for 3 to 5 hours.
Heat your oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Take the cover off the rolls.
Cook the rolls in the hot oven until they turn golden brown, about 15 minutes. Move them to a plate.

Put olive oil in a big pan and heat it over medium-high heat. Add the diced onion and cook it until it smells good, for about 2 minutes. Then add the sausage. Cook it, breaking it up as you stir, until it's browned, which takes 5 to 7 minutes. Mix in 1/2 cup of the marinara sauce, 1/2 teaspoon of the garlic powder, the onion powder, Italian seasoning, and red pepper flakes. Cook until it's hot all the way through, about 4 minutes. Move this mix to a bowl.
Pour the rest of the marinara sauce into a bowl that can go in the microwave. Heat it in the microwave until it's hot, about 1 minute.

In another microwave-safe bowl, mix the other 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder, ricotta cheese, 3/4 cup of mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, the eggs, salt, and pepper. Microwave it on high for 2 minutes and then stir it. Keep microwaving until it's fully heated through, about 2 more minutes. Stir in the parsley.
Cut the rolls in half and put them on a plate. Serve them with the bowls of sausage mix, marinara sauce, cheese mix, and pepperoni. You build them however you like.
author: Culinary Envy

title: Crispy Egg Rolls with Bacon, Jalapenos, and Cheese
description: Joanie Simon created this recipe for egg rolls filled with bacon, two kinds of cheese, and jalapenos. They are fried until they turn perfectly golden brown.
ingredients: Diced jalapeno peppers: 1/4 cup, drained well
Bacon: 1 pound, chopped and fried until crisp
instructions: In a bowl, mix the mozzarella cheese, Shamrock Farms Cottage Cheese, jalapenos, bacon, and garlic powder until everything is well combined.

Put about 1 1/2 to 2 tablespoons of the cheese mixture in the center of an egg roll wrapper. Fold the bottom quarter of the wrapper up over the filling, then fold in the sides, and roll it up. Moisten the inside edge to make it stick shut. Do this for all the remaining cheese mixture and wrappers.

Warm the oil to 365 degrees F (185 degrees C) in a big pot. You need enough oil so that an egg roll will be covered at least three-quarters of the way when you put it in. Once the oil is hot, add 2 or 3 egg rolls at a time, turning them often so they brown evenly. Fry them until they are a deep golden brown. Take them out as soon as you hear a louder frying sound, which means the oil has reached the cheese. Serve them hot.
author: Shamrock Farms

title: Creamy Seafood and Sweet Potato Soup
description: This chowder is packed with vegetables and has a rich, smooth texture. It's a healthier option because it skips heavy cream and uses sweet potatoes for creaminess.
ingredients: 1 sweet potato, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes
1/2 pound tilapia fillets, cut into chunks
Salt and ground black pepper: 1 pinch, to taste
instructions: Over medium heat, melt the butter in a large pot. Add the onion, peppers, garlic, herbes de Provence, and cayenne pepper. Cook until the onion is soft and clear, about 5 minutes. Stir in the sweet potato and corn; cook for 2 more minutes.
Pour in the chicken broth and milk. Bring this to a boil on high heat, then turn the heat down to low. Cover the pot and let it simmer for 15 minutes.

Use an immersion blender to partially blend the chowder. Add the scallops and tilapia. Keep cooking on low heat until the seafood is done, which takes about 7 to 10 minutes. Taste the soup and add more seasoning if needed.
author: Diana71

title: One-Pan Chicken, Chorizo & Seafood Rice
description: This hearty rice dish, loaded with chicken, chorizo, and seafood, is perfect by itself. You can also serve it with steamed clams. Don't forget a glass of red wine. The rice needs 15 to 25 minutes to cook until done.
ingredients: Medium zucchini: 1, cut into quarters, then 1/4-inch slices
Garlic: 2 cloves, chopped fine, or more if you like
Water: 1 cup, or as much as needed
Salt and ground black pepper: to taste
Red bell pepper: 1/2, cut into small cubes
Green bell pepper: 1/2, cut into small cubes
Small yellow onion: 1, cut into 1-inch pieces
Medium tomato: 1, cut into small cubes
instructions: Get a large saucepan hot with oil over medium heat. Put in the zucchini and cook it until it's a little brown, about 2 minutes. Add the shallot and cook until it starts to brown, about 2 minutes. Then add the garlic and cook until it's just barely brown, about 1 minute. Toss in the rice and cook it for about 1 minute. Add the canned tomatoes, stir well, and cook for 1 minute. Now, put in the water, chili powder, cumin, saffron, salt, and black pepper. Stir everything up. Add the bay leaf. Cover the saucepan and cook until the rice is soft, which takes 20 to 25 minutes.
Stir a quarter of the can of peas into the cooked rice. Cover the saucepan partly so steam can get out, then set it aside.

Heat the other 2 tablespoons of oil in a big paella pan over medium heat. Add the chorizo; cook and stir until it's brown, 5 to 7 minutes. Move the cooked chorizo to the edge of the pan. Put in the chicken and cook until it's mostly done, 8 to 10 minutes. While the chicken cooks, add the bell peppers, serrano peppers, onion, and diced tomato. Move the cooked chicken to the edge of the pan too.
Add the shrimp to the paella pan. If the pan seems dry, add a little water. Cook the shrimp for 2 minutes on each side. Then add the scallops and cook for 2 more minutes.

Turn down the heat under the paella pan to medium-low. Mix everything in the pan together. Put the cooked rice in a layer on top of the mixture in the paella pan. Keep cooking for 2 to 4 more minutes, until all the meat, chicken, and seafood are fully cooked. Add the avocado and cilantro, mix it all up, and serve.
author: Daniel Sarfati

title: Warm Bean Dip with Mango and Cream Cheese
description: This warm dip brings together refried beans, smooth cream cheese, and a mix of Jack and Cheddar cheeses. It gets a special twist from mango-pineapple salsa and a hint of mild spices, making it a delicious and memorable snack.
ingredients: Mango-pineapple salsa (like Trader Joe's® Island Salsa): ½ cup
instructions: Get your oven ready by heating it to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

In a bowl, mix the cream cheese, sour cream, the 1 tablespoon and 1 teaspoon of taco seasoning, onion powder, and hot pepper sauce. Stir in all but 1 tablespoon of the chopped green onions. Then, add the refried beans, half a cup of Cheddar cheese, half a cup of Jack cheese, the salsa, and the apricot jam. Pour this mixture into an 8x12-inch baking dish. Put the rest of the Cheddar and Jack cheeses on top.

Bake in the hot oven until the dip is bubbly and the cheese on top turns a bit brown, which should take 20 to 30 minutes. Sprinkle the remaining green onions on top and serve it with warm tortilla chips.
author: Culinary Envy

title: DIY Seafood Broth
description: Make your own seafood broth at home. It's great for seafood soups, paella, and other dishes.
ingredients: Large green bell peppers, chopped roughly: 2
Fish parts (like bones, spine, tail): ½ pound
instructions: Warm up the olive oil in a big stockpot on medium-high heat. Cook the onions in the hot oil for 5 minutes, stirring them. Then, add the celery, carrots, and bell peppers and cook for another 5 minutes. Mix in the cilantro, oregano, and bay leaves and cook for 2 more minutes. After that, put in the water, fish parts, fish heads, clam juice, and peppercorns.
Get the mixture boiling, then turn the heat down low. Let it gently cook without a lid for at least 4 hours. Take it off the heat and let it cool down for about 30 minutes.

Scoop out the big pieces from the broth with a skimmer or a spoon with holes. Pour the broth through a fine-mesh strainer into a big container, making sure to get rid of all the fish bones. Use it right away or put it in the freezer for later.
author: Sophia Del Carmen

title: Turkey and Veggie Party Sandwiches
description: These simple finger sandwiches are great for parties. They have turkey, artichoke, red pepper, and spinach. Make them the day before your event for easy serving.
ingredients: Thinly sliced cooked deli turkey: 4 ounces
Baby spinach leaves: 1 cup (or as much as you like)
Artichoke hearts, drained and chopped: 1/2 cup
instructions: First, get a small bowl and mix the cream cheese, garlic, and Italian seasoning together. Put it aside.

Next, use a serrated knife to cut off the top third of the baguette. Take out some of the bread from the bottom part, leaving about a 1/2-inch thick shell. Spread the cream cheese mix all over the inside of both baguette pieces.

Put layers of turkey, spinach, red pepper, and artichokes onto the bottom part of the baguette, then place the top part back on. Wrap the whole thing tightly in foil. Put it in the fridge for at least 2 hours, or leave it there overnight.
When you're ready to eat, unwrap the baguette. Cut it diagonally into pieces that are 1 to 2 inches thick. Stick a toothpick into each piece to hold it together.
author: Nikki

title: Dairy-Free Blueberry Hotcakes
description: This easy recipe makes great pancakes for people who don't eat animal products. It uses common things like flour and soy milk. You can leave out the blueberries and put in other fruits or nuts if you want.
instructions: Get your skillet or griddle hot over medium heat.
In a big bowl, put the flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt. Mix them up well. Then, pour in the soy milk and oil. Use a whisk to beat it until the batter is smooth. Gently stir in the blueberries.

Pour ¼ cup of batter onto the hot pan. After 3 to 4 minutes, when you see bubbles on top, flip the pancake over. Keep cooking it until it's golden brown, which will take 2 to 3 more minutes. Do this for all the rest of the batter.
author: VALERIEE19
